story:
I was scared of my house. This all started because I was scared of my house. And this is not hype or hyperbole. My house scared me.

For real.

Before we moved in, I would go there at night after rehearsal to apply paint samples to various walls and in my brain I was always thinking “cool, I can put the samples up and then go to my new man-cave and play guitar for a while before I have to head back” and then I’d get there and start painting and invariably I would get creeped out and then the noises would start and then the imagination would run wild and suddenly there was a dude in the house watching me. 

This went on for weeks. Then we moved in.

And my wife, who had made so much fun of me…this big fat man being scared of a little house, came to me and said “man this house is creepy. I’m scared honey”.  Because she’d never been there at night.

And that is the truth. My house is creepy as hell at night.

And that is where this all started.

This sprouted from my saying, “since my house is so creepy at night, why not shoot a horror movie there”.

True Story.

And then I locked my keys in the house and had to crawl through a window and fell and hurt myself and so I went to Home Depot and bought one of those faux rock hide-a-key things so that I wouldn’t have to crawl through a window and fall and hurt myself and while I was looking for a place to hide it, I suddenly had a flash of someone watching me hide it and then…well then the imagination runs wild again and here we are.

There we were. Because I had a premise and a damn good one but I didn’t have a script. So I did what every industrious producer/director does when faced with a lack of material.  I put it out there on the web.  First through a message board with the remnants of Movie Poet: “hey, I have this idea about a dude that opens a hide-a-key thingy and instead of a key finds a memory stick with a bunch of videos on it that show an unknown intruder seriously f***ing with his family so write me a video” thinking well this will be fun and what could possibly go wrong.

And then the scripts started coming in…

I may have said too much already...


Here's what the movie's about:

A dude comes home from work. It’s late…raining. He’s in a terrible mood.  He rushes to get the groceries out and locks his keys in the car. He’s f***ed. His wife and the kids are at her parents’.  What to do? What to do?  SALVATION…he remembers that he’d bought one of those little hide-a-key thingy that looks like a rock and you stick your key in it and put it in the garden or something for just such an emergency.  So he looks for the faux rock—not an easy thing to do in the middle of the night with no flashlight. He finds it. Sighs of relief.  He opens the rock to find…

No key.

In its place, a small flash drive.

He breaks a window. Gets in his house. Fires up the computer and inserts the drive.

There are a series of media files. As he plays each one, to his horror, he realizes that they are of him and his family, and they are shot inside his house (using the hide-a-key for access one would presume) by an unknown intruder.  Some are during the day, some are at night, some while they are sleeping. As the video clips progress, he realizes that the intruder has begun to ACTIVELY participate in his life.

So these scripts...and I am a horror FAN. I grew up...let me tell you...my MOTHER took me to see Friday the 13th Part 3 while we were on vacation at a place called Crystal Lake (this is 100% true...as much as anything in a 10 year old's memory can be)...I saw TX Chainsaw at a Drive-In that same summer.  I grew up in the age of the VHS...and pre-Blockbuster Video and every weekend my allowance was spent on renting horror movies.  Pieces, The Dorm that Dripped Blood, Dario Argento, Lucio Fulci, et al.... I tell you that to make you understand that I am not a newbie and/or easily shocked.  I saw Halloween before I saw The Apple Dumpling Gang.  I know  horror.

The scripts. They started coming in.  And I started reading and quickly realized that I may have gotten myself into something that I can't get out of. Because these scripts are the most f***ed up things I've ever read (pardon my francais).  And now I have to make them.  I have to cast people and do the things to them that are in these scripts.

I have to figure out ways to do the things to these poor people that these sickos want me to do...

and that costs money.  The amount is negotiable but I always felt that Bowfinger was onto something when he said that all movies, cash in, cost $2,184.  So that's what I'm asking for...if it's good enough for Chubby Rain, it's good enough for Hide-A-Key.

So here we are (face to face, a couple of silver spoons?).  I'm going to make this movie....Wanna help?

At this point (and we're going to be adding more perks as we go), we are looking for peeps who want to see Hide-A-Key and are willing to put their money where their (sick) mouths is and commit to watching in advance.  And we're looking to make that as painless (read: Cheap) as possible. For a measly 10 bucks you can watch the movie...that's only slightly worse than On Demand but slightly better (or on par, depending on your location) than seeing at your local multi-plex.  And you can always combine your money with 5 or so of your friends and host a party...I mean, yes, that's like taking food right out of my beautiful children's mouths when you do that, but hey, ART exists to be shared.  

So please consider Pre-purchasing a download or dvd today.  And we are committed to giving you the absolute most bang for your buck so everyone who gives ANYTHING will receive access to a multitude of kick ass behind the scenes stuff.

And remember....a friend of Quite is a friend alright.

story:
Short Summary

THE CREEPS is a traditional horror short film set on Halloween, filmed on beautiful Super-16mm film.

Denny is ready to meet someone new after a tough break-up, and is going on a first date on Halloween night. The mystery girl is named Lyla, whom he met online. Once he gets to her house, however, he realizes he's in for a bit more than he bargained for.  

This is a horror short film made by horror fans for horror fans- filled to the brim with practical fx, prosthetics, and a ton of Halloween spirit!

What We Need & What You Get

As huge fans of Halloween-themed horror, we understand that nailing the atmosphere of the holiday is crucial. Therefor, there is an abundance of decorations and fx that need to be purchased and designed, and they have to be just perfect.

Filming on film isn't cheap, but it's worth it! Your wonderful contributions will go towards the 16mm film and development!

Basic equipment, location, and food for the hungry cast and crew! 

Your contributions to this project will be acknowledged with some of our cool perks! Check them out!

The Impact

We simply want to bring horror fans a gorgeous Halloween-themed horror story with memorable characters, an eerily traditional story, and quality creeps. We want to deliver something true horror fans can rejoice in! 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some can't contribute financially, and that's completely fine! If you could still share this page and tell everyone, we could be... like, best friends still.

story:
What is The Value of Ex?

Four ex couples. One goal. To find The Value of Ex. What happens when a relationship ends, but your heart refuses to let go? The Value of Ex is a romantic comedy series following the misadventures of a group of college friends as they struggle to navigate the murky waters between breaking up and moving on. When the curve balls of life cause them to cross paths with men from their past, they must determine whether to give love a second chance or close the door forever.

At its core, The Value of Ex is about determining  who to add, who to keep, and who to subtract from the equation of your life.  In season 2, the ladies must come to terms with the past and decide if these men can add any value to their future. Through their sisterhood, laughter, and Angela’s unique brand of therapy, the ladies discover that The Value of Ex is not only about determining the value of past love, but ultimately about the value of the love they have for each other and themselves. 

What Did We Accomplish Season One?

Season one of The Value of Ex launched on Youtube in May of 2014.  Since that time, the show has been in multiple festivals including the American Black Film Festival, the Raindance Web Fest and the HollyWeb Festival.  Most recently, the show was picked up for distribution by the new online streaming service KweliTV.  I am very grateful for all that we were able to accomplish with season one and even more excited about what lies ahead in season two!

Why Do We Need Your Help?

It doesn't take a mathematician to know that producing a quality show takes money. Season one was a labor of love that I funded entirely on my own.  I want to make season two even better and to do that, I need your help.  A donation from you, no matter how large or small, would help me to continue to produce this show. Here is a breakdown of how the money will be spent:

What Are The Perks?

In exchange for your support, you'll get my eternal gratitude and some really cool perks! Perks include exclusive access to watch season two before its release, autographed cast photos, a limited edition "The Value of Ex" T-Shirt, a speaking role on the show, producer credit and original commissioned artwork from talented artist @WhereUatro.  Check out his work here: http://borrowthisart.tumblr.com 

What Are Other Ways You Can Help?

I'm glad you asked! There are many ways you can help support season two of The Value of Ex!
  • Spread the word! Tell a friend to tell a friend about our campaign! Tweet about it, share it on Facebook, Instagram, Snap Chat, Periscope and whatever other social media platform you use.  Let others know that this awesome show needs support!
  • Follow Us On Social Media! @TheValueofex on Instagram, Twitter & Facebook!
  • Donate a service! Do you have crew experience or can do catering, hair, wardrobe, set decorating or just want to lend a helping hand? Let us know!
  • Watch the show!  If you haven't watched season one, check it out now! 

What Else Can You Tell Me About The Show?

Meet The Exes

Brynne and Christopher 

Brynne is the lovable math teacher and  hopeless romantic who desperately wants to believe in fairy tales and the “happily ever after” despite being left at the altar by her ex, Christopher.  When Christopher pops back into her life just months before she is about to marry her new beau Michael, old feelings are sparked and Brynne finds herself wondering whether Michael is her Prince Charming after all.  
Jessica and Antonio
Jessica is the sassy, self-centered physical  therapist who wants to start a practice out of her home, that is if she actually had a home.  When she finds herself evicted and out of options, she moves in with her smooth talking, womanizing ex Antonio who is a player on and off the basketball court.  Will she be able to resist his charm the second time around?    

Tyler and Terry

Tyler, the no nonsense, corporate diva was always used to getting her way, until she lost her promotion to Terry, the only man who ever broke her heart.  Can the dynamic duo put their differences aside for the sake of the company? Or will old feelings cause this power ex couple to go to war at the office?

Angela and Nathaniel
Angela is a bossy relationship therapist with a love/hate relationship with food and her ex husband Nathaniel.  Since she was always trying to fix him when they were married, it's only fitting that Nathaniel would turn to her for relationship advice for his soon to be new wife, the annoyingly bubbly Bianca.  Right? Wrong!!! 
Meet The Creator

Hey everybody!!! My name is Bridgett Michele Lawrence and I'm an aspiring television writer who is working hard to turn my Hollywood dreams into a reality.  I am originally from New York, where I earned my Bachelor of Fine Arts degree in Film &TV Production and Dramatic Writing at New York University's prestigious Tisch School of the Arts.  My original pilot, The Value of Ex, won first place in the Organization of Black Screenwriters’ Original Script Competition and garnered the attention of executives at the CW as well as Overbrook Entertainment.  In 2012, rather than waiting for Hollywood to greenlight my project, I decided to greenlight myself and produce the show on my own as a web series.
Meet The Team
Bridgett Michele Lawrence - Executive Producer/Creator/Writer/Director
Porscha Richards - Producer
Julienne Irons - Producer/Actress
Parneille Walker - Producer

Thank you so much for your help and I look forward to bringing you season two!

story:
Konyak is one of the 16 major tribes living in Nagaland, Northeast India. But the people there don't look like Indians, they are golden skinned with more Asiatic eye features. These tribes probably came from China and Mongolia long ago. The Konyak land is situated in the northeastern part of Nagaland. Their land is a mountainous region with rich products of natural forest. Most of the Konyak villages are situated on hilltops.

The Konyaks were animists, worshipping elements of nature, until Christian missionaries arrived in the late 19th century. By the late 20th Century, more than 90% of the population of the state had accepted Christianity as their religion. Today, in every village of Nagaland there is a Christian church. The common and most used language in Nagaland is Nagamese. The present generation, however, has an inclination towards English, which is the medium of instruction in school and college.

Konyak tribe is known as the last headhunters and it is famous for the facial tattoos of its warriors. The custom of killing an enemy and bringing the head was indicative of courage and pride in the past. The belief among Konyak forefathers was that there is a magical power in the human skull. A heroic reception was accorded to a warrior who entered the village with a captured head of an enemy. The village folk, men and women used to offer ceremonial reception to the hero. Killing an enemy and severing his head was considered a rite of passage for young boys, and success was rewarded with a facial tattoo. This practice was banned in the 1940s, but since the last headhunting case in Nagaland was reported in 1969, older tribesmen belong to the last generation with facial tattoos.

The skin of the body was perforated and different designs were drawn on different parts of the body such as face, chin, bosom and knees. The tattooing was painful but the men and women in the past accepted it as a status symbol. Men got their tattoos when someone of their age group had brought an enemy’s head. But nowadays such practice is no longer observed.

Today only the old people of Nagaland preserve their genuine habits, old stories and pass on the ancient marks of the tribal times. Youth lives somewhere in-between the new world they believe in and the roots they belong to. Everywhere you can see tall transmitter masts, because today nearly every middle-aged and young Naga possess a mobile phone that they extensively use. Globalization has reached at least the young Naga.

Modernization and globalization cause a cultural gap between generations. This happens mostly to people who live in remote and isolated areas and our project is inspired by this phenomenon and its subject are the Konyak people. We have divided it in two parts and the first one, that you see here describes the elders of Konyak. With the passing of the old generation any trace of their ancient tribal practices such as tattooing, body piercing and collecting war trophies are bound to disappear. This first part puts focus on all these tribal signs painted on their bodies and documenting their tribal identity. In the second part we want to present the young members of the tribe. They wear trendy clothes and even girls wear high heels on rough roads. Many of them have moved in towns to work and only go to their home villages for festivals. Living a modern life, influenced by Western culture or modern Asian lifestyle is now what they do.

Unfortunately financial circumstances forced us to significantly reduce our stay in Nagaland. We have only finished the first part. Now we are eager to continue working on the theme and complete the second part of the project. The portraits of the young generation of the tribe will be presented in a modern, fashionable and cinematic style expressing their own desirable way of living. Both parts together are a visual reflection of this cultural gap. We believe by raising awareness with this project we will help to improve tourism in Nagaland and make it more sustainable as well as people’s national identity. Doing this project we can not only bring their unique culture onto the world stage but we can help to understand better people living in remote and isolated areas, who are recently exposed to the modern world. 



Stretch Goals


Photographing    -    Making a Book    -    Exhibition





What We Need & What You Get


Nagaland is known as the state with the worst road infrastructure in the world. Transportation there is difficult. A 50 km trip could take up to 3 hours. Local transport is very limited and only between major villages and towns. We will need to hire a private SUV and a driver. It is also essential to hire a guide because of the language barrier. We will be responsible for the accommodation and food expenses of our driver and guide. In some villages people speak their own dialect, so in this case we will need to hire a local person to help us communicate. To fulfil our goals and complete the second of the project we've estimated that we need to stay and work in Nagaland for 2 months. The campaign is calculated for this period of time.



Distribution of Funds



Flexible Funding




Perks


This project means a lot for us and we hope you share our passion. We have a number of rewards for those, who join and make this project happen. Down below you can take a glimpse look at the perks that are waiting for you. Please bear in mind that all raised funds above $18,000 will be used for production of a photo book. If this happens new perks will be added.


The Postcard Collection



Canvas Shopping Bag and T-Shirt



8" x 10" Fine Art Prints




16" x 24" Finе Art Print




24" x 30" Fine Art Prints




32" x 40" Limited Edition Fine Art Print


Please note. The price of all Fine Art Prints does not include shipping. If you purchase any of our prints we will contact you to discuss the shipping options.



Risks & Challenges


Please note that if you are interested in the Photo Session Perk there are some issues about. If your country has a restriction or there is a problem for us to obtain visas there are several options that we can offer you:

  • We will send you a round trip ticket to Bulgaria where we can set up the photo session. You will be responsible for your accommodation, food and daily expenses.
  • We love travelling and we suppose you too. So we can meet in a third place and set up a shoot. We will be responsible for our travelling and all other expenses and you will be responsible for yours.



Other Ways You Can Help


We appreciate every donated dollar. However if you can’t afford to contribute you can still do the following things:

  • Share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Google+ or whatever social networks you  use.
  • Write about this campaign on your blog.
  • Tell your friends about it.
  • Tell your friends to share and tell their friends too.
  • ... and share it again!


Thank you so much in advance. We need your help to continue doing what we love to.

Mongolia long ago. The Konyak
land is situated in the northeastern part of Nagaland. Their land is a
mountainous region with rich products of natural forest. Most of the Konyak villages are
situated on hilltops.

The Konyaks were animists, worshipping elements of nature,
until Christian missionaries arrived in the late 19th century. By the late 20th
Century, more than 90% of the population of the state had accepted Christianity
as their religion. Today, in every village of Nagaland there is a Christian
church. The common and most used language in Nagaland is Nagamese. The present
generation, however, has an inclination towards English, which is the medium of
instruction in school and college.
Konyak tribe is known as the last headhunters and it is famous
for the facial tattoos of its warriors. The custom of killing
an enemy and bringing the head was indicative of courage and pride in the past.
The belief among Konyak forefathers was that there is a magical power in the
human skull. A heroic reception was accorded to a warrior who entered the
village with a captured head of an enemy. The village folk, men and women used
to offer ceremonial reception to the hero. Killing an enemy and severing his
head was considered a rite of passage for young boys, and success was rewarded
with a facial tattoo. This practice was banned in the 1940s, but since the last
headhunting case in Nagaland was reported in 1969, older tribesmen belong to
the last generation with facial tattoos.
The skin of the body was perforated and different designs were
drawn on different parts of the body such as face, chin, bosom and knees. The
tattooing was painful but the men and women in the past accepted it as a status
symbol. Men got their tattoos when someone of their age group had brought an
enemy’s head. But nowadays such practice is no longer observed.
Today only the old people of Nagaland preserve their genuine
habits, old stories and pass on the ancient marks of the tribal times. Youth
lives somewhere in-between the new world they believe in and the roots they
belong to. Everywhere you can see tall transmitter masts, because today nearly
every middle-aged and young Naga possess a mobile phone that they extensively use.
Globalization has reached at least the young Naga.
Modernization and globalization cause a cultural gap between
generations. This happens mostly to people who live in remote and isolated areas and our project is inspired by this
phenomenon and its subject are the Konyak people. We have divided it in two parts
and the first one, that you see here describes the elders of Konyak. With the passing of the
old generation any trace of their ancient tribal practices such as tattooing, body
piercing and collecting war trophies are bound to disappear. This first part puts
focus on all these tribal signs painted on their bodies and documenting their
tribal identity. In the second part we want to present the young members of the tribe. They wear
trendy clothes and even girls wear high heels on rough roads. Many of them have
moved in towns to work and only go to their home villages for festivals. Living
a modern life, influenced by Western culture or modern Asian lifestyle is now
what they do.
Unfortunately financial circumstances forced us to significantly
reduce our stay in Nagaland. We have only finished the first part. Now we are
eager to continue working on the theme and complete the second part of the
project. The portraits of the young generation of the tribe will be presented in
a modern, fashionable and cinematic style expressing their own desirable way of
living. Both parts together are a visual reflection of this cultural gap. We
believe by raising awareness with this project we will help to improve tourism
in Nagaland and make it more sustainable as well as people’s national identity.
Doing this project we can not only bring their unique culture onto the world
stage but we can help to understand better people living in remote and isolated
areas, who are recently exposed to the modern world. 



Stretch Goals




Photographing    -    Making a Book    -    Exhibition






What We Need & What You Get

Nagaland is known as the state with the worst road infrastructure in the world. Transportation there is difficult. A 50 km trip could take up to 3 hours. Local transport is very limited and only between major villages and towns. We will need to hire a private SUV and a driver. It is also essential to hire a guide because of the language barrier. We will be responsible for the accommodation and food expenses of our driver and guide. In some villages people speak their own dialect, so in this case we will need to hire a local person to help us communicate. To fulfil our goals and complete the second of the project we've estimated that we need to stay and work in Nagaland for 2 months. The campaign is calculated for this period of time.



    

Distribution of Funds






Flexible Funding






Perks


This project means a lot for us and we hope you share our passion. We
have a number of rewards for those, who join and make this project happen. Down below you can take a glimpse look at the perks that are waiting for you. Please bear in mind that all raised funds above $18,000 will be used for production of a photo book. If this happens new perks will be added.




The Postcard Collection

 



Canvas Shopping Bag and T-Shirt







8" x 10" Fine Art Prints









16" x 24" Finе Art Print







24" x 30" Fine Art Prints




32" x 40" Limited Edition Fine Art Print




Please note. The price of all Fine Art Prints does not include shipping. If you purchase any of our prints we will contact you to discuss the shipping options.
    

Risks & Challenges

Please note that if you are interested in the Photo Session Perk there are some issues about. If your country has a restriction or there is a problem for us to obtain visas there are several options that we can offer you:


We will send you a round trip ticket to Bulgaria where we can set up the photo session. You will be responsible for your accommodation, food and daily expenses.
We love travelling and we suppose you too. So we can meet in a third place and set up a shoot. We will be responsible for our travelling and all other expenses and you will be responsible for yours.



Other Ways You Can Help

We appreciate every donated dollar. However if you can’t afford to
contribute you can still do the following things:


Share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Google+ or whatever social networks you  use.
Write about this campaign on your blog.
Tell your friends about it.
Tell your friends to share and tell their friends too.
... and share it again!



Thank you so much in advance. We need your help to continue
doing what we love to.

story:
Never born, never will you die

Never gone, never will you return

Never created, never will you be destroyed

Without beginning or end, o' River, you will flow from here to there


SYNOPSIS 

The story enfolds on the banks of an imaginary river on a full moon night, when Siddhartha crosses the river in a boat, leaving Yasodhara alone on the banks. Yasodhara unable to find her beloved, Siddhartha, confronts deep pangs of separation. Her suffering makes her vulnerable to life's many moods and thus she embarks on a journey of contemplation on the various shades of life.

 

                                      

 Her quest for truth takes her away from the river, to return back to the same river, each time wearing a new skin. In every journey away from the river she sheds her old skin to put on a new garb different from her last- A sad, scared Yasodhara transforming into a seeker of truth, the seeker of truth returning as a murderer, the murderer transforming into an enlightened being – all these latent personalities of Yasodhara unfold around the river. Her journey to understand the cause of her suffering and her eventual enlightenment is what the film 'YASODHARASUTRA' is all about.

The film is the director's personal exploration of the character Yasodhara, Gautam Buddha's wife and her possible journey in understanding life. The film projects Yasodhara as a woman who lives a passionate and dangerous life after being abandoned by Siddhartha.  She questions and probes the contradictions of life and in the process becomes free of all entanglements and fears born out of years of conditioning.



Yasodhara in the film is a rebel whose inquisitive mind refuses to accept life as it comes. Drawing from the life of Yasodhara, the film tries to understand the cycle of joy and pain, union and separation, death and birth, suffering and redemption that a human being is subjected to.

Around the river lives an old lady who weaves a quilt of memories. Unaware of the present, her world is stitched with the memories of the past.

A fool, who is visible only to Yasodhara and the old lady, is a being from the other world. He has been banished from his world of moments, because he committed the blasphemy of holding on to one moment. He is sent to the world of memories, to understand the beauty of each moment and yet not hold any. While the old lady lives in the world of memories, the fool's world is made of the present moment. He has no memories and enjoys moment like a Haiku.

One by one all die. The fool becomes invisible to Yasodhara who has now been corrupted by the ways of the world. 



She finally returns to the river, with the understanding that all the human suffering is a result of societal conditioning. It's the ideas of right and wrong, moral and immoral, love and romance, ownership and possession which create an illusion of pain. Seeing reality devoid of these veils of conventions makes one free. She leads a life of meditation around the river, befriending an old ferryman, who teaches her the art of rowing the boat and awakens her to the many moods of the river, symbolic of life.

It's at this moment that she meets Siddhartha, who has now become enlightened. In the span that Siddhartha attains enlightenment Yasodhara too has become enlightened. Both meet at the river, where Yasodhara now rows a boat ferrying people across the river. Siddhartha bows to the Buddha that had awakened in Yasodhara as Yasodhara acknowledges the Buddha that had awakened within Siddhartha.



Both had transformed.

Both had changed and died to their old selves.

Both were equal.

Both bid a farewell to each other and walk on their different paths.

Once again the fool becomes visible to Yasodhara, and together they row the boat into the world of moments.


THE KEY VALUE PROPOSITION

The film reinterprets the life of Yasodhara, Gautam Buddha's wife, projecting her as a woman as enlightened as Gautam Buddha himself. The film proposes that Yasodhara in the span of six years, during which Siddhartha attained enlightenment, also went through a deep  intellectual churning, quite different from that of Siddhartha, attaining  enlightenment in the same span, pitching both Siddhartha and Yasodhara as equals.

 It's not a period film.  It is a story which tries to break all perceptions of time and space, making it a lyrical and  magical rendition of life in its most poetic form. The  subtle humor created through interactions between characters, with deep philosophical meaning, makes it an enthralling piece of work. The element of celebration, of both - life and death, memories and moments, passion and meditation makes the story a compelling  and enriching piece of art.


HOW COULD YOU SUPPORT  

Of the total cost of production of USD 510,000 (INR 30.6 million) , we already have USD 420,000 (INR 25.2 million), which is 82% of the total budget. 

The project is currently in it's production phase. We have finished the pre- production phase constituting of screenplay writing, music composition, art designing, costume designing, casting and location recces. 

A seven days of shooting was done in December, 2014, primarily to shoot certain season specific scenes and some very difficult action based scenes and installations. 

We need additional USD 90000 ( INR 5.4 million) which will be used for the post production, for CGI, VFX and sound designing. 

We are looking for your support to raise this additional amount of USD 90000 (INR 5.4 million). 

The total cost of production - USD  510000 ( INR 30.6 million)

Funds Available - USD 420000.00 (INR 25.2 million )

Funds Required - USD 90000.00 (INR 5.4 million)

Our goal is the complete the film by October, 2016 . The final shooting schedule is planned for November 2015.


WHY SHOULD YOU SUPPORT  

For the only and only reason that you believe in the story, it's philosophy and in our ability to create a work of art with a potential of  revolutionizing the way we perceive suffering, conflicts and separation. 

It's an exploration into the depths of our heart. It is a film we want to see for it's spiritual heights and creative excellence. 

It's for the sheer joy of participating in a creative journey that you would want to support this project. 

For you believe in peace and harmony. 

What we can offer is a promise of a work of beauty, love and truth. 

It is in the true spirit of "Bhiksha', asking for  alms with the purpose of self-effacement or ego-conquering, for if the universe doesn't wish it to happen, it will never happen.

 It never was ours and it never will be ours. It belongs to all and all own it. 


WRITER'S NOTE 

"Yasodhara is my personal exploration into the realm of memories. It is my personal confrontations with life which finds space in this story, emphasizing the 'return'. 

Unable to understand the origins of sorrow, which had suddenly creeped into my life,I struggled to overcome the pain.  For eight long years I suffered chronic depression.

My research on Tibetan refugees took me to remote parts of Ladakh where I lived with the Tibetan shepherds for months, leading a nomadic life. I traveled with them as they moved from one place to another in search of greener pastures. They carried what they needed, accumulating nothing. Traveling with them I felt the weight of my own memories cluttered inside my mind. These memories created feelings of hate and love. I wanted to get rid of them but at the same time could not imagine my existence devoid of the same. After all, it was the memories which linked my past with the present creating the sense of who I was. 

I was confused, disturbed and angry about my state of being. Death seemed the only way to end the suffering. It was while suffering with  high fever when this story and all it's characters magically reveled themselves to me. I wrote the first draft of the script  in the state of absolute infirmity...and as I wrote, I discovered yet another way of dying - moving from moment to moment; leaving the known and embracing the unknown, is what I realized dying was all all about. 

As I wrote 'YASODHARASUTRA' my own mind found answers to many of my own questions. This story is a lotus which bloomed after years of deep sorrow within me and it is this lotus which I wish to offer the world, in absolute gratitude". 
                                                                                                           Jyoti Patil 

   

ABOUT THE DIRECTOR 

Jyoti Patil is a passionate story teller. Life for her is a way of gathering stories. A filmmaker by profession she has numerous documentaries and short films to her credit. Survival strategies adopted by communities in extreme circumstances and situations is what fascinates her. It’s the spirit of survival which she has tried to capture through her very humble film projects. 

After completing a master’s programme in mass communications, in the year 2000, Jyoti has been directing documentary and short films on various social and environmental issues. From her experience as a national reporter with a national news channel she soon realized that the main stream media had little space for issues of the marginalized. Having quit her job as a reporter she began working with NGOs in the rural Maharashtra getting a grip of issues confronting rural areas. With this exhaustive field experience she went ahead to develop communication strategies for grassroots NGOs, such that it becomes an effective intervention for change.

Without fussing about high end communication tools she worked along with the community to form their own tools of communications. This involved making small films, audio magazines, posters and performing street theatre. She initiated rural film clubs showcasing best of cinema to the rural audience especially to the youth, as an initiative of NGOs she worked with. These film clubs run weekly with at least 15 to 20 community members watching films on various issues followed by discussions.

She has directed and produced documentaries on livelihood issues of bootleggers, environmental movements in rural Maharashtra, changing agricultural practices in the region of Ladakh, metal crafts of Uttar Pradesh. Her films have been screened at various national and international film festivals. Subjects of her films have ranged from criminal and denotified tribes to women’s empowerment, local self governance, environment and ecology. She has also directed promotional films for NGOs working in the social sector.

She is currently based in a small village, Satola, in the central Himalayan region of Uttarakhand, India, from where she pursues her passion for writing, film making and photography.

story:
"WHY?"

We don't just love our cats... we love ‘art’ that stirs many kinds of emotions… ‘creating’ an unforgettable experience, which leaves you, the viewer, wanting more. 


We are artists and we love to create. We love the act of creating something everybody will enjoy. We created the SHADOW CLANS Film to showcase the world our collective talents in film making. Our team loves anything futuristic, so we made this movie futuristic and sci-fi. We believe that we have an amazing project. we have an intelligent story, cool characters and great action. We want the chance to bring it to the world.

We’ve worked so hard on this film all throughout 2014 with all expenses out of our own pockets. That’s how passionate and dedicated we are to finish it so we can tell the world our version of the future. Right now, we are on our final stretch and we’re getting real close but we badly need help. We hope that you'll be impressed in our project enough to believe in it as much as we do to gain your support.

This is what we have accomplished so far with such a limited budget. Help fund Shadow Clans and you’ll be blown away by how much more kick ass we can make this movie. Help us finish Shadow Clans and we will deliver you nothing but pure awesomeness!


"Everyday is one step closer to the future. Enjoy the ride… its going to be an exciting and crazy one." - IQ (Lead scientist: iRUKANDJi Faction)

We have come out of our pockets for the travel and pre-production of this film. International licensing, lodging, travel, security, location scouting, equipment rentals. Although we have lots of equipment already, but some items are vital for shots and could not be imported such as cranes, generators, safety equipment and harnesses, weather proofing from crazy monsoon rains. 

It was expensive getting out here, but it has been well worth the journey. We are approximately 75% through the film portion of this project. In order to stay at a steady pace and finish this aspect of the film, we have to keep the crew happy and fed. Cameramen, security, stuntmen, choreographers, martial artists, actors, lighting crew, set dressers and make-up artists.




ENFORCER - Genetically enhanced strong-arm for the Shadow Clans.



KENJIRO - Genetically enhanced Enforcer of the iRUKANDJi Faction



KENJIRO - Attacked with the Sinistra's high caliber photon assault rifle



So Shadow Warriors... 


Come join the secret Brotherhood of the Shadow. Your contribution will allow us to tell this amazing story where humans and computers are rapidly advancing. Man and machine begin to merge. Loyalty and betrayal, the promise of immortality… and a surprise cliff hanger ending that will leave the audience completely twisted and begging for part 2! 

And this isn't just a film. The world of the SHADOW CLANS will be conveyed through high res comic series & a hard bound graphic novel thanks to your loyal contributions. 


GRAPHIC NOVEL


BEHIND THE SCENES

(Manila, Philippines)


50%............................. Post-Production (CGI & Special Effects)

20%............................. Funder Perks (Giving Back to Contributors)

10%.............................. Editing & Sequencing (Animation)

5%................................ Charity (Orphanages in Manila, Philippines)

5%................................ Social Media & SEO (Online exposure)

5%................................ Artists & Staff (Our dedicated Film Crew)

5%................................ International Film Festival (Submission Fees)


NOTE: The importance of submitting your film to festivals around the globe is gaining international recognition and acclaim. This type of widespread exposure will thrust 'SHADOW CLANS' into the public consciousness, but the important thing to know about film festivals, is its not 'how many' show up to watch your film... its "who" shows up to watch your film. 

Directors, writers, actors, agents, production companies and anyone who's anyone in the world of film-making travel to festivals around the world to watch thousands of films every year; giving the unsigned talents looking for a foot-in the chance to show case their works of passion. REAL COOL!!

We highly appreciate your contributions, that is why we do not only commit ourselves in delivering you a quality futuristic film packed with real action but we will also offer you guys the following  items below in exchange for your generous contributions:

  • Receive email updates and access to exclusive behind-the-scene photos & videos.
  • Get a cartooned action photo of you posted on our Facebook page.

  • You are automatically entitled to ALL the previous perks

  • Receive an Electronic version of the Shadow Clans Full-Color Graphic Novel.

  • You are automatically entitled to ALL the previous perks
  • Get the first of its kind Shadow Clans Shirt (Specially tailored and not sold elsewhere)
  • Limited Edition Shadow Clans DVD (Compilation of Shadow Clans Shorts)

  • You are automatically entitled to ALL the previous perks

  • Get the first of its kind Shadow Clans Hoodies (Specially tailored and not sold elsewhere).

  • You are automatically entitled to ALL the previous perks

  • Get a hold of a hard copy of the Shadow Clans Full-Color Graphic Novel.


  • You are automatically entitled to ALL the previous perks

story_txt:
"WHY?"We don't just love our cats... we love ‘art’ that stirs many kinds of emotions… ‘creating’ an unforgettable experience, which leaves you, the viewer, wanting more. We are artists and we love to create. We love the act of creating something everybody will enjoy. We created the SHADOW CLANS Film to showcase the world our collective talents in film making. Our team loves anything futuristic, so we made this movie futuristic and sci-fi. We believe that we have an amazing project. we have an intelligent story, cool characters and great action. We want the chance to bring it to the world.We’ve worked so hard on this film all throughout 2014 with all expenses out of our own pockets. That’s how passionate and dedicated we are to finish it so we can tell the world our version of the future. Right now, we are on our final stretch and we’re getting real close but we badly need help. We hope that you'll be impressed in our project enough to believe in it as much as we do to gain your support. This is what we have accomplished so far with such a limited budget. Help fund Shadow Clans and you’ll be blown away by how much more kick ass we can make this movie. Help us finish Shadow Clans and we will deliver you nothing but pure awesomeness! "Everyday is one step closer to the future. Enjoy the ride… its going to be an exciting and crazy one." - IQ (Lead scientist: iRUKANDJi Faction)

We have come out of our pockets for the travel and pre-production of this film. International licensing, lodging, travel, security, location scouting, equipment rentals. Although we have lots of equipment already, but some items are vital for shots and could not be imported such as cranes, generators, safety equipment and harnesses, weather proofing from crazy monsoon rains. 
It was expensive getting out here, but it has been well worth the journey. We are approximately 75% through the film portion of this project. In order to stay at a steady pace and finish this aspect of the film, we have to keep the crew happy and fed. Cameramen, security, stuntmen, choreographers, martial artists, actors, lighting crew, set dressers and make-up artists.
ENFORCER - Genetically enhanced strong-arm for the Shadow Clans.KENJIRO - Genetically enhanced Enforcer of the iRUKANDJi Faction
KENJIRO - Attacked with the Sinistra's high caliber photon assault rifle


So Shadow Warriors... 










Come join the secret Brotherhood of the Shadow. Your contribution will allow us to tell this amazing story where humans and computers are rapidly advancing. Man and machine begin to merge. Loyalty and betrayal, the promise of immortality… and a surprise cliff hanger ending that will leave the audience completely twisted and begging for part 2! 
And this isn't just a film. The world of the SHADOW CLANS will be conveyed through high res comic series & a hard bound graphic novel thanks to your loyal contributions. 


GRAPHIC NOVEL



BEHIND THE SCENES

(Manila, Philippines)

20%............................. Funder Perks (Giving Back to Contributors)




10%.............................. Editing & Sequencing (Animation)


5%................................ Charity (Orphanages in Manila, Philippines)



5%................................ Social Media & SEO (Online exposure)


5%................................ Artists & Staff (Our dedicated Film Crew)



5%................................ International Film Festival (Submission Fees)






NOTE: The importance of submitting your film to festivals around the globe is gaining international recognition and acclaim. This type of widespread exposure will thrust 'SHADOW CLANS' into the public consciousness, but the important thing to know about film festivals, is its not 'how many' show up to watch your film... its "who" shows up to watch your film. 





Directors, writers, actors, agents, production companies and anyone who's anyone in the world of film-making travel to festivals around the world to watch thousands of films every year; giving the unsigned talents looking for a foot-in the chance to show case their works of passion. REAL COOL!!







We highly appreciate your contributions, that is why we do not only commit ourselves in delivering you a quality futuristic film packed with real action but we will also offer you guys the following  items below in exchange for your generous contributions:

story:
Summary:

Superheroes. The modern myths of our time. 

Since kids, we've been fascinated by their flashy costumes, powers, but most all the human element. What do they tell us about ourselves?  Why the superhero genre continues to appeal and fascinate the public is because it not only shows us what we are capable of; willing to do the impossible for our friends, family or complete strangers, but also it makes us look at our world and society in a different light and provokes us to ask the question, "How can I make it a better place?"

Power, of any kind, can be used for good or evil depending on the person and situation. In Legendary, we explore that to the fullest with our main protagonist (Zane Bolton/Legendary) and antagonist (Arnold Trust, CEO of Trust Global). What are the great lengths we are willing to go to keep that power or take it away? If given such miraculous gifts would we, as individuals, use them for justice and the betterment of mankind or would we use them for destructive purposes? The choices that we make in but also the characters in our series have infinite effects and possibilities. 

What the director, producers, writer, cast and crew hope to achieve with the audience is first to entertain you but most of all we want you to look at these characters and their decisions closely. 

Is Arnold Trust really a bad man or is he doing bad things because of the grave situation he is in?

Could Zane have done more to prevent his father's death?

What is it that makes a hero? Are people born with heroic traits, are they given to them by accident or chance, or do they develop these on their own free will? 

It's these questions that we want to arouse within our audience. 

Crew:

Justin Berrisford: Director

Born and raised in White Bear Lake, Justin has always aspired to be a part of something. In his directorial debut he will see his dream come true. Just says, "It is a joy and honor to be accompanied on this journey with a wonderful cast, crew, contributors and fans to see this succeed. Here's to all the dreamers of the world. I'm making my dream come true and you can too. Never give up."

Cole Meyer: Screenwriter/Producer

Since a young age, Cole wanted to get into the film business. After graduating from Century Community & Technical College with an A.S. Degree in Digital Video Production in 2008 and going onto Metropolitan State University to receive a B.A. in Screenwriting in 2010, Cole has made several short films under his production company Big Bang Productions and has even received several awards. 

"Legendary" is not his first foray into the superhero genre. "Love Unmasked", a parody of the Golden Age of comics and the Adam West "Batman" TV series, was his first time diving into the world of capes and gaudy costumes. See here:


"Legendary", however, is a more serious, down to earth and dramatic take, and he couldn't be more thrilled writing the episodes and producing this project. 

Tucker Kloetzke: Actor/Assistant Director

Tucker was born and raised in Minneapolis, Minnesota and began creating movies when he was only seven years old. Tucker Kloetzke has written, directed, edited and starred in every video and movie that Pendle Productions LLC has produced. He created Pendle Productions LLC as an independent film production company dedicated to producing high-quality entertainment, covering all types of genres, including comedy, horror, action and adventure, romance, and mystery. His film "The Dead Body" won the Award of Merit for Short Film at the The Accolades Worldwide Film Festival in 2011.

Currently, Pendle Productions only creates shorts but an opportunity to be a part of something this big and expansive, and working alongside and reuniting with friends after a four year break, feels like returning home. 

Steve Kohler: Lead Designer/Actor

Steve has a communications, video, and graphic design background. Also, a graduate of Century College. He has worked with Tucker and Cole in the past on various shorts. After a four year hiatus, the three are excited to be working alongside each other again to make this project the best it can be. 


Edward Linder: DP/Actor

Edward is the founder and owner of TMJ Productions (Too Much Joy). The entertainment company was founded in 1999 and has been involved in everything from film, video, theatre and graphic art. Edward has received awards and accolades as well with his career. Check him out at: http://www.tmjproductions.com

Christian Gayle: Visual F/X

Christian is a talented freelance visual f/x artist, video editor, camera-operator and filmmaker. His short film "Trapped" was entered into the 2011 9th annual Lightsaber Choreography Competition (LCCIX). The competition's panel of judges noted the film for its gritty and realistic style. See here:


In April 2013, he founded Creative Gateway Productions. 

James Paulson: Sound-Operator/Script-Supervisor

James is a screenwriter, filmmaker and an overall swell guy.

Cast:

Like our crew, the cast is entirely made up Minnesotans. Many of them have starred in commercials, film and theatre. As follows:

Tucker Kloetzke-Zane Bolton/Legendary


Rachel Weber-Hannah McGregor

C.J. DeVaan-Arnold Trust

Beau Hellam- Calvin Pierce

Alex Galick-Amir Hassan

Bruce Miller-Detective Morton Hoss

Rikka Bonnell-Detective Brenda Barnes

Steve Kohler-Buzz "The Buzzard" Ford


Shannon McDonough-Roxie

Sara Atkinson-Sarah McGregor

Edward Linder-Dr. Herbert Bolton

John Edel-Vernon White

Ernest Briggs-Coach Boone

Why You Should Donate To This Project:

If you're a fan of the Marvel and D.C. cinematic universes, Heroes or comics in general, we feel this web series will be for you. It's got action, comedy, romance but also most of all we wanted to tell character-driven stories. While, yes, Pierce can fly like Superman, Zane can heal himself like Wolverine and both have the power of super-strength, our main objective when creating this was not only put our spin on the superhero genre and give people a reason to come back each week and watch the next episode, but to present a show to the public, that in itself, feels like it exists within our own world. 

Zane, as stated above, starts out as the quarterback of the his football team. He's got a great girl, life couldn't be better, but then that all changes in an instant. Everything ordinary must be put aside and he must embrace the extraordinary in himself. Like all great heroes, he must answer the call, protect the ones he loves, fight evil wherever it lurks and be the stuff legends are made of. 

Our goal is to finish the first season with a new season and episodes to follow. Episodes will run a length of 15-20 minutes. Six episodes total for each season. When all episodes are complete and transferred to DVD, viewers will have a chance to decide whether or not they want to watch the episodes separately or altogether as one complete 2-hour movie. We plan to finish all the episodes before October and have the finished product ready to view by or about January 2015. 

What We Need & What You Get:

With your help and support, your donations will be used to pay our talented cast and crew, location fees, costumes, makeup, props, craft services and transportation fees. Your generous donations will also go towards post-production. This ranges from mixing sound, doing ADR if needed, adding visual effects and editing the episodes. 

We are looking to raise an estimated $5, 000 for this project. With all we have planned and to meet the wages and costs, we will need every dollar to do so.  We are creating an original universe that can next to Marvel's, D.C.'s or other comic brand names' universes. To make this happen--- to achieve our vision--- none of it can be possible without passionate and committed individuals who want to see this through from pre to post-production like us.

We have many different incentives for people to give money towards. As each incentive goes up in amount, the prizes get bigger. One of these is the opportunity to have an extra role in the series (must live in Minnesota or Wisconsin however). Other incentives include posters, buttons, T-shirts, DVD copies and more. 

    Risks & Challenges:

    As stated, Legendary depends on your help and support. Every dollar counts. We want this to go far beyond a pilot episode or even a teaser or concept trailer. If we do not raise the $5, 000 proposed, many of the things we want to do and have planned will sadly have to stay in the concept stage and the end product will not be as what we intended it to be. Halfway ($2, 500), however, would allow us to do many things we want to do but the $5, 000 or more raised, we feel, will meet all the demands, costs and help out in the long run if any problems arise. 

    As ambitious as we are, we also know technical issues could ensue along with scheduling conflicts, weather changes or various other reasons. However, despite all these things, the Legendary team are determined to deliver an amazing series for you and stay true to the genre that has touched our lives since childhood and today. We are all anxious to get started on this and are committed to seeing this project from concept (scripts and storyboards) to the final product but again... it all depends on you to get us there. 

    The Impact:

    As stated earlier, while yes there are super powers and big action-scenes in Legendary, the overall series is built around our characters and their stories. Each character is forced to make tough choices and decisions; each character goes down paths that lead to interesting twists and turns. And when season one ends, season two really heats up and the consequences for those actions and choices come out to the front. 

    With that in mind, again, the life of Legendary and where it goes from the early stages to final production, depends solely on you.

    If you want to see an exciting new take on the superhero genre with compelling characters that you can latch onto and care about, Legendary is that and more.

      Other Ways You Can Help:

      We understand that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help. Here are many ways you can get the word out about this project:

      - Make some noise about our campaign. Link or share this Indiegogo page. Go on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Myspace, you name it, and tell them about our page. Once they view it, tell them to donate and share our page too. Let the word of mouth spread. 

      -Show people our trailer and once they've seen it, tell them to share it with their friends and family. Tell them about this great, new superhero-themed web series that needs their help and support with getting off the ground. 

      -Have someone sponsor us. As one of the incentives describes, we would love to feature a product, company, brand, band, etc. in this series. You scratch our back we'll scratch yours.

      So if you are ready as us to see this series come to fruition then let's take flight together and go kick some ass!

story:
NEW VIDEO: Please watch the new pitch video ABOVE featuring world-leading experts talking about the science behind this film!


Who Are We?

We are Toni Harman and Alex Wakeford. We are parents to a 7 year old girl and we're also award-winning documentary filmmakers. Corny as it might sound, we genuinely want to make films that change the world.

(Photo Above: Alex Wakeford and Toni Harman  accepting the top prize, the Grand Prix Award for their previous documentary "Microbirth" at the Life Sciences Film Festival in Prague in October 2014. Copyright LSFF 2014)

Our next project is a feature-length documentary for worldwide cinema release that we hope could become a kind of self-help plan for the species!


What's The New Film?


It might be called A PROBIOTIC LIFE (working title) but it isn't about probiotics!

It's about what we can do from birth to protect our microbiome for the best possible health.

The film is a celebration of new discoveries in the human microbiome. The message is simple - to improve our health as a species, perhaps it's time for us to re-learn who we are as human beings. To become aware that we're not just human; we're actually part human, part microbe. If we want better health, maybe it's time for us all to start making choices from birth that benefit the whole human super-organism!

This is an urgent message right now as many aspects of our modern way of life seems to be impacting our microbiome; from eating processed foods to using anti-bacterial products, from life-saving practices like antibiotic therapies to C-Sections combined with the loss of our close connection with nature.

Many modern-day health problems have been linked in some way to an imbalance of our human microbiome - everything from allergies, asthma, diabetes, obesity, bowel disorders, some cancers and because of a gut-brain connection, even conditions like Alzheimer's, Parkinson's and autism.

So what will it take to make ourselves and in particular, our kids, stronger, more robust and ultimately resistant to disease? With your support, we hope to find out!

As the film reveals, the most critical time period for the human microbiome is from birth to infancy as the microbiome stabilizes sometime between 2-3 years of age. This means that how we give birth and feed our babies plus their microbial exposures during these early years could play a major part in determining their lifelong health.


(Photo above: Jarrad Marcel, Research Laboratory Coordinator, Argonne National Laboratory, collecting a swab sample from his nephew. Copyright Alto Films Ltd 2015).

The film explores what can new parents do to protect a child's developing microbiome and to give that child the strongest possible immune system.

After the age of 3, the microbiome shifts a little over the course of our lives and so there are still things we could all do to help restore our microbiome.

The film explores the latest science on the impact of diet on the microbiome, including finding out which type of diet might be best for your microbiome, for example, which is more microbe-friendly, paleo, vegetarian or high fibre diets? The film looks at whether or not to take prebiotics, probiotics or antibiotics, the simple changes we could make to how we live and why we all perhaps should get more down and dirty with nature.

(Photo above: Grant Fisher (the little boy on the right) and his family, one of the youngest ever recipients of a fecal transplant that "cured" recurrent C-Difficile)

The film tells emotionally-engaging personal stories; from an Amish family living in northern Indiana (a community with remarkably low rates of asthma and allergies) to a family whose infant son was "cured" of the debilitating disease C-Difficile after a fecal transplant (yes, a poo transplant!). The film also looks at the potential for microbiome-related treatment further down the road for allergies, asthma and obesity plus conditions such as Parkinson's and autism.

The film also looks at the latest advances in the medical and scientific worlds like "gauze-seeding" of the microbiome for C-Section babies, probiotic replacement body parts and fecal transplants plus exciting things that lie around the corner in terms of designing buildings that are actually good for your microbes.


(Photo above: Dr John Alverdy filmed in his lab at the University of Chicago. Copyright Alto Films Ltd 2015).

Scientists we have already filmed for this project include professors from Cornell University, New York University, Chicago University, Northwestern University and Kings College London with more scientists lined up to be filmed this summer!


(Photo Above: Dr Jack Gilbert in his lab at Argonne National Laboratory. Copyright Alto Films Ltd 2015).


Will It Change The World?

Anything is possible! We would love the film to become a kind of self-help guide for the species.

We certainly hope it inspires people to make positive changes to their lives. As the film reveals, simple small changes to diet and lifestyle could go a long way to protect, restore and rebalance the human microbiome - these changes could benefit ourselves and our families but also, potentially impact future generations.

We want this to be more than a film, we want to inspire a movement uniting forward-thinkers from around the world. We want these forward-thinkers to tell their friends in real-life and across social media, so one simple idea spreads wider and wider - the benefits of starting to live "a probiotic life".

We need your support to make this happen. Yes, we need money to complete the film - but more importantly, we need good word of mouth, to spread the idea across the world. 

(Photo above: Alex Wakeford, co-Producer / Director, "A Probiotic Life" - filming at one of the University of Chicago hospitals. Copyright Alto Films Ltd 2015.)


Why Are We Doing This?

Why are spending two years of our lives making a documentary about bacteria?

Honestly, we want to help shape the future. We want to play a small part in ensuring that the next generation of children is more robust and more resilient to disease. That way, future generations will be best equipped to deal with whatever health challenges lie ahead.

Isn't that ultimately what everybody wants - for ourselves, our families and our friends and even wider, for whole populations and for future generations to be the healthiest they can possibly be? 

(Photo above: Toni Harman, co-Producer /Director, A Probiotic Life - filming at the University of Chicago Gnotobiotic facility. Copyright Alto Films Ltd 2015.)

Who Are We To Do This?

We are professional filmmakers. We met at the London Film School where we trained twenty years ago and since then we've been making films together.

We have a strong track record. Over the past six years, we have made four feature-length films that have been distributed internationally including CREDO a psychological thriller (2008, 90 mins - released as THE DEVIL's CURSE by Lionsgate in the US), DOULA! a documentary about doulas (2010, 60 mins), FREEDOM FOR BIRTH a documentary about human rights in childbirth (2012, 60 mins).


Our last film MICROBIRTH (60 mins, 2014) about how the way we give birth impacts a baby's lifelong health - won the top prize, the Grand Prix Award, at the Life Sciences Film Festival in Prague. It's had over 1,000 public screenings all around the world and is now being distributed internationally. It's sparked massive international media interest and more importantly, it's changed people's lives. 


Why Should You Trust Us?

We will finish the film no matter what.

If we raise more than our target - terrific! We'll set some stretch goals. Every dollar raised will go towards the direct costs of making this project the best it can be. So if we raise more than our target, we'll spend more money on marketing and promotional materials to spread the word as far and wide as possible.

And you can trust us with the perks. We delivered all our perks for our FREEDOM FOR BIRTH and MICROBIRTH Indiegogo campaigns to all our contributors on time and on schedule!

And we really do care about this. We have spent the past year and spent all of our own money to get to this stage, now we need one big boost and your support to get us over the finish line for maximum global impact!


What Do We Need The Money For?

Our journey so far has taken us from an Amish farm in Indiana to a US Government Research Lab, from inside homes to operating theatres and into influential architectural firms. This summer we plan to continue our journey by doing more filming in Europe and North America. We want to film projects that are unraveling the impact of the gut microbiome on autism, Parkinson's, allergies and obesity.

We are aiming to premiere A PROBIOTIC LIFE in the Spring of 2016 at a big festival followed by a theatrical release in cinemas!

After what we hope will be a very successful cinema and VOD release, then we'll be opening the film up to you to hold your own public screening (if you choose this perk) in order to spread the message even wider. With our film FREEDOM FOR BIRTH, we had over 1,100 simultaneous public screenings all over the world on one day  - with over 100,000 seeing the film on that single day!


How Can You Help?

Please choose a perk now and contribute. That would simply be amazing!

And if you can, please tell your friends about this campaign.

And of course, please share, like, tweet and shout about it across social media.

Like our Facebook page : http://facebook.com/aprobioticlife

Follow us on Twitter @aprobioticlife : http://twitter.com/aprobioticlife

And if you're tweeting, please use the hashtag #APROBIOTICLIFE

And if you have any questions or suggestions - please let us know via the contact form on the A PROBIOTIC LIFE website, via Facebook or Twitter. We really appreciate all feedback. It helps us make this project the best that it can be.

Thank you so much. We are so excited by this project and we can't wait to get on and finish the film so we can help spark real change.

(Photo Above: Toni Harman (left) and Alex Wakeford (right), Producers/Directors, A Probiotic Life. Copyright Alto Films Ltd 2015.)

Please join us for an amazing adventure into the microbiome.
story_txt:
NEW VIDEO: Please watch the new pitch video ABOVE featuring world-leading experts talking about the science behind this film!
Who Are We?



We are Toni Harman and Alex Wakeford. We are parents to a 7 year old girl
and we're also award-winning documentary filmmakers. Corny as it might sound, we genuinely want to make films that change the
world.


(Photo Above: Alex Wakeford and Toni Harman  accepting the top prize, the Grand Prix Award for their previous documentary "Microbirth" at the Life Sciences Film Festival  in Prague in October 2014. Copyright LSFF 2014)
Our
next project is a feature-length
documentary for worldwide cinema release that we hope could become a kind of self-help plan for the species!



What's The New Film?
 It might be called A PROBIOTIC LIFE (working title) but it isn't about probiotics! It's about what we can do from birth to protect our microbiome for the best possible health.The film is a celebration of new discoveries in the human microbiome. The message is simple - to improve our health as a species, perhaps it's time for us to re-learn who we are as human beings. To become aware that we're not just human; we're actually part human, part microbe. If we want better health, maybe it's time for us all to start making choices from birth that benefit the whole human super-organism!

This is an urgent message right now as many aspects of our modern way of life seems to be impacting our microbiome; from eating processed foods to using anti-bacterial products, from life-saving practices like antibiotic therapies to C-Sections combined with the loss of our close connection with nature.
Many modern-day health problems have been linked in some way to an
imbalance of our human microbiome - everything from allergies,
asthma, diabetes, obesity, bowel disorders, some cancers and because
of a gut-brain connection, even conditions like Alzheimer's,
Parkinson's and autism.
So what will it take to make ourselves and in particular, our kids, stronger, more robust and ultimately resistant to disease? With your support, we hope to find out!


As the film
reveals, the most critical time period for the human microbiome is
from birth to infancy as the microbiome stabilizes sometime between
2-3 years of age. This means that how we give birth and feed our
babies plus their microbial exposures during these early years could
play a major part in determining their lifelong health. 

(Photo above: Jarrad Marcel, Research Laboratory Coordinator, Argonne National Laboratory, collecting a swab sample from his nephew. Copyright Alto Films Ltd 2015).The film explores what can new parents do to protect a child's developing microbiome and to give that child the strongest possible immune system.After the age of 3, the microbiome
shifts a little over the course of our lives and so there are still
things we could all do to help restore our microbiome. 
The film explores the latest science on the impact of diet on the microbiome, including finding out which type of diet might be best for your microbiome, for example, which is more microbe-friendly, paleo, vegetarian or high fibre diets? The film looks at whether or not to take
prebiotics, probiotics or antibiotics, the simple changes we could
make to how we live and why we all perhaps should get more down and
dirty with nature. 

(Photo above: Grant Fisher (the little boy on the right) and his family, one of the youngest ever recipients of a fecal transplant that "cured" recurrent C-Difficile)
The film tells emotionally-engaging personal stories; from an Amish
family living in northern Indiana (a community with remarkably low
rates of asthma and allergies) to a family whose infant son was
"cured" of the debilitating disease C-Difficile after a
fecal transplant (yes, a poo transplant!). The film also looks at the
potential for microbiome-related treatment further down the road for
allergies, asthma and obesity plus conditions such as Parkinson's and autism. 
The film also looks at the latest
advances in the medical and scientific worlds like "gauze-seeding" of the
microbiome for C-Section babies, probiotic replacement body parts and
fecal transplants plus exciting things that lie around the corner in
terms of designing buildings that are actually good for your
microbes.



(Photo above: Dr John Alverdy filmed in his lab at the University of Chicago. Copyright Alto Films Ltd 2015).
Scientists we have already filmed for this project include professors from Cornell University, New York University, Chicago University, Northwestern University and Kings College London with more scientists lined up to be filmed this summer!








(Photo Above: Dr Jack Gilbert in his
lab at Argonne National Laboratory. Copyright Alto Films Ltd 2015).




Will It Change The World?
Anything is possible! We would love the film to become a kind of self-help guide for the species. 
We certainly hope it inspires people to make positive changes to their lives. As the film reveals, simple small changes to diet and lifestyle could go a long way to protect, restore and rebalance the human microbiome - these changes could benefit ourselves and our families but also, potentially impact future generations.






We want this to be more than a film, we want to inspire a movement uniting forward-thinkers from around the world. We want these forward-thinkers to tell
their friends in real-life and across social media, so one
simple idea spreads wider and wider - the benefits of starting to live "a probiotic life".


We
need your support to make this happen. Yes, we need money to complete
the film - but more importantly, we need good word of mouth, to spread
the idea across the world. 


(Photo above: Alex Wakeford, co-Producer / Director, "A Probiotic Life" - filming at one of the University of Chicago hospitals. Copyright Alto Films Ltd 2015.)


Why Are We Doing This?
Why are spending two years of our lives making a documentary about bacteria? 
Honestly, we want to help shape the future. We want to play a small part in ensuring that the next generation
 of children is more robust and more resilient to disease. That way, future generations will be best equipped to deal with whatever health challenges lie ahead. 
Isn't that ultimately what everybody wants - for ourselves, our families and our friends and even wider, for whole populations and for future generations to be the healthiest they can possibly be? 


(Photo above: Toni Harman, co-Producer /Director, A Probiotic Life - filming at the University of Chicago Gnotobiotic facility. Copyright Alto Films Ltd 2015.)

We are
professional filmmakers. We met at the London Film School where we
trained twenty years ago and since then we've been making films
together.


We
have a strong track record. Over the past six years, we have made
four feature-length films that have been distributed internationally
including CREDO a psychological thriller (2008, 90 mins - released as THE DEVIL's CURSE by Lionsgate in the US), DOULA! a documentary about
doulas (2010, 60 mins), FREEDOM FOR BIRTH a documentary about human
