story:
Short Summary

Premier Ryders  is a social organization of like-minded individuals who are coming together to create support and awareness in Stopping the Violence, as well as Cancer awareness and prevention. This Docu-Series will capture the Premier Ryders going into troubled neighborhoods to mentor teenagers who otherwise may have a bleak future. The Premier Ryders will engage positive role models (such as those that are part of our team here) that will redirect troubled youth through educational programs designed to advocate structure, positivity, compassion and social responsibility,  Words we strive to live by, "Good, Better, Best. Don't let it rest. Until your good is better & your better is best!"

The Lil Ones who I Live and fight this fight for! Stop The Violence!

                                         Premier Ryder Team Biography

William Harris is the visionary, driving force and co-founder of the Premier Ryders. "Big Wheel", was previously an integral part of the creation of another motorsports club.  He helped grow that organization to a membership of over 10,000 with a presence in 28 states.  A combination of his experiences in that organization in conjunction with a very unfortunate event that touched his own life the Premier movement has been born.  



Matt Hill, "Da Coach," is the backbone of Premier Ryders. Matt's experience in the areas of Operations Management, Talent Acquisition, Marketing and, most importantly ongoing Coaching, makes him essential to the team. Matt plans to continue to implement programs that will help create awareness in ending violence in our communities and promoting cancer awareness and prevention.

Vette Meadows is a compassionate activist of social injustice. Bringing over 20 years of experience in the fields of business development, operations, sales and marketing. Evette is fervent in raising cancer awareness and stopping the violence and also making our communities a better and safer place to live

LaShawn Williams brings over 15 years of experience working and mentoring youths through various organizations such as The Chicago Park District and as a member of Zeta Phi Beta Sorority, Inc. LaShawn believes that we have to be advocates for those who cannot advocate for themselves.

Cynthia Kilby is a 10 year veteran of the US Navy. Cynthia is very passionate about educating others on the importance of cancer screenings, and early detection which helps save lives.
Robin Palumbo brings over 18 years of experience in the area of Accounting. With a primary focus on budgeting, cost analysis, and financial reporting, Robin is a definite asset to the Premier family.                                                                                           

Rico Edwards is a veteran of the United States Marine Corp. This opportunity helped him to discover that life is a precious gift, and too many of our youth are wasting their lives away. Through mentoring today’s youth, Rico hopes to help guide young men and women in a positive direction and help them understand there is a better way.                                                                                                                                                                  

L Jay Jones is head of security for The Premier Ryders Motorsports Club. "K9", as he is affectionately called, brings forth over 20 years of experience from both military and law enforcement backgrounds. K9 has provided security detail for various Motorcycle clubs, community pastors and churches.

Angela LaGrone is part of Premier Ryders security team with a background in domestic violence, family advocacy, rape crisis, intervention and teen counseling. 

Tanya Johnson contributes over 20 years of Sales and Marketing experience. Her expertise in event planning and promotions, makes her a definite asset to the team.

Ashley Rose brings over 5 years of Project Management experience working with various community organizations. Ashley is eager to help in educating communities on cancer awareness.



Premier Ryders is asking for donations in the amount of $250,000.00 USD to secure documentation through film; capturing the creation of the Premier Ryders and the impact that the group will have in communities across the country . This funding will go towards the filming, editing, production and administrative costs necessary to produce the series and begin the launch of our programs.  A primary focus will be the CAVE program; Cancer and Violence Educators. This program provides a unique perspective as it merges the causes of Cancer and Violence together to show how surprisingly similar the situations are. The CAVE program is designed to take children from different walks of life who have been exposed to violence as well as children who have been diagnosed with cancer and merge  them together in a camp setting to promote the building of healthy relationships, positive bonds , and applying the “Good, Better, Best “ practices to their daily lives.  As a supporter, this is your chance to make a big difference in ways both big and small.  

As it often does, the power will lie in the numbers.  By joining together to curb societal propensity toward violence and to create cancer awareness and prevention, we can motivate others that have the same passions and make a huge impact.  The Premier Ryders will unite those who truly want to help change our communities and aide in the implement of traveling programs that will guide our youth; who are our future.        

 

Let Me Count the Ways!

There are so many ways in which you can help:

  • Share the links to our campaign with your friends, family & colleagues
  • Follow us on Twitter, Facebook and Instagram and use the hashtag #PremierRyders #Ryde2SaveLives
  • Become an official member of the Premier Ryders in your respective state.
  • Indulge in one of our fabulous perks. There is something for everyone!

Indulge in one of our fabulous perks. There is something for everyone!

story:
About Us

Landline, A Short Film by Writer/Director Shani Drake

SYNOPSIS: Abigale (Tyla Vlavianos) never knows if she's really awake or still dreaming. Everything about her world is surreal, from the town that she occupies by herself, to the recurring dream she has of being in therapy, and the mysterious man (Nick Heyman, Revenge, Shameless) she runs into in the forest.

We will be going into production on June 15th and filming at two beautiful locations; A house in the Hollywood Hills and Griffith Park. We will be shooting the film with the Black Magic Pocket to get a real cinematic look.

After filming, there are many different costs that go into the post production of a film, from editing and color correction to marketing and festival submission fees. We are doing this campaign to raise money to help with those costs.

About The Director

Shani Drake is an American Actress, Youtuber, Singer-Songwriter and Filmmaker. Subscribers of her Youtube channels know her as a bubbly, adventurous girl who enjoys documenting her life and sharing it with the internet. Between her two channels, she does Daily Vlogs, Fashion Videos, Movie Reviews, and has a series called Social Anxiety Confessions. Shani studied Acting, Writing & Directing for the Camera at Shoreline Community College's film program. In March of 2015 she moved from Seattle to Los Angeles to pursue an acting and filmmaking career. Landline will be her directorial debut. 

The Crew

CINEMATOGRAPHER - Weetus Cren

ASSISTANT DIRECTOR - Eryn Rea

SOUND - Medardo Gastelum

WARDROBE/COSTUME - Mariah Harrison

PA/GAFFER - Carlton Hudson

DIT - Leonardo Diaz

BTS PHOTOGRAPHER - Morgan Chan

BTS VIDEOGRAPHER - Kesi Drake

CRAFT SERVICES - Roxann Drake


The Cast

Abigale - Tyla Vlavianos


The Man - Nick Heyman


The Scientist - Spencer Jarman



What We Need

  • $1000 - Editing: This money will go towards paying an editor, along with other fees that come with post production; color correction, sound, etc.
  • $1000 - Film Festival Submission and Exhibition: Film Festivals have submission fees ranging from $0-125 plus shipping costs and manufacturing of screening and exhibition materials (DVDs etc).
  • $500 - Soundtrack: This money will go towards paying the indie band or musician whose music we decide to use in the film.
  • $200 - Production Costs - We still have a few costs related to production that we could use help with.


Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can donate money. There are still many other ways you can help!

  • Make some noise about our campaign on social media by sharing the link to this fundraiser. A Facebook post is priceless.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools, to tweet & email your friends and colleagues!

story:
Short Summary

The Witcher world is immense. Books and games are just a small part of stories left untold in the minds of the others. Our team also has a Witcher Story to tell. A story about love, doubt and danger.

Lost and Found is a short film that chronologically preceeds the events of The Wild Hunt. Ciri is on the run, travelling through time and space, and Geralt… well, he has some other kind of trouble.

Your support will allow us to finish the current production and go further with The Witcher Stories.


What We Need & What You Get

We have already finished actual filming, but the post-production requires some extra funding. Our aim is to deliver the short film with great visuals, original soundtrack and voice acting in several languages. Afterwards, since the project is purely non-commercial, there will be a free release on YouTube.

In order to achieve all that we need the minimum of 2,000 $. That sum would allow us to pay our film crew for spending extra time on editing and visual effects, to hire voice actors for English, Polish and Russian voicing and to rent a studio, where voice actors and musicians will be recorded.

Filmed in Lviv, Ukraine, this short is not just a single fruit of our efforts, but it also may the beginning of something much more, if your support exceeds the initial goal. We’re not just talking about traditional extras, exclusive photosets and posters.In case we collect twice the required sum, we will start working on the next Witcher Story — better, longer and even more fascinating.

And even if the funds don’t reach the goal, all the collected money will be used to deliver at least the English version of the film.

The Impact

Lost and Found is not an ordinary fan-made film. Our team of dedicated writers, actors, filmmakers and costume designers decided to tell you one more story about Geralt of Rivia and Ciri.  A story about love, doubt and danger.

Despite it’s our first project of such kind, the director and cameramen have a decent experience in Ukrainian cinematography. The rest of the team share an equal amount of talent, experience, hard work and love for the Witcher world.

We hope you cherish the same feelings towards the books by A. Sapkovsky, its world and characters. We did our best to carture the spirit of the source material and transform it into the story, every fan would enjoy.

Risks & Challenges

Since the shooting process is over and the hardest challenges are left behind, the rest of the work lies upon our director, voice actors and musicians from the band “Kings and Beggars”. Fortunately, all of them have enough experince and are already hardened in the fire of work.

Time is what they require the most. Since our team has to put aside their main jobs for the next several weeks in order to finish the production of Lost and Found, we feel the urge to compensate that time and that is why this campaign was made.

The finish line of the project is so close, but we still need your support.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone may be able to support us financially, but you can always do the simplest thing — let other people know about our project!

Lost and Found requires to be told about as well as to be funded. Share this project using the Indiegogo share tools, Facebook, Twitter etc. — and don’t forget to mention this campaign to your friends the next time you go out somewhere.

Every oren and every spoken word brings Lost and Found one step closer to its finish.

And we thank you a lot for all this.

story:
Relive Texas Tech Football Pirate Era

The Pirate Era of Texas Tech Football is undoubtedly one of the most exciting periods in program history! Join Texas Tech Alumni, Fans and Supporters in creating an unique Independent Documentary Film commemorating the Red Raiders! Our goals with Pirates Of The South Plains are:

  • To Celebrate and Commemorate the Pirate Era of Texas Tech Football through interviews with Players, Coaches, Alumni and Supporters closest to the action!
  • To Collaborate with Red Raiders everywhere to create the kind of documentary film that the Red Raider Nation will love!

How You Can Support The Pirates

We need your help in 3 ways:

  • Make a financial contribution to the film! Our film isn't backed by a movie studio or TV network, so support from awesome people like you will help bring Pirates Of The South Plains to life! We have some cool perks available and ways for you to actually appear in the film! Get ready for your close up!
  • Follow us on Facebook at www.Facebook.com/PiratesOfTheSouthPlains for updates on the film's progress and participants in the film! You can also let us know topics you want to see covered!
  • Share this campaign with others that love Texas Tech University, Red Raider Football and Sports Documentaries! Make some noise about this campaign!

How Funds Will Be Used?

Your financial contributions will be used in the following important areas:

  • Equipment Costs: Cameras, Mics, Lighting, etc
  • Travel Costs: Players, Coaches, Fans and Supporters from the Pirate Era are located throughout Texas and across America. We will travel to them for film interviews.
  • Post Production & Marketing Costs: Completing the final edit of the film and getting the word out to watch Pirates Of The South Plains! 

When Can I See The Film?

Depending on the availability of our subjects throughout the Fall, we anticipate having the film completed by early Summer of 2016. Once completed, there will be 2 ways you can watch Pirates Of The South Plains:

  • Video On Demand platforms (Vimeo and Amazon)
  • Local screenings planned with Texas Tech Alumni Chapters in various cities. We'd love to bring the film to your city!

More Than Just Football

While we are making this film about a specific era of Texas Tech Football, we will also relive exciting memories from:

  • The Goin' Band From Raiderland
  • Cheerleaders
  • Saddle Tramps
  • Raider Gate

And much, much more!

story:
Vaccines are safe, we’re told.  We hear it from the mainstream news media and from the government we wish we could trust.  The warnings are becoming more strident.  They are telling us there is absolutely no scientific doubt. They are implying that parents who hesitate to have their children vaccinated or who even question the safety of vaccines are committing an immoral act. 

But vaccines aren’t safe.  In spite of the denials, evidence from honest scientists is showing that vaccines are dangerous and that the science telling us otherwise has been corrupted.  For the future of our children, the true story must be told.

I’m Richard P. Milner. My background is in network news documentaries for ABC, NBC and PBS. I co-produced “Fooling with Nature,” a PBS Frontline documentary on endocrine disruptors, a class of synthetic chemicals that can interfere with many critical processes in our bodies including fertility. Some of the better known ones are the Dioxins, PCBs, BPA, and DES.

The program was aired, but that information was censored because network officials didn’t want to “alarm anyone.”  Still the program introduced a large audience to the dangers of a class of these chemicals.  That program took five years from concept to broadcast.  Since then media censorship has gotten worse. 

Several years ago, I began looking into the possible link between vaccines and autism. I’m the son of a doctor, so I expected to find overwhelming proof that there is no link.  Instead, I found the opposite.  There is a large body of scientific evidence against vaccination that goes back decades.  Not only are vaccines not as effective as advertised, they have injured a very large number of people.  The mainstream media will not touch this story -- much less give it the comprehensive reporting it calls for.

So I am asking you to help me produce Sick Nation: The Medical Mercury Health Crisis, a documentary film on the suppressed science of vaccine dangers.  It will present the evidence and the stories of vaccine victims.  Your donation will help ensure we can produce this groundbreaking film.

Sick Nation: The Medical Mercury Health Crisis begins with mercury and aluminum as chief culprits in our pandemic of chronic diseases and disorders and extends to the many serious poisons in vaccines.  As proposed, the program will use a set of virtual debates between proponents and critics of vaccines as the method of telling the vaccine injury story.

I invite you to watch our video, Haley vs. Offit, Do Vaccines Cause Autism? A Virtual Debate About The Greatest Medical Controversy Of Our Time.  This video is a small sample of the document we hope to produce.  It features a discussion between scientist Boyd Haley, PhD, and vaccine inventor/ pitchman, Paul Offit, MD.  It offers important insights on what can happen when industry profits, rather than human health, drive government vaccine recommendations and mandates.

Dr. Offit appears often on national television as an expert on vaccines, but refuses to debate. By not inviting any of his many critics, the mainstream media give the impression that he has none. This false impression leaves the public uninformed on the very real threats posed to children’s health through an overly aggressive vaccine program that now recommends children receive an astounding 48 vaccines by the age of six!

Dr. Offit and other forced vaccine proponents claim that the science is settled, that it overwhelmingly supports the idea that vaccines are very effective and very safe.  But the reality is different. In spite of massive industry influence and propaganda, the science directly counters that claim.  Vaccine proponents and the media simply ignore or suppress the studies, and the CDC refuses to record new cases of autism linked to vaccination.  (No. They have two vaccine injury reporting systems, which most doctors don’t use.  So only one to ten percent of injuries ever get reported.)

The mainstream media no longer report as they once did. There used to be a firewall between advertising and news, but that has been gone for some time.  Pharmaceutical corporations spend $4 billion per year on ads.  Where a major advertiser or program donor like big Pharma is concerned, media sides with the money, not with the injured. 

That’s why we need your help to produce the film and sidestep the mainstream media by promoting and distributing theatrically and over the Internet. Will you join us?

Vaccines have been controversial since the beginning. And the pharmaceutical industry has repeatedly lied to us about them.  There is evidence that many vaccines actually cause diseases and disorders they are meant to prevent, such as polio and measles, or cause other problems, such as chronic seizures and allergies.  Moreover, vaccines may make infectious diseases worse by delaying their onset and increasing their virulence. 

Big pharmaceutical corporations have not only suppressed the vaccine-autism link, they have also suppressed evidence that vaccines may be a major contributing factor or principal cause of other neurological problems, Alzheimer’s, Anaphylactic Shock, Asthma, Autoimmune and Cardiovascular Diseases, Cancer, Diabetes, Obesity, Sudden Infant Death Syndrome (SIDS) and Sudden Cardiac Arrest. 

Since 1986, the US Federal Court of Claims has awarded more than $2.3 billion compensation for vaccine injuries.  Originally meant as a simple no-fault procedure, cases today are hotly contested. Parents with limited funds go up against the US Department of Justice playing every legalistic trick with deep pockets of taxpayer money.  Leading pharmaceutical companies have paid billions of dollars to settle fraud accusations.  Yet fines and settlements appear to be merely a cost of doing business.  These stories are not reported in depth.

The top five pharmaceutical corporations have net profits exceeding the remaining 495 Fortune 500 companies combined!  To maintain their profitability, they’ve made slight variations to drug formulations, all-in-one vaccines, and delivery systems as patents are about to run out, illegally promoted off-label uses, paid doctors to sign their names to articles custom-written by drug marketing departments, and hid information on drug dangers from the FDA and the public.  Today few new drugs with billion-dollar profit potential are in the development pipeline. But more than 200 new vaccines are.  Moreover, ever since ratification of The National Vaccine Injury Act of 1986, corporations have no liability. 

Since 1986, the CDC has been charged with promoting vaccines.  They have been able to put into place a nationwide Mandatory Childhood Vaccine Schedule that calls for 69 doses of 16 different vaccines before age 18, beginning on day of birth.

Pregnant women are being advised to vaccinate, which means mercury and aluminum exposure during the most vulnerable points of fetal development.  In most states parents can claim vaccine exemptions.  But with Dr. Offit leading the charge, national and state legislatures are moving or have moved to close exemptions, leaving parents no choice but to vaccinate if they want their child to attend school or daycare.

The myth of vaccine effectiveness is powerful.  Time after time vaccines have been shown to be not as effective as advertised.  But most people still believe in them because they only hear the pro-vaccine message.

When vaccines do work, they lose their effect within 2-10 years, making so-called “herd immunity” impossible.  The term “herd immunity” was co-opted by the vaccine industry.  Actual herd immunity doesn’t come from vaccines, but is a status attained by a population after a sufficient number have been infected naturally and develop immunity naturally--not an immunity of a few years, but lifetime immunity.

Another myth is that vaccines are free or that the vaccine industry makes very little money on them.  Taking as an example all children born in 2010, if the vaccine industry can attain a vaccination rate of 90%, they stand to make $5.273 billion on that group. For the same group, the government stands to receive $129.023 million in vaccine taxes.  Doctors will make $3,033 per child or $14.615 billion for the group. The pharmaceutical corporations then make additional billions selling drugs to treat the resulting sicknesses and disorders to the half of our children who now have a chronic medical condition.

Why would these corporations put the health of children above profits?  They’ve captured the CDC, which promotes their product at no cost to them, and they can’t be sued.  One way to stop them is with education, the same as it was with exposing the link between smoking and cancer.  We need to disseminate the facts as widely and forcefully and often as possible. 

Our documentary is one part of an independent media movement to counter the pharmaceutical corporations’ propaganda.  Now, more than ever, we need you!  You can help us complete this documentary and distribute it widely by sharing our link with your friends and by making a donation.

Our budget for completion is $182,691, a mere fraction of the spending by the other side.

You can make the difference by sharing our link with your friends and by making your own donation.  If not you, who?  If not now, when?

Richard P. Milner

Executive Director

Public Affairs Media, Inc.

All contributions are tax deductible.

Public Affairs Media, Inc. is an independent 501(c)(3) non-profit organization established to produce investigative and historical reporting on substantive national and international issues.  It was founded on the premise that if democracy is to survive, the public must be informed and leadership made accountable through a free press, and that freedom of the press depends on the freedom and duty of the individual journalist to identify, explore, and explain the important issues of the day in a fair, accurate and complete manner.

story:
Come Out and Play!

Come along and see what the other side of the tech community is doing about your data.  With all of the breaches occurring these days, is there anyone who is working to protect your data?  You may be asking yourself, I thought I was protected?  You expect to be secure and then wonder........ What Security?!?!

What is going on?

Who is learning, working, and training the next generation of professionals against the next wave of criminals?!    Security B-Sides MSP excites, educates, and provides the resources needed by those that want to protect you and your information.  

Security B-sides MSP is passionate about broadening the outreach and education of those who are not familiar with what is actually happening in the security community.  We need your help in reaching a different audience to show what is actually happening with those protecting your information.

You have the opportunity to help inform and educate those that would not hear or understand what is happening to their information and who is working to protect it.  Passionate IT professionals work hard to protect your data from others that would like to take it. What is being done and why are they doing it?

Risks & Challenges

For us increase the quality of professionals, change must occur.  The biggest challenge and risk comes from with in the community itself.  Those who fear change are many times to biggest enemy to progress.  This can be summed up with the following..... Why should I get a car if I have a horse and buggy?

Other Ways You Can

Help tell everyone what is really going on and drive them to affect change!

Change will only happen when those who value quality above all else, deliberately  and consistently drive the change that is needed.  Watch the people who risk their reputation to help others wanting to be part of the change! 

The Producer and Editor

Jew DreamFirstBorn, originally from New York City, is an award winning local film maker and photographer in Minneapolis, MN. He graduated from The Arts Institute with a Bachlors of Sciences in Digital Video Film Production. He has had work shown at The Guthrie and has worked on many films that have appeared in local film festivals. 

His photographs have been published in the Star Tribune, VitaMN, City Pages, MN Monthly. He recently wrapped on the feature film production "Forgotten" directed by Joel Soisson and produced by Mike Leahy. He also publishes a monthly portrait magazine called Paper Crayons: Portraits. He has photographed celebrities including: President Barack Obama, Lenny Kravits, Janet Jackson, Dave Chappelle, Olivia Newton-John and Finoa Apple just to name a few.

Why should I get a car if I have a horse and buggy? 
  Other Ways You Can 
Help tell everyone what is really going on and drive them to affect change!Change will only happen when those who value quality above all else, deliberately  and consistently drive the change that is needed.  Watch the people who risk their reputation to help others wanting to be part of the change!  The Producer and Editor


Jew
DreamFirstBorn, originally from New York City, is an award winning local film
maker and photographer in Minneapolis, MN. He graduated from The Arts
Institute with a Bachlors of Sciences in Digital Video Film Production. He has
had work shown at The Guthrie and has worked on many films that have appeared
in local film festivals.  
His photographs
have been published in the Star Tribune, VitaMN, City Pages, MN Monthly. He
recently wrapped on the feature film production "Forgotten" directed
by Joel Soisson and produced by Mike Leahy. He also publishes a monthly
portrait magazine called Paper Crayons: Portraits. He has photographed
celebrities including: President Barack Obama, Lenny Kravits, Janet Jackson,
Dave Chappelle, Olivia Newton-John and Finoa Apple just to name a few.

story:
Hey, everyone. I’m Cruz Maria Santibanez, a native of Clinton, North Carolina. Let me tell you a little about myself before I go into our mission. In 2008, at the age of 17, I was burned on 68% of my body because of a machine malfunction at work. After re-integrating into society, I quickly learned I had been labeled. I was now ‘different.’ I had physical scars. It was then that I decided to pursue a career within the entertainment industry with one goal in mind: change the stigma of what a perfect body and image should be.

          Truth at its finest, I am not the only who has faced obstacles or has experienced trials and tribulations, and I was reaffirmed when I met these two phenomenal women: Megan Blanton  and Margarita Phannavong. We all have a story to tell, and that’s why we have come together to bring you #ThePossible.

          #ThePossible will be a unique show hosted on YouTube beginning August 2015 starring Margarita Phannavong and Cruz Santibanez with a mission including but not limited to showcasing survivors of adversity who will share their stories to inspire and foster global unity. However we can’t do this alone, so we ask that all overcomers help aid us in the overcoming by making this show a reality. #ThePossible will be launching an IndieGogo funding page Thursday, May 14 until Wednesday, July 1 in the hopes to raise $5,000. This amount will cover all equipment costs of production including a camera, computer, editing software, and a lighting kit.

          Allow #ThePossible expand horizons by helping others all around the world. Join us in spreading the word! Share this with someone you think will be inspired by our mission and would feel empowered and hopeful from meaningful discussions. Contributions of any amount will be highly appreciated. From the bottom, top, and corners of our hearts…we say, thank you in advance.

Humbly yours,

#ThePossible

story:
the opportunity

We suddenly have an opportunity to apply for a "Good to Great" grant from the state of Connecticut. This special grant, offered for the first time, will provide historic sites with up-to $125,000 for a transformative change -- in our case, this change would be to restore the historic New London Harbor 'Pequot' Lighthouse dock so that we, visitors, and the US Coast Guard can get to Harbor Light by boat!

The dock is estimated to cost about $175,000. The grant would pay up-to $125,000 but requires a 25% match at the time of the application. If we apply for the full amount, that match would be $31,250. This total would get us pretty close to being able to complete the entire dock project.

This offer also means that every one dollar contributed to this campaign is matched x 4  by the grant to equal $5!

The grant was announced on June 11. The matching funds must be in-hand at the time of the application: July 11, 2015. But whatever the grant outcome, we will go ahead with the dock!

New London Harbor 'Pequot' Light is the oldest and tallest lighthouse on Long Island Sound. According to the US Coast Guard, from the lantern at Pequot Light, one can see more lighthouse than from any other place on earth! Don't you want to see that?!

the offer

Every contribution is appreciated and we thank you for considering this effort to keep a beloved icon open to the public.
We have a number of Perks available (see right), but it's your support that matters most. There is strength in numbers. If we each contribute just a small amount, we will get there.

the issue

Yes, there is a serious issue we now have to discuss.
If it were not for a temporary injunction issued on June 19, 2015, we could not get to our own lighthouse! The new neighbors on both sides of the lighthouse are preventing our access and costing us a great deal of money in legal fees.

New London Maritime Society believes that you--the American public-- built the lighthouses. You own the lighthouses (through us -- a non-profit 501(c) 3 charitable organization, which is steward of three lighthouses, and which is overseen by the National Park Service). And you deserve to have access to the lighthouses. Lighthouses are our history. As one European visitor put it, they are America’s castles.

This is the 15th anniversary of the National Lighthouse Preservation Act of 2000. In the history of the Act, no single organization has even been awarded ownership of three lighthouses -- and may I add, three such spectacular lighthouses: New London Harbor 'Pequot', Race Rock, and New London Ledge Lights. New London Maritime Society, with its educational 'Lighthouse Kids' programs, boat tours, partnerships in the community, and special events, is the poster child for Lighthouse Preservation.

In fact, New London Harbor Light was among the first group of six lighthouses offered for disposal by the GSA in 2002 -- The New London Maritime Society applied for the lighthouse in 2002 and Harbor Light was awarded to the Society soon thereafter. The actual conveyance ceremony took place eight years later in October 2010.  This Lighthouse Matters!


Currently NLMS is defending the rights of the public to have access to their lighthouses in court! In a lawsuit filed by a neighbor to Harbor Light, our lawyers have filed a 'Motion to Dismiss' which argues in favor of federal primacy in all zoning disputes with these historic American beacons. If this motion is granted, we will have won a battle for all civic groups working to preserve their local lighthouses.

Across five years of programming, New London Maritime Society has successfully established New London, Connecticut, as a true 'Lighthouse Hub. People now recognize the city has a wealth of diverse lighthouses just off shore. Businesses promote the idea, our director was awarded Elk's 2015 'Citizen of the Year' and the Society received formal recognition from New London's Economic Development Commission for it's work to turn New London into a 'Lighthouse Hub'. We are supported by a terrific board of trustees, who are workers and givers to this campaign. At our board meeting on Thursday, June 25, trustees pledged cash & check donations for 12 planks not recorded on this on-line tally!

Like the City of New London itself, the New London Maritime Society is small, poor, and understaffed. But we are trying to make things a little better in the world. Preserving these historic shared community icons, maintaining the public's right to access these landmarks, and working to support the US Coast Guard -- which still maintains the lanterns to keep our mariners safe -- is something we feel we can do.

the other issue

We have been successful at establishing New London as the region's 'Lighthouse Hub'. One way we did this was with a successful program of lighthouse boat tours. These trips are our single most-successful fund-raising activity.
But this summer we are facing competition in the lighthouse tour category. This is not a bad thing because at our core we believe in and advocate for lighthouse and history education. However, to continue to earn the donations necessary to restore and maintain our lighthouses, we need to keep our tours successful. One good way to do that is to differentiate what we offer. Already our Sunset and Full-Moon tours are unique. By adding some tours that can land at the dock at Harbor Lighthouse to visit inside the lighthouse by boat we will be able to offer another unique experience.
The dock also will bypass the problems we currently are having with both our neighbors, who are preventing our access by land to the lighthouse.
We really need that dock!

the challenges

Restoring the historic dock at the lighthouse and exercising our riparian rights will allow us access to the lighthouse during reasonable weather and when we can afford to hire one of our local captains to ferry us over. But we still have a long haul ahead of us with the legal issues with our neighbors to establish a path by land. We fear that the neighbor bringing the lawsuit can tie up this little non-profit for quite some time -- and this appears to be the plan.

We do believe that our rights will be upheld in court, and with that battle won, we'll have struck a blow for all lighthouse friends groups. We also will have made the option of adopting a lighthouse a bit less daunting for other groups like us, who fear this kind of treatment from NIMBY neighbors on the waterfront!

want to help?

There are ways to help other than to contribute:
  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you!

story:
What's It All About? 

That's the age old question, isn't it? What are relationships all about? Why get into a relationship when all your others have ended? Isn't it just a waste of time if you're not going to end up with that person forever? 

My name is Drew Emery, and I haven't figured any of that out either. 

At twenty-one years old, I've been in relationships, had my heart broken, and have even maybe sort-of-possibly been in love before... 

...but I still don't know the secret behind a successful relationship. 


That's where this film comes in.

How We Were follows the story of Tim and Ella, high school students who date for a six-month period. In the film, we see their past and their present play out simultaneously. 

Tim is a typical high school senior, a guy who acts like he knows exactly what he's doing; but of course, he has no clue.  He is what you might call creatively challenged and is afraid to make something, or indeed anything, by himself. That's why he starts hanging out with Ella.  She is the girl next store, with an artistic flare. This story follows them as they fall in, and out, of love.  

What's the point, then, if they don't end up together? Well I'd like to think that even if a relationship doesn't work out, we learn something from the other person, and maybe we're even better because of them.


That's what Tim and Ella teach us. 

What We've Done So Far

We have already shot the film, and now need the money to finish it. We are looking to refund the costs incurred during the production of the film, and to cover the costs of post production. 

One of the aforementioned expenses was building a set for a scene that takes place in an abandoned house. It took time and money to transform the production designers basement into a set.

Below are some before and after pictures.

BEFORE

AFTER


STILL FROM THE FILM



What We Need and What You Get

We are looking for $2,000 to complete the film and get it off to festivals.

Here's a breakdown of how the money will be spent...


Other Ways You Can Help

Can't donate? That's okay! You can still help out the cause. Share our link on Facebook and Twitter. Spread the word to relatives and friends. 


And That’s All There Is To It.

Thank you to everyone out there who is not only helping out, but also is being supportive in general. Can't do it without you.

story:
After 8 years in the making, we can finally share the story of how former Russian Lt. Colonel, Stanislav Petrov saved the world on September 26th, 1983.

Few people know him, but every person on the planet was affected by his actions that September night: The Soviet Nuclear Early Warning Center reported that the United States launched five nuclear missiles, and in 40 minutes they would hit their targets in Russia. Petrov was on duty that night and in the moments that followed, he overruled the system's warning, personally declaring that it was a false alarm. He went against military protocol and refused to retaliate, until he could confirmn the moments that followed, he overruled the system's warning, personally see eclaring that it was a false alarm. He went against military protocol and refused to retaliate, until he could  the missiles in the sky with his own eyes. They never came and because of his decision we are all alive today.

This false nuclear attack warning is cited by CIA analyst Peter Pry as "the single most dangerous incident of the early 1980s."

The film also tells the story of how the man who saved us all –  a man broken by the system, a man who for decades were unable to overcome his own downfall – learns to face his personal demons and ultimately finds redemption.


"All in all, this might just be one of the most important films of our time! Maybe even of all time!"  5 Stars –The Fancarpet.com.


The events of September 26, 1983 remain a stark example of the precarious situation we still find ourselves in. There are over 3000 nuclear missiles on hair trigger alert today; close calls and mistakes happen – more often than you think...
With tension building around the nuclear agreement in Iran, threats from North Korea, nuclear tension between India and Pakistan it is important that we all join the conversation and voice our opinion.

Stanislav Petrov's courageous decision deserves recognition and you can help shine a light on the issue. By bringing the film to a wide audience, you can participate in the prevailing, global discussion on nuclear weapons and help make a difference. We have partnered with numerous organizations to help further the current debate on nuclear weapons, to engage public opinion, and to facilitate international policy change.

"How does it feel to walk the earth and know that it almost wouldn't be here, if it weren't for your decision?""  – Walter Cronkite

Help us BRING STANISLAV PETROV to the United States in mid October 2015.

We are planning several events for Stanislav to attend in the U.S. to show him our gratitude. We need your help to make this happen:
  • He will be honored at the Parliaments for Religions conference in Salt Lake City on October 17th 
  • He will receive a Peace Prize at the Conference 
  • He will receive our #ThankYouPetrov Award 
  • There are two more events in the works to be announced very soon!

#THANKYOUPETROV: PRIZE AWARD AND CEREMONY.  (Live Stream)

To acknowledge our gratitude that Stanislav saved our lives and our planet, we will present him with a prize and a grant with your name on it. You will gain access to the exclusive lifestream award ceremony.  The award presented to Stanislav will include each and every name who donated to this campaign. 


EXCLUSIVE, LIMITED RELEASE SCREENINGS FOR PEACE WEEK 2015

Pre-buy tickets to SELECT SCREENINGS in New York, Los Angeles, Detroit, and Portland.

September 18th, 2015 the film will have an exclusive, limited release in select theaters to honor Stanislav Petrov and to celebrate the following important dates:

  1. International Day for the Total Elimination of Nuclear Weapons (Stanislav Petrov Day – Sept 26th)
  2. International Peace Day (Sept. 21st)
  3. The Pope visiting the United States, to address peace and disarmament. 

WE CAN'T THINK OF A BETTER TIME TO THANK STANISLAV PETROV!!!


Featuring Kevin Costner with appearances by Walter Cronkite, Robert De Niro, Matt Damon, and Ashton Kutcher.



If you live in one of these cities you can pre-buy a ticket to a screening. Please specify, when you buy a Perk that includes a ticket, which screening you want to attend.
NEW YORK.
Cinema Village – September 18th to September 24th.
All week: 1:00pm, 3:05pm, 5:10pm, 7:15pm, 9:20pm
PORTLAND.

Clinton Street Theater –September 18th to September 21st.
Fri, 18th: 4:00pm - Sat, 19th: 2:00pm - Sun, 20th: 4:00pm - Mon, 21st: 7:00pm

LOS ANGELES.
Arena Cinema Hollywood – September 25th to October 1st.
Fri, 25th: 6:00pm - Sat, 26th: 2:20pm - Sun, 27th: 2:00pm, 6:00pm - Mon, 28th: 9:30pm - Tue, 29th: 6:25pm - Wed, 30th: 9:30pm - Thurs, 1st: 8:00pm
DETROIT.
Cinema Detroit – September 25th to October 1st.
Fri, 25: 7:30pm - Sat, 26: 7:30pm - Sun, 27: 5:30pm - Mon, 28: 7:30pm - Tues, 29: 7:30pm - Weds, 30: 7:30pm - Thurs, Oct. 1: 7:30pm


You can help us tell the story of how Stanislav Petrov Saved the World. Use these social media links and # to spread the word!
#ThankYouPetrov      #TheManWhoSavedTheWorld     #StanislavPetrov
#ThinkWithYourHeart      #MakeTheEnemyYourFriend
FACEBOOK    TWITTER   YOUTUBE    



Each Perk level includes all perks above it. (Except the Select Screening Ticket).






*Digital Streams, Downloads, DVD or Blurays will not be immediately available.
**Tickets are only available in select cities, select dates and times. See buy tickets sections for details.


We would like you to help us screen the film all over the world.
The film has many friends who have all joined together to fill Movie Theaters, Parliaments, Church Halls, and College Auditoriums. Join in these efforts and schedule a screening near you. Spread the word.


In celebration of Stanislav Petrov, the film will be screened exclusively around the world in the following locations:
USA: New York, Los Angeles, Portland, Detroit, Albany, Wilmington, Fayetteville
EUROPE: Berlin, Vienna, Basel, Bern, Zürich, Helsinki, Amsterdam
AUSTRALIA: Sydney, Brisbane, Perth
NEW ZEALAND: Wellington, Auckland
INDIA: Delhi
RUSSIA: Zelenongor
JORDAN

*We will update map as more cities sign on.

We have set our initial goal at $25,000.

1) This will enable us to get Stanislav to come the US. To cover airfares, hotels, and other travel costs, an interpreter, and a nurse/companion we need your help.
2)  We will give 20% of your support directly to Stanislav as a prize award, and if we go beyond our goal we will continue to send money to Stanislav.
3) Enable us to set up the live stream Award Ceremony.

Here is how your money will be spent:


The film premiered in theaters in the UK and Denmark in May/June of 2015. The reviews have been incredible and the press is heralding the film as breaking new ground in terms of engaging, original film making. 

More importantly, the film is being used to educate high school and college students about the dangers of nuclear weapons, the value of peaceful coexistence, and making informed decisions about future existential risks. 

Here are some quotes about the film:

"The precariousness and damn near unlikeliness that we survived the Cold War without killing off our civilization has never been better highlighted than with The Man Who Saved the World."  – The Flick Philosopher

"A True and Powerful Story"  – The Hollywood Reporter

"A Pearl! Heartbreaking! Impressive!"  – Sound Venue

Best Feature Film – Sunscreen Film Festival

Audience Award Winner for Best Narrative Feature, Honorable Mention –Woodstock Film Festival 
James Lyons Award for Best Editing of a Narrative Feature, Honorable Mention – Woodstock Film Festival 

Audience Award – DocVille (Belgium)
CPH:DOX (Denmark), five additional screenings due to audience demand

The following groups, in alphabetical order, have pledged their support for our film around the world. We want to thank them all deeply for their support and for the important work they do every day for peace and education:

Global Security Institute (GSI). gsinstitute.org

Global Zero. globalzero.org

International Campaign to Abolish Nuclear Weapons (ICAN). icanw.org

International Physicians for the Prevention of Nuclear War (IPPNW). ippnw.org

Massachusetts Peace Action (MPA).  masspeaceaction.org

National Association of Evangelicals (NAE). nae.net

Nuclear Threats Initiative (NTI).  nti.org

Parliamentarians for Nuclear Non-proliferation and Disarmament (PNND). pnnd.org

Physicians for Social Responsibility (PSR).  psr.org

PragueVision Institute for Sustainable Security.  praguevision.org

Religions for Peace (RFP).  religionsforpeace.org 

The Utah Campaign to Abolish Nuclear Weapons (UCAN). utahcan.org
Universal Models for Peace. universalmodelsforpeace.org
Unfold Zero. unfoldzero.org

The Union of Concerned Scientists (UCS). ucsusa.org

World Evangelical Alliance (WEA).  worldea.org

With tension building around the nuclear agreement in Iran, threats from North Korea, nuclear tension between India and Pakistan it is important that we all join the conversation and voice our opinion.Woodstock Film Festival
story_txt:
After 8 years in the making, we can finally share the story of how former Russian Lt. Colonel, Stanislav Petrov saved the world on September 26th, 1983.
Few people know him, but every person on the planet was affected by his actions that September night: The Soviet Nuclear Early Warning Center reported that the United States launched five nuclear missiles, and in 40 minutes they would hit their targets in Russia. Petrov was on duty that night and in the moments that followed, he overruled the system's warning, personally declaring that it was a false alarm. He went against military protocol and refused to retaliate, until he could confirmn the moments that followed, he overruled the system's warning, personally see eclaring that it was a false alarm. He went against military protocol and refused to retaliate, until he could  the missiles in the sky with his own eyes. They never came and because of his decision we are all alive today.
This false nuclear attack warning is cited by CIA analyst Peter Pry as "the single most dangerous incident of the early 1980s."
The film also tells the story of how the man who saved us all –  a man broken by the system, a man who for decades were unable to overcome his own downfall – learns to face his personal demons and ultimately finds redemption.



"All in all, this might just be one of the most important films of our time! Maybe even of all time!"  5 Stars –The Fancarpet.com.



The events of September 26, 1983 remain a stark example of the precarious situation we still find ourselves in. There are over 3000 nuclear missiles on hair trigger alert today; close calls and mistakes happen – more often than you think...With tension building around the nuclear agreement in Iran, threats from North Korea, nuclear tension between India and Pakistan it is important that we all join the conversation and voice our opinion.
Stanislav Petrov's courageous decision deserves recognition and you can help shine a light on the issue. By bringing the film to a wide audience, you can participate in the prevailing, global discussion on nuclear weapons and help make a difference. We have partnered with numerous organizations to help further the current debate on nuclear weapons, to engage public opinion, and to facilitate international policy change.





"How does it feel to walk the earth and know that it almost wouldn't be here, if it weren't for your decision?""  – Walter Cronkite



Help us BRING STANISLAV PETROV to the United States in mid October 2015.
We are planning several events for Stanislav to attend in the U.S. to show him our gratitude. We need your help to make this happen:


He will be honored at the Parliaments for Religions conference in Salt Lake City on October 17th 


He will receive a Peace Prize at the Conference 
He will receive our #ThankYouPetrov Award 
There are two more events in the works to be announced very soon!





#THANKYOUPETROV: PRIZE AWARD AND CEREMONY.  (Live Stream)
To acknowledge our gratitude that Stanislav saved our lives and our planet, we will present him with a prize and a grant with your name on it. You will gain access to the exclusive lifestream award ceremony.  The award presented to Stanislav will include each and every name who donated to this campaign. 




EXCLUSIVE, LIMITED RELEASE SCREENINGS FOR PEACE WEEK 2015
Pre-buy tickets to SELECT SCREENINGS in New York, Los Angeles, Detroit, and Portland.
September 18th, 2015 the film will have an exclusive, limited release in select theaters to honor Stanislav Petrov and to celebrate the following important dates:


International Day for the Total Elimination of Nuclear Weapons (Stanislav Petrov Day – Sept 26th)
International Peace Day (Sept. 21st)
The Pope visiting the United States, to address peace and disarmament. 

WE CAN'T THINK OF A BETTER TIME TO THANK STANISLAV PETROV!!!



Featuring Kevin Costner with appearances by Walter Cronkite, Robert De Niro, Matt Damon, and Ashton Kutcher.




If you live in one of these cities you can pre-buy a ticket to a screening. Please specify, when you buy a Perk that includes a ticket, which screening you want to attend.

NEW YORK.Cinema Village – September 18th to September 24th.All week: 1:00pm, 3:05pm, 5:10pm, 7:15pm, 9:20pm

PORTLAND.Clinton Street Theater –September 18th to September 21st.Fri, 18th: 4:00pm - Sat, 19th: 2:00pm - Sun, 20th: 4:00pm - Mon, 21st: 7:00pm


LOS ANGELES.Arena Cinema Hollywood – September 25th to October 1st.Fri, 25th: 6:00pm - Sat, 26th: 2:20pm - Sun, 27th: 2:00pm, 6:00pm - Mon, 28th: 9:30pm - Tue, 29th: 6:25pm - Wed, 30th: 9:30pm - Thurs, 1st: 8:00pm

DETROIT.Cinema Detroit – September 25th to October 1st.Fri, 25: 7:30pm - Sat, 26: 7:30pm - Sun, 27: 5:30pm - Mon, 28: 7:30pm - Tues, 29: 7:30pm - Weds, 30: 7:30pm - Thurs, Oct. 1: 7:30pm








You can help us tell the story of how Stanislav Petrov Saved the World. Use these social media links and # to spread the word!
#ThankYouPetrov      #TheManWhoSavedTheWorld     #StanislavPetrov#ThinkWithYourHeart      #MakeTheEnemyYourFriend
FACEBOOK    TWITTER   YOUTUBE    

Each Perk level includes all perks above it. (Except the Select Screening Ticket).






















*Digital Streams, Downloads, DVD or Blurays will not be immediately available.**Tickets are only available in select cities, select dates and times. See buy tickets sections for details.





We would like you to help us screen the film all over the world. The film has many friends who have all joined together to fill Movie Theaters, Parliaments, Church Halls, and College Auditoriums. Join in these efforts and schedule a screening near you. Spread the word.








In celebration of Stanislav Petrov, the film will be screened exclusively around the world in the following locations:
USA: New York, Los Angeles, Portland, Detroit, Albany, Wilmington, FayettevilleEUROPE: Berlin, Vienna, Basel, Bern, Zürich, Helsinki, AmsterdamAUSTRALIA: Sydney, Brisbane, PerthNEW ZEALAND: Wellington, AucklandINDIA: DelhiRUSSIA: ZelenongorJORDAN




*We will update map as more cities sign on.

We have set our initial goal at $25,000.
1) This will enable us to get Stanislav to come the US. To cover airfares, hotels, and other travel costs, an interpreter, and a nurse/companion we need your help.2)  We will give 20% of your support directly to Stanislav as a prize award, and if we go beyond our goal we will continue to send money to Stanislav.3) Enable us to set up the live stream Award Ceremony.
Here is how your money will be spent:





The film premiered in theaters in the UK and Denmark in May/June of 2015. The reviews have been incredible and the press is heralding the film as breaking new ground in terms of engaging, original film making. 
More importantly, the film is being used to educate high school and college students about the dangers of nuclear weapons, the value of peaceful coexistence, and making informed decisions about future existential risks. 
Here are some quotes about the film:
"The precariousness and damn near unlikeliness that we survived the Cold War without killing off our civilization has never been better highlighted than with The Man Who Saved the World."  – The Flick Philosopher
"A True and Powerful Story"  – The Hollywood Reporter
"A Pearl! Heartbreaking! Impressive!"  – Sound Venue


Best Feature Film – Sunscreen Film Festival
Audience Award Winner for Best Narrative Feature, Honorable Mention –Woodstock Film Festival James
Lyons Award for Best Editing of a Narrative Feature, Honorable Mention – Woodstock Film Festival 
Audience Award – DocVille (Belgium)CPH:DOX (Denmark), five additional screenings due to audience demand

The following groups, in alphabetical order, have pledged their support for our film around the world. We want to thank them all deeply for their support and for the important work they do every day for peace and education:



Global Security Institute (GSI). gsinstitute.org
Global Zero. globalzero.org
International Campaign to Abolish Nuclear Weapons (ICAN). icanw.org
International Physicians for the Prevention of Nuclear War (IPPNW). ippnw.org
Massachusetts Peace Action (MPA).  masspeaceaction.org
National Association of Evangelicals (NAE). nae.net
Nuclear Threats Initiative (NTI).  nti.org
Parliamentarians for Nuclear Non-proliferation and Disarmament (PNND). pnnd.org
Physicians for Social Responsibility (PSR).  psr.org
PragueVision Institute for Sustainable Security.  praguevision.org
Religions for Peace (RFP).  religionsforpeace.org 





The Utah Campaign to Abolish Nuclear Weapons (UCAN). utahcan.org


Universal Models for Peace. universalmodelsforpeace.org


Unfold Zero. unfoldzero.org


The Union of Concerned Scientists (UCS). ucsusa.org
World Evangelical Alliance (WEA).  worldea.org

With tension building around the nuclear agreement in Iran, threats from North Korea, nuclear tension between India and Pakistan it is important that we all join the conversation and voice our opinion.Woodstock Film Festival

story:
WHO WE ARE AND OUR SPIRIT

Hi guys!

My name is Mikhail Yusupov. Nice to meet you all !

WE ARE NOT GOING TO TELL YOU A LONG STORY ABOUT US - ENTHUSIASTS, NOT SILLY GUYS, A LITTLE REBELLIOUS. IN GENERAL, ORDINARY PEOPLE LIKE YOU :)

The team that we have doesn’t  solely consists of doctors  and phds in science...  we are more romantic and rebelious bunch and we are happy with that,  because only romantics have done, are doing and always will do  breakthoughs findings for civilization. In truth, we don’t even have experience in making documentaries. But we have a lot of energy and a great will to do it !

Always be open-minded to new revolutionary bits of information and knowledge in general. Do not be afraid to explore, talk and discuss something new, unusual, sometimes mind boggling.  Then and only then nothing and no-one would be able to stop the progress on our planet ! 


ALL GREAT DISCOVERIES HAVE BEEN MADE BY 

“ROMANTIC REVOLUTIONARIES” FROM SCIENCE!


OUR GOAL

We want to conduct a large, independent study of the history of the planet Earth and human civilization (how it actually happened). As a result shoot a great documentary film, which will depict the most interesting and controversial mysteries of Earth's civilization. Everything in the film will be greatly supported with facts which in turn will not leave the audience wondering if its  another fiction.

Humanity must know the truth about its’ past and the past of the planet. We can not stick our heads in the sand when another fact emerges, thus causing one to doubt generally accepted "historical theory" of the origin of modern civilization (and ancient: the Sumerians, Maya, ancient Egypt, and the like).

The past. What do we know about it?

How real is the historical theory, which we are taught in schools?

Is  "Darwin’s" generally accepted theory  true?

How long does humanity exists on our planet?

And many other questions in doubt.

Perhaps each of us asked at least on one of the above questions, or heard about them. Why are there so many artifacts (which conveniently are considered fake), historical chronicles (so called myths) that do not correspond to what is written in the books.

Below is a selection of the most "harmless" films about controversy in  official science:

 «The Young Age of the Earth»


«The Mysterious Origins of Man»


  

«Ica Stones» 


Believe me, there are a lot of films like those, and even more facts. For example - what do you know about the pyramids? That they exist only in Egypt and South America? But they are both in China and Europe, and according to some reports, in the heart of the Bermuda Triangle, as well as Antarctica. https://www.google.com/maps/search/79'58'12.0+''s81'56'24.0''w/@-79.975827,-81.943331,1586m/data=!3m1!1e3?hl=ka

You can say - well, it's too much. But what about  the mysterious map of the earth of the Turkish Admiral  Peri Reis  which he created in 1513 and it was discovered in 1929 but is homologated by all. This map, according to the American researcher Professor Charles Hutchins Hapgood - striking in its accuracy and comparable to modern maps (created using aerial photo shoot). By the way, it depicts Antarctica free of ice ...

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Piri_Reis_map

So, there are a lot of puzzles in our past. As much as "possible" responses to them set out in many articles or documentaries. With your help, we will try to (absolutely not biased, because our budget is up to you, and does not depend on a major media structures or rich sponsors who needs certain result) study all puzzles, and give answers to them, with a maximum of evidential base. And who knows what new horizons of knowledge,our research will be able to give the mankind. 

THE TRUTH IN OUR WORLD IS RELATIVE. 

THOSE WHO STRIVE TO FIND IT - WILL FIND IT !



 How Much Do We Need 

Many of you probably have a question - why such a strange figure on the project budget, $ 1,981,600, it has arisen from our calculation and this figure is accurate. With this money we plan to conduct the expedition and research in 15 countries + Antarctica Expedition which will be the most expensive. In each of the countries we are planning to spend AT LEAST 14 days, in which we will visit all the most famous and mysterious places, conduct research of artifacts and megalithic structures, shoot interviews with prominent scientists in these countries, going to send  all  found artifacts for the examination . At the end of our trip (which will end at least in 12 months), expeditionary activities and the filmed materials we will transgress to the structuring of knowledge and mount documentary. It will take us about 6 months. Total minimum term of the project : 18 months, the minimum budget of $ 1,981,600. 

That is the minimum because in the process there are going to appear a lot of additional facts that we might want to study, some deeper than others. It is like "Disney Worldwee" you always plan to spend some money, but often go beyond what is permitted, because of the large number of temptations :))


 How We Will Use Funds 

Each expedition will take at least $ 83 600...

It includes:

·  Examination of all artifacts that we are going find

·  Permits for excavation

·  Hiring people on the ground

·  Costs of transfers and accommodation



OUR THANKS & WHAT YOU GET



Challenges

For sure we will have difficulties, and probably a lot ! And we have to study a lot of new things for us. But we are confident that we can overcome them and put all our efforts to implement this project!

This project is only the beginning, as soon as it is completed, we will launch even more ambitious project that is so incredible that if we were to  start it now, it would have very little chance of success, because of its scale. Only with your help we will be able to implement it, and only then we will prove you that we are capable to realize the project "Forgotten past"!


Other Ways You Can Help Us

Well, that is the plan. We’re all hoping very much for your help, not only financial, but informational, email us, all the mysteries (and maybe the answers) that you think deserve to be explored !


P.S. Accounts Twitter / Instagram / YouTube were created specifically for the project. And will be updated as quickly as possible.


THANK YOU ALL !

Mikhail Yusupov and our Team !

story:
For many children, summer months are filled with exciting learning experiences and adventures that help them to grow and thrive.  We at the Boys & Girls Club of Harlem want to provide opportunities for Harlem’s children to do just that by offering a subsidized summer enrichment experience that builds their mind, body and spirit; preparing them for the school year ahead. 

Join us in supporting over 60 children this year access the Boys & Girls Club of Harlem summer camp by giving a High $5.  Your donation will support camp scholarships to help offset some of the costs and make the camp experience affordable for parents.  Giving them both the peace of mind and support to keep their children safe during these summer months.

 

After you give your donation, share a picture or post of you and a friend giving each other a High $5 on Facebook, Instagram or Twitter with the hashtag #High5ForHarlembgc. Showing your support for the club and all that we do for the children in the Harlem community we serve.

 

 

Boys & Girls Club of Harlem Mission
The mission of the Boys & Girls Club of Harlem is to provide access and opportunities for youth to reach their full potential as responsible members of the community.  For more information visit our website at www.harlembgc.org.
