story:
Our Collective Defined

Wide eyes. Endless questions. Nothing to lose. Tabula rasa.

A kid. 

The ruggedness of talent can lead to stumbling of the heart, the rawness of potential can fog the mind, and blind ambition can yield disruptive relentlessness. 

And it is difficult to stop a kid once resolute with an idea. It becomes exponentially more difficult once you've taught that kid to write. It becomes impossible to stop that kid once they've rallied the others.

But, oh, how easy it is to help that kid. How they will ride the inertia from the smallest push. How simple it is to spark ambition within them. The only nourishment they require is criticism and words of wisdom. The only space they need to create is the width and length of a desk. They can build from nothing. They can discover in darkness. Success moves them forward. Failure moves them forward. 

Only forward.


F.P.S. Fred: Genesis

Hello again, it's your writer and director Grey. Now, F.P.S. Fred comes from a dark place... literally not figuratively- as in I was in a dark room when I wrote it. 

Going off to college meant getting a new laptop and my goal was to make sure my parents got me one powerful enough to game. We'd never had a family computer powerful enough for gaming, so up to this point I was strictly on consoles and handhelds (and look I didn't turn out so bad *twitches*) neither of which I could take to my dorm with me. Of course, it didn't take long for the internet to oh so formally introduce me to Steam. I literally had to call Andrew Chenault (our camera operator) at 1 AM IN THE MORNING to let him know- no more like to enlighten- no more like to save his life by alerting him that there was an online store practically giving games away. He sleepily groaned, said he'd known about it, and hung up. So that night I made my first Steam purchase, one of 2012's biggest hits, Borderlands 2 and its predecessor with all the DLC included. 

 The Borderlands franchise holds a ton of my freshman year hours. Great style, great writing, and pinpoint in knowing what kind of game it is. On the flip side, my Winter quarter schedule consisted of an Intro to Screenwriting class. I figured this class would be easy- the reason I got into filmmaking (a whole other long story) was because of writing and by this time I'd already written three feature length screenplays and a web series. But that was a problem- three FEATURE LENGTHS and a SERIES. This class wanted me to produce a SHORT (20 pages or less). The first draft of my first screenplay ever ran about 170 pages. Like many of us writers I have issues with condensing vivid ideas as well as cutting my baby to shreds once it's written. Not only that but my Professor (shoutout to Jon Beaupre!) challenged us to explore territory we hadn't set foot in, to dabble into something or someone weird to us. To say the least, this class was hard for me.

So the day comes when I have to submit a draft. I have one class in the afternoon and then the screenwriting class in the evening. On the night before with still no 20 page ideas or anything written I do what any responsible escapist would do- I binge game  Borderlands 2 through the night/morning until my afternoon class. But something strange happened when I got up out of my seat to leave. I could still see the health bar from Borderlands 2- I could still see the whole Heads Up Display- like the image was burned into my head, an eye spot unwilling to fade away. So I... accepted it. I even began to swivel my head smoothly as if I were someone else camera. I got dressed that way, ate that way, and went to class that way. Of course, this imaginary HUD faded eventually but it made me think.

What if someone could subject themselves to that? What if someone was so displeased with life, so disillusioned with monotony, so caught up in the thought that "hey, of all the universes we got the most boring one" they implement a self-inficted psychosis? And, most importantly, how do they find their way back- if they ever do or ever can? Those questions are the bedrock of Freddie Fresno's existence- he's here to answer them- I wrote him to answer them. This is a story for those not just looking for something out of life but something much, much, greater out it. With the seasoning of a few personal plights to round out and deepen my characters it only took about an hour to finish the script- ridden with typos- but a script nonetheless. 

I knew immediately I wanted to make it.

Inside Look at Incentives

Some more of the Cast/Crew

 

Seasoned is an understatement when referring to the film's Assistant Director Jacob Gray. As a writer and director as well, Jacob charged boldly into the world of filmmaking in 2014 with his first short film- self-produced and self-financed he succeeded in creating something from nothing. Shortly afterward, his music video directorial debut "Judas/Aurora" with Long Beach collective The Natives has received broad unanimous acclaim- especially from the locals of Long Beach for his visually stunning portrayal of the city. 


Our 2nd Assistant Director, Linda Huynh is a Film major and Art minor who will... get you to vote? Linda's extensive work with Advancing Justice keeps her involved in community building, fundraising, and campaigning.  Believe it or not, her worlds overlap. Her skills in organizing events and making sure that all things run effectively and on time are what makes her a successful 2nd AD. But don't let her political awareness fool you, Linda is an avid photographer and budding cinematographer with a director's brag sheet chalk full of Public Service Announcements.

 
Star Garrett Vanderwielen is a man who channels hilarious antics through many a forms. As a personality, editor, and award-winning animator he's best known for his YouTube channel "AngryGingersnApps" and his work on the hit web series "The Most Popular Girls in School"

The multi-talented Zeno Robinson makes no secret of his interesting pursuits- acting, making music, and writing.  With Grey needing to fill the relatively small role of Dexter as soon as possible for Phase 1, Zeno was referred. However, after only a few conversations between the two new friends revealing him to be an avid gamer, his relatability to the script, and incredible performance he was swiftly given a lead role for the production of Phase 2.

Tiffany Chu's photogenicity is no secret. Her pursuit of acting has followed her through the three short years it took for her to complete her BA at UCI. So why is she serving as script supervisor for F.P.S. Fred? Because Tiffany is just as interested in what goes on behind the camera. Seeing the significance of every cog and gear that goes into making proper moving picture when she's not in front of the camera Tiffany is learning something new about the art of filmmaking.

Andrew Chenault initially began his college trek majoring in video game design but soon realized the versatility of the creative outlet that is film- and his eye for it. Being a long time gamer and now student of cinema made him the ideal candidate for camera operation- point- all of Freddie's Point of View sequences were shot by him. Now, other than his writing, he's currently apart of the largest feature length film ever to be produced solely by UCI students and is a videographer for the university's Anteater TV. 

Lucas Benitez is another victim to the high school film bug. His combined passion for literature, poetry, prose, and all writing of excellence and the unparalleled "wow" factor of movie magic (one of his favorites being Jurassic Park) really meant there was only one path for him- the cinema. Lucas is able to separate these worlds as he pleases being one of the chief editors of Statement Magazine, CSULA’s journal for literature and art, while at the same time being Treasurer of Cinematic Visions, CSULA's film club. But of course, he always inevitably brings them together, writing and directing his own works- his most current being a documentary on the late Sal Castro and the Chicano Youth Leadership Conference.


Alan Chung is well known for his cinematography through his projects with PaperSketch Media and Wong Fu Productions. He's currently the Director of Photography of the largest feature length film produced by UCI students.

Want to know where we got our equipment? Check out the incredibly priced and resourceful Los Angeles Camera Rentals!
http://losangelescamerarentals.com/

See you soon?

Thank you so much for sticking around! From our pitch video to our introductions we hope Campaign F.P.S. was everything you expected and more. We'd be honored for you to join us on our journey every step of the way. Don't worry, we'll do all the heavy lifting! But there are a few things you can do:

  • Shout us out! Use the hashtag #fpsfred on Facebook and Twitter and get more people excited about the film.
  • Below are links to our Facebook, Twitter, and YouTube pages. Be sure to check them out and share.

Grey will be back to give you any updates as they come but we'll all be seeing you again on June 5th. See you on the other side!
story_txt:
Our Collective Defined 
Wide eyes. Endless questions. Nothing to lose. Tabula rasa.


A kid. 

The ruggedness of talent can lead to stumbling of the heart, the rawness of potential can fog the mind, and blind ambition can yield disruptive relentlessness. 

And it is difficult to stop a kid once resolute with an idea. It becomes exponentially more difficult once you've taught that kid to write. It becomes impossible to stop that kid once they've rallied the others.But, oh, how easy it is to help that kid. How they will ride the inertia from the smallest push. How simple it is to spark ambition within them. The only nourishment they require is criticism and words of wisdom. The only space they need to create is the width and length of a desk. They can build from nothing. They can discover in darkness. Success moves them forward. Failure moves them forward. Only forward.


   F.P.S. Fred: Genesis
Hello again, it's your writer and director Grey. Now, F.P.S. Fred comes from a dark place... literally not figuratively- as in I was in a dark room when I wrote it. 

Going off to college meant getting a new laptop and my goal was to make sure my parents got me one powerful enough to game. We'd never had a family computer powerful enough for gaming, so up to this point I was strictly on consoles and handhelds (and look I didn't turn out so bad *twitches*) neither of which I could take to my dorm with me. Of course, it didn't take long for the internet to oh so formally introduce me to Steam. I literally had to call Andrew Chenault (our camera operator) at 1 AM IN THE MORNING to let him know- no more like to enlighten- no more like to save his life by alerting him that there was an online store practically giving games away. He sleepily groaned, said he'd known about it, and hung up. So that night I made my first Steam purchase, one of 2012's biggest hits, Borderlands 2 and its predecessor with all the DLC included. 

 The Borderlands franchise holds a ton of my freshman year hours. Great style, great writing, and pinpoint in knowing what kind of game it is. On the flip side, my Winter quarter schedule consisted of an Intro to Screenwriting class. I figured this class would be easy- the reason I got into filmmaking (a whole other long story) was because of writing and by this time I'd already written three feature length screenplays and a web series. But that was a problem- three FEATURE LENGTHS and a SERIES. This class wanted me to produce a SHORT (20 pages or less). The first draft of my first screenplay ever ran about 170 pages. Like many of us writers I have issues with condensing vivid ideas as well as cutting my baby to shreds once it's written. Not only that but my Professor (shoutout to Jon Beaupre!) challenged us to explore territory we hadn't set foot in, to dabble into something or someone weird to us. To say the least, this class was hard for me.

So the day comes when I have to submit a draft. I have one class in the afternoon and then the screenwriting class in the evening. On the night before with still no 20 page ideas or anything written I do what any responsible escapist would do- I binge game  Borderlands 2 through the night/morning until my afternoon class. But something strange happened when I got up out of my seat to leave. I could still see the health bar from Borderlands 2- I could still see the whole Heads Up Display- like the image was burned into my head, an eye spot unwilling to fade away. So I... accepted it. I even began to swivel my head smoothly as if I were someone else camera. I got dressed that way, ate that way, and went to class that way. Of course, this imaginary HUD faded eventually but it made me think.

What if someone could subject themselves to that? What if someone was so displeased with life, so disillusioned with monotony, so caught up in the thought that "hey, of all the universes we got the most boring one" they implement a self-inficted psychosis? And, most importantly, how do they find their way back- if they ever do or ever can? Those questions are the bedrock of Freddie Fresno's existence- he's here to answer them- I wrote him to answer them. This is a story for those not just looking for something out of life but something much, much, greater out it. With the seasoning of a few personal plights to round out and deepen my characters it only took about an hour to finish the script- ridden with typos- but a script nonetheless. 

I knew immediately I wanted to make it.

Inside Look at Incentives



    Some more of the Cast/Crew 


 
Seasoned is an understatement when referring to the film's Assistant Director Jacob Gray. As a writer and director as well, Jacob charged boldly into the world of filmmaking in 2014 with his first short film- self-produced and self-financed he succeeded in creating something from nothing. Shortly afterward, his music video directorial debut "Judas/Aurora" with Long Beach collective The Natives has received broad unanimous acclaim- especially from the locals of Long Beach for his visually stunning portrayal of the city. 


Our 2nd Assistant Director, Linda Huynh is a Film major and Art minor who will... get you to vote? Linda's extensive work with Advancing Justice keeps her involved in community building, fundraising, and campaigning.  Believe it or not, her worlds overlap. Her skills in organizing events and making sure that all things run effectively and on time are what makes her a successful 2nd AD. But don't let her political awareness fool you, Linda is an avid photographer and budding cinematographer with a director's brag sheet chalk full of Public Service Announcements.

 
  Star Garrett Vanderwielen is a man who channels hilarious antics through many a forms. As a personality, editor, and award-winning animator he's best known for his YouTube channel "AngryGingersnApps" and his work on the hit web series "The Most Popular Girls in School"
The multi-talented Zeno Robinson makes no secret of his interesting pursuits- acting, making music, and writing.  With Grey needing to fill the relatively small role of Dexter as soon as possible for Phase 1, Zeno was referred. However, after only a few conversations between the two new friends revealing him to be an avid gamer, his relatability to the script, and incredible performance he was swiftly given a lead role for the production of Phase 2.

Tiffany Chu's photogenicity is no secret. Her pursuit of acting has followed her through the three short years it took for her to complete her BA at UCI. So why is she serving as script supervisor for F.P.S. Fred? Because Tiffany is just as interested in what goes on behind the camera. Seeing the significance of every cog and gear that goes into making proper moving picture when she's not in front of the camera Tiffany is learning something new about the art of filmmaking.

Andrew Chenault initially began his college trek majoring in video game design but soon realized the versatility of the creative outlet that is film- and his eye for it. Being a long time gamer and now student of cinema made him the ideal candidate for camera operation- point- all of Freddie's Point of View sequences were shot by him. Now, other than his writing, he's currently apart of the largest feature length film ever to be produced solely by UCI students and is a videographer for the university's Anteater TV. 


Lucas Benitez is another victim to the high school film bug. His combined passion for literature, poetry, prose, and all writing of excellence and the unparalleled "wow" factor of movie magic (one of his favorites being Jurassic Park) really meant there was only one path for him- the cinema. Lucas is able to separate these worlds as he pleases being one of the chief editors of Statement Magazine, CSULA’s journal for literature and art, while at the same time being Treasurer of Cinematic Visions, CSULA's film club. Alan Chung is well known for his cinematography through his projects with PaperSketch Media and Wong Fu Productions. He's currently the Director of Photography of the largest feature length film produced by UCI students.Want to know where we got our equipment? Check out the incredibly priced and resourceful Los Angeles Camera Rentals!
http://losangelescamerarentals.com/

    See you soon? Thank you so much for sticking around! From our pitch video to our introductions we hope Campaign F.P.S. was everything you expected and more. We'd be honored for you to join us on our journey every step of the way. Don't worry, we'll do all the heavy lifting! But there are a few things you can do:  Shout us out! Use the hashtag #fpsfred on Facebook and Twitter and get more people excited about the film. Below are links to our Facebook, Twitter, and YouTube pages. Be sure to check them out and share.   Grey will be back to give you any updates as they come but we'll all be seeing you again on June 5th. See you on the other side!

story:
The August Project.org

Thank you so much for taking the time to read about this cause and the very personal and passionate meaning behind The August Project. 
My name is Chelsea. I am a full time single mother of a beautiful, 3 year old little girl. I am a certified School Counselor, licensed Professional Counselor Intern, and carry a Masters Degree in Counseling and Higher Education. I am intelligent, educated and was a successful school counselor when my life was turned upside down. You never know who life decides to take a hit at. And, you never know when. In the span of one year, my marriage and my family had fallen apart; I was in a very dangerous environment; I was planning an escape; was diagnosed with 3 autoimmune diseases and was facing some of the most stressful and emotionally torturing times of my life. Within the next year- both of my parents had become terminally ill and the "unknown" was more colorful than I had ever seen. 
On March 13th, 2010, I was wearing a gorgeous white dress and in front of all of our family and friends, I walked down the aisle and vowed my life to a man I had known nearly 4 years.  I became pregnant that fall and what should have been a beautiful and innately safe experience and one that every mother- to -be should experience, became my own living nightmare. My world was slowly turning upside down and being twisted in ways that I never knew it could be.  By the grace of God and the undying love I have for my daughter, I escaped that nightmare and never went back. 
I am a proud and ambitious survivor of domestic abuse and a proud and ambitious survivor as a single mother. The journey into becoming a single mother brought more heartache, hopelessness and disappointment than I would have ever imagined.  There is a significant lack of resources available to EFFECTIVELY HELP a single mother during crisis and after. Yes, there are organizations out there that will purchase school supplies, clothing and direct you to the local food pantries. These services and organizations are a God send. I went to every food pantry that I could and received clothing for my daughter and I am grateful for those resources. 
I found myself feeling more hopeless as time went on.  There were and are resources and services that I needed and these were things that I would ALWAYS need help with. It wasn't a one time thing. It wasn't a 3 month thing. It was a 3 year thing.

I found the name of The August Project as I lived through many experiences, trials, challenges and successes along the journey of becoming a single mom. As we all know, the month of August is the 8th month of the year. Over a span of time, I came to learn that the number 8 means "new beginnings" in the Bible. The number 8, the month of August, and new beginnings have been a significant part of the journey. In fact, one of the shelters and counseling centers that my daughter and I escaped to was called "New Beginnings". It all just fit. And it fit naturally. 
 These are services and resources that are custom to being a single mother. I needed continued help. And I needed a lot of it. Unfortunately, the resources are not available for the custom type of services that single mothers truly need from the point of crisis and in moving forward. Your donation and belief in this Non-Profit Organization will provide services and resources that are vital to single mothers everywhere and will help us to raise empowered, confident, successful and healthy children. 
The services and resources that The August Project will be providing to single mothers and children include Virtual Counseling, Legal Advocacy, Care for Pets (T.A.P. for Pets), Financial assistance; fully furnished temporary housing; temporary cars/vans/trucks with insurance coverage included; discounts on hotel stays for the "escapes" that many women have to endure if they are in an abusive relationship; a 24/7 mentoring program; daily/weekly/monthly blogs and newsletters providing extensive support and updated resources available in the community and surrounding areas; and continued education and on-call support during the different stages of the separation and divorce-including post-divorce care. We will be implementing an on-call service with doorstep delivery of any medicine, formula, diapers, milk, food or any other essentials that a mother has run out of; be it the middle of the night or middle of the afternoon. There were many nights that I ran out of these items and many more. Instead of having the option to wake up to a significant other lying next to me; I began to endure the trek into the  middle of the night- with my baby in tow. Alot of these times, it was freezing cold or over 100 degrees. My car that was repossessed by the ex husband had left me with borrowing a van from a friend. While incredibly grateful to have a moving vehicle; over the year the car began to break down.  At this time, that van had no heater or air conditioner. Braving Dallas traffic with an infant in the middle of the afternoon in middle of summer by myself, with no air conditioner, posed life threatening health concerns and resulted in a very, very stressful situation for my infant/toddler daughter with no way to explain that she could possibly understand. 
Your donations to this cause; to this need in the single mother community, will provide the ability for The August Project to TAP into the above resources;  to ACCESS them day or night on a case by case basis; and to PROVIDE opportunities that these families have longed for. Your donation alone is guaranteed to be a part of creating a better life for innocent children and hard- working single moms. 
Please share this. Please share the link. And, please consider supporting a new movement and new change for single mothers and children as they continue to walk alone. 
I was there. I am there. The August Project is a MUST for the world. 
Thank you for the time you have taken to read this and to consider supporting it in a way that will truly and genuinely make a difference. 

Chelsea Bohannon

Chief Executive Officer
The August Project
www.theaugustproject.org 
tap@theaugustproject.org

story:
Greetings all . . .

Cooper & Faizah Griggs, and Jason Krieger cordially invite you to help us fund our short film project, jOSHUA.

Based on a novella by Jason Krieger, the film is a joint collaboration between friends and colleagues, which we hope can not only be a compelling piece of drama, but a thriller in the highest order.

This production is several years in the making - a venture to stretch both the film skills and story-telling abilities of all of the creatives/producers involved. 

Our hope is that YOU, our esteemed colleagues and friends, will help by making a donation allowing us to create the intended vision for this project - helping all of us grow not only in our own talents, but establish a story that will be compelling to a short film audience AND possibly kindle interest in making the concept into a full length feature.

What We Need & What You Get:

Our goal for crowd funding would be the following:

  • $15K from YOU, our friends, so that we can make the short film that we would like for you to see
  • Donate any amount, although for donations of $50 or more, there's some cool perks like DVDs, Concept Art, signed copy of script and other goodies
  • Funds are solely going to the budget of the film, to hire professional crew members and actors and make a film worthy of the donations that YOU would provide
  • Of course, if you can't help financially, we could always use you as a Production Assistant on the project - please contact us via personal email:

jason_j_krieger@yahoo.com


Synopsis:

The Children of the Night . . . What Sweet Music They Make . . .

Joshua is tormented by dreams of demons.  The only thing that can cure his nightmares is to go out into the wilds of the city and 'help' the lost souls of skid row.  But is he truly there to assist the people he meets or does he have some other motive?

Joshua is a psychological thriller about a man who appears to be one thing, but could possibly be something else.

story:
My name is Grant Johnson. I graduated from New York Film Academy Los Angeles. I have been working in film in both Los Angeles and Utah for the past four years. I have directed several shorts, and have won several awards. One of my films was recently screened at the Short Film Corner at the Cannes Film Festival. Now I'm excited to introduce you to my new project, Collide.

    Collide is a short film about a young man (David) who comes across an accident. There he finds a young woman who has been hit by a car. As he begins to help her he is pulled forward in time by her as she shows him the life they were supposed to live together. There he is faced with the difficulty of trying to save her as well as their future together. This film is extraordinarily important to me because it's about the effect, good or bad, a person can have on the lives of others. Our life, and what we do, impacts all those we have met and all those we will ever meet. We live in a world were what we do can have a great effect on so many others.

    Our goal is to make this feel like a larger film. To show not just the near future but to show the effects throughout someone's life. One of the ways we are hoping to achieve this is by doing a road trip. Filming in different cities in California will give the film a larger scope and feel. In order to do this we need your help. We need a larger budget to make use of equipment to showcase the locations and help tell the story. The money will go to camera equipment as well as lighting equipment and insurance. We need your help to be able to tell this important story. Without your help we will not be able to make this happen. Thank you for your consideration.

story: I am using the funds raised to pay my app developer to finish my app and to add some other features I've thought of. The iPhone app is almost done, and I need the Android version next. With so many people getting their phones confiscated and videos deleted, I wanted a faster way to send videos and pictures. It takes approximately 6 or 7 button presses to send pics/videos on an iPhone or Android. With my app, it only takes three. It sends the video or picture to multiple pre-selected locations automatically. It can't be deleted or stopped. If someone does get your phone, and goes to the photo cache to delete it, they are deleting a decoy copy. It's already gone. This app will help fight corruption and brutality by exposing it. Thanks for your help in advance and I will gladly email you a free code for the app in exchange for your contribution.

story:
The American Policy Center is the nation’s leading opponent to a policy called Agenda 21/Sustainable Development. APC has developed a comprehensive plan to educate the public and train local citizens to oppose such policy. Part of the process is to reach out to the general public that remains mostly unaware of such policy, or the damage it is doing to their fellow citizens, especially private property owners. 

To that end, APC is developing a series of ads to run on national television networks to dramatically depict how our government is changing and how those changed particularly affect private property owners.  “Stop Agenda 21” is the tag line every American should be demanding of their state and local governments.

The nation has been moved by the emotional ads that show the suffering of abused animals and they have answered the call to support organizations that are working to protect them. But how about people who are suffering the same kind of abuse through no fault of their own, seeing their property taken and their homes destroyed as a result of government edict? Don’t they deserve our passion and support too? After introducing the Agenda 21 issues to the general public, APC will develop a series of ads that will show how Americans are suffering from these dangerous Agenda 21 policies.

Why you need the funds & what will you do with the funds?

The funds to be raised here will serve as seed money to get the ads produced and then begin airing on television. The ads will also ask for funds of support and that money, raised through the airing of the ads, will be used to perpetuate the airing of more ads on more television networks. It will also be used to create new follow up versions to keep the campaign fresh.  The important thing today is to raise the seed money to get started. 

Who’s all involved in the project/background of leaders and company?

American Policy Center, Tom DeWeese (Founder and President), Singer/Song Writer Susan Toms, Film Maker Tina Trenner and Big Idea productions.

Tom DeWeese is recognized as the nation’s leading expert on Agenda 21 and the dangers is poses to the American system of representative government and private property rights. An activist for over 45 years, he has appeared on national news programs including Fox News, the Michael Reagan Show, Cross Talk and many more. Quoted in the New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Washington Post, Washington Times, etc. He speaks across the nation and his articles appear in numerous national publications and news web sites. The American Policy Center was founded in 1986 and advocates limited government, free enterprise and individual liberty, specifically focusing on private property rights, personal privacy, education policy, and national sovereignty. 

Other ways people can help?  (i.e. social media, email friends and family, etc)

Please help us get this message out to as many Americans as possible, through your Facebook page, Twitter account or your email list. Tell your family and friends how they can help spread the message that their fellow citizens are suffering from government overreach. Don’t let them suffer alone.
story_txt:
The American
Policy Center is the nation’s leading opponent to a policy called Agenda
21/Sustainable Development. APC has developed a comprehensive plan to educate
the public and train local citizens to oppose such policy. Part of the process
is to reach out to the general public that remains mostly unaware of such
policy, or the damage it is doing to their fellow citizens, especially private
property owners.  
To that end,
APC is developing a series of ads to run on national television networks to
dramatically depict how our government is changing and how those changed
particularly affect private property owners. 
“Stop Agenda 21” is the tag line every American should be demanding of
their state and local governments. 
The nation
has been moved by the emotional ads that show the suffering of abused animals
and they have answered the call to support organizations that are working to
protect them. But how about people who are suffering the same kind of abuse
through no fault of their own, seeing their property taken and their homes
destroyed as a result of government edict? Don’t they deserve our passion and
support too? After introducing the Agenda 21 issues to the general public, APC
will develop a series of ads that will show how Americans are suffering from
these dangerous Agenda 21 policies. 
Why you need the
funds & what will you do with the funds?
The funds to
be raised here will serve as seed money to get the ads produced and then begin airing
on television. The ads will also ask for funds of support and that money,
raised through the airing of the ads, will be used to perpetuate the airing of
more ads on more television networks. It will also be used to create new follow
up versions to keep the campaign fresh. 
The important thing today is to raise the seed money to get
started.  
Who’s all involved in
the project/background of leaders and company?
American Policy Center, Tom DeWeese (Founder and President),
Singer/Song Writer Susan Toms, Film Maker Tina Trenner and Big Idea
productions. 
Tom DeWeese is recognized as the nation’s leading expert on
Agenda 21 and the dangers is poses to the American system of representative
government and private property rights. An activist for over 45 years, he has
appeared on national news programs including Fox News, the Michael Reagan Show,
Cross Talk and many more. Quoted in the New York Times, Wall Street Journal,
Washington Post, Washington Times, etc. He speaks across the nation and his
articles appear in numerous national publications and news web sites. The
American Policy Center was founded in 1986 and advocates limited government,
free enterprise and individual liberty, specifically focusing on private
property rights, personal privacy, education policy, and national
sovereignty.  
Other ways people can
help?  (i.e. social media, email friends
and family, etc)
Please help
us get this message out to as many Americans as possible, through your Facebook page, Twitter account or your email list. Tell your family and friends how
they can help spread the message that their fellow citizens are suffering from
government overreach. Don’t let them suffer alone.

story:
Ever think about riding a bicycle across the country?  With a fiddle and a banjo?  Plus 100 pounds of film and audio gear!?!  Interviewing and recording musicians playing their own regional music that has never been documented??!!

Sounds nuts, right?  WE DID IT!  With the help of many great friends, a few who even rode with us along the way, WE DID IT!  We captured 14 interviews and performances from amazing musicians and artists in their own backyards.  And now we hope to share these stories with YOU - but we need YOUR HELP!
(CHECK OUT THE UPDATES PAGE FOR VIDEOS WE HAVE RELEASED)
OR GO HERE


WAIT, WHAT?!? ON A BICYCLE?!?!  UNASSISTED??  WITH GEAR AND INSTRUMENTS?


We hit the road in early fall, after a great night of jamming at Paul Roomsburg's “The Cabin” in Augusta, West Virginia.  Cruising down the Shenandoah to Keezletown, to record Hannah Johnson on pump organ, banjo and fiddle.  Climbing up 5 Mile Mountain to Floyd for a home made dinner with recording engineer Joe ”Bass” DeJarnette.  Off through South West Virginia we found Sabra Guzman and Buck Eye Banjos - then into the majestic Blue Ridge Mountains.  Up and over Grandfather Mountain, bombing down the Parkway to Asheville and the depths of Bob Willoughby.  Strolling and rolling through the hills and chicken farms of North Georgia, soaking up wisdom and sage advice from potter, Pat Shields.  Alabama to the Gulf Coast, out the panhandle of Florida and into Mississippi, which will always be a tall tale.  Then to Louisiana, and the heart of Acadia - Cajun accordions, fiddles and two-stepping for days at Blackpot Festival in Lafayette - et toi!  The wide…wide…wide…open stretches of Texas with it's Polish fiddle, the hills of New Mexico, the lonely deserts of Arizona and Joshua Tree, California for Thanksgiving and into the arms of the city of Angels - Los Angeles before December!  Where we made a record featuring tunes we learned along the way with Angeleno Old Time musicians like Frank Fairfield (SEE THE PERKS for a DIGITAL DOWNLOAD of the album)!

We pulled off the first half of this project, the riding and filming, on our own. No sponsors, no executive producers, no advertisers, no corporations, just 2 Guys Named Ben.  Now we’re looking for YOUR HELP in completing the second half of this project: the editing, mixing, and finishing of these videos.  It gives us goose bumps just thinking about it - two musicians, out in America, spending time with other American artists, no one famous - just real folks who do what they do because that's who they are and where they come from. 

 
Ever wanted to do something like this?  Ever dreamed this big?  This series of videos and audio recordings is the closest we can get you to being out there with us!  So jump on and help us reach our goal!

Who are we? 


Ben Townsend, is a multi-instrumentalist (former member of the Hackensaw Boys and The Fox Hunt) and has been playing Old Time music all his life. Before this trip he had never ridden a bicycle long distance (he’d hardly ever ridden one at all). 

Ben Guzman, from Los Angeles, is a veteran cyclist who plays the fiddle (Triple Chicken Foot and The High Life Cajun Band) and is one of the founding members of The Los Angeles Old Time Social and The Bicycle Kitchen. 


What WE NEED & What YOU GET

Over the course of this campaign we will release 4 sneak peek episodes FOR FREE! 
Here's where the money goes, folks:

  • Every penny made up to the goal goes towards editing and production costs for this web series.  
  • Any amount over goes to fund the next trip!  
  • As a contributor you will be part of the family that has helped keep this rare segment of American Music history alive! 
  • When this is all over we will have produced 14 webisodes and 2 albums of content.  Check out the perks to see exactly what you can take away today!
  • Here are some of the great folks who will be featured in our webisodes:   Paul Roomsburg, Hannah Johnson, Joe Bass, Sabra Guzman, Greg Galbreath, Tom Barr, Trevor McKenzie, Chicken Train, Bob Willoughby, Pat Shields, The Blackpot Festival (Evie Ladin and Wilson Savoy) and the Deep End Sessions (Frank Fairfield, Ben Townsend and Friends)

OTHER WAYS TO HELP:

Sharing and posting this campaign on Facebook to your own page, or emailing the INDIEGOGO link to folks who aren't on social media helps us reach the people who really care about this stuff!   We are not hiring publicists or advertizing:  THIS IS A WORD-OF-MOUTH CAMPAIGN! You can help by getting the word out!

story:
*** UPDATE *** TRAILER ONLINE *** 


To watch the crowdfunding Video again:


Plot Summary

This documentary features Sarah-Quita Offringa.
A 23 year old apparently happy-go-lucky windsurfer who hails from Aruba. 
She started windsurfing when she was nine.


Today, at 23 years she has become a household name on the professional windsurfing circuit and has accumulated 9 back to back world titles. In the meantime she has also moved to Holland and obtained a bachelor's degree in science. Mostly known for her freestyle prowess as - she hasn't lost a single freestyle heat nor competition since 2008- she has now set her sights on competing in all disciplines -Slalom, freestyle and waves-  of the Professional Windsurfing Association's tour. This is no easy feat as most windsurfers only focus on one discipline.

This will be a first to have a female protagonist in a windsurfing movie. Furthermore in this documentary instead of focusing on pure windsurfing action. We rather shed light on the lifestyle of a professional windsurfer. Which typically involves travelling the world, training, finding new spots and coming in contact with new cultures.
In this documentary we follow Sarah-Quita on her travels in 2015. We'll follow her as she ventures out into the world exploring new destinations and meeting new people. We'll also see how she prepares for the upcoming competition season as well as how she is coming along competing in all three disciplines on tour.

Filming locations

In Australia we see her face extreme heat and see how she handles the outdoors as she drives and camps up and down the West coast with friends in search of waves.


Having been brought up in the Caribbean, Sarah-Quita is used to sunshine and wearing bikini's. We challenged her by taking her to the Nordic cold of Iceland.
Explore the breathtaking landscape of Iceland with her and see whether she's able to get in her wetsuit and defy the cold water.


Aruba is where Sarah-Quita grew up and developed her windsurfing skills. 
This island is blessed with trade winds, turquoise water and makes for a world class location to practice. 


On our trip to her home she explains why she loves the island so much and needs to go back to her family every now and then. 
Finally we'll follow her on her yearly tour in the Canary Islands and Turkey as she competes in freestyle, wave and slalom events.

What We Need 

We've filmed the biggest part of the movie thanks to the financial support received from the Aruban Tourism Authority and Guardian Group Fatum. However we are still looking for funds to cover the last stage of our project.

The last phase of our project is filming Sarah-Quita's competitions in the Canary islands and Turkey from July through August. After this it's time to edit the movie. Our goal is to premiere the movie at the PWA world cup in Germany, Sylt on the 2nd of October 2015.

In order to get it done by then we're going to need some extra help from our editing friends. This is where  your help comes in! With your contribution we'll be able to finish this project on time. 

Your Reward

By supporting us here we offer you:

-The exclusive download of the final movie at a discounted price. 
-You'll be able to view the movie before it is available to the general public.
-We'll have a limited edition travel story book in print available with exclusive pictures & stories of the movie which also includes  the movie on a USB key.

Check out the contribution options on the right for more information.

We've worked hard on this project and the process of it all has been an experience of a lifetime. We're really excited to share the windsurfing and travelling excitement with you. And with you're help we can make it happen very soon.

Thank you!!

story:
This campaign is now closed but you can still make a donation via our website!

The Film 

Award-winning film maker Michael Chanan is back with Money Puzzles, a feature-length documentary film about money, debt and us. 

We're told daily how we have no choice but to give more public money to banks and therefore provide less for schools, healthcare and public services, because the crisis demands it.

But what if this was all a myth? What if the austerity were based on a misunderstanding about money, or even lies about money? What if the whole of economics as we know it were based on a fundamental misunderstanding of economics and money? What if debts could quite legally be cancelled and the misery inflicted on people around Europe and the rest of the world was not just unnecessary, but actually a political decision by a tiny elite who seek to dominate us?

In Money Puzzles we will not just unravel the mysteries of money through the ages, but also provide a robust and conclusive critique of austerity policies and the destruction being wrought in its wake. We will explain also how the legal concept of "odious debt" enables governments to wipe out public debt, as happened in Cuba and Iraq. There is an alternative to the crisis and our project it so explain it. 

Money Puzzles is being made at a moment when a new anti-austerity politics is becoming a reality in Greece, Spain and elsewhere, even the UK, where the Tories’ election victory makes the challenge ever more urgent. That victory was based on a lie promulgated by a compliant media: that the financial crisis of 2008 was caused by the deficit and not the financial bubble bursting and banks too big to fail crashing. 

This film, by questioning the illusory and contradictory nature of money and debt, will undermine the distortions and falsehoods about them on which austerity politics is based.

The filmmaker

Michael Chanan is a seasoned documentary filmmaker and Professor of Film & Video at the University of Roehampton, and is seeking to produce a film that puts his creative and academic expertise to work in a form that reaches the broadest possible audience. We are working with a small team of production assistants at home and abroad.

So far... or, How to make a film about money and debt without any money and without going into debt!

To get us started, we've adopted a multi-pronged strategy of gathering small amounts of money or support in kind. We have secured development funds from Sussex (£1900), and some research funding from Roehampton (£1250). We're filming in stages, as and when these minimal resources allow (plus the expenditure of our labour time). 

We began by making a teaser, which we launched at an event in March 2015 at Goldsmiths organised by their Political Economy Research Centre (PERC). Through linking up with PERC, Michael was able to go to Athens with the #DebtAction Group in May, and filmed Greece on the Edge?, which will comprise an episode in the full-length film. 

Plans

We returned to Greece in July to show the teaser at the conference on 'Democracy Rising' and do some more filming on the developing situation. In August we shall film some interviews and other scenes in London. In September, Michael is invited to screen a previous film of his in Córdoba, Argentina, and will take advantage of the trip to film in Buenos Aires on Argentina's recent history of money and international debt default.  

If circumstances allow, we also plan to film in Spain before the general election, expected in November, and in Ecuador, a little known example of how a small country can fight back.

What we need

Michael is a salaried academic and since Money Puzzles counts as research he will not be paid. Our UK-based production assistants have agreed to donate their labour, but when shooting abroad, we’re paying a production assistant.   

Our basic costs at home, including eight days shooting in the UK, post-production and a launch event, comes to £10,300. This is our target.

Anything above this will go to support further shooting abroad. Shooting in Argentina in September, partly covered by separate academic funding, requires £1450. Filming in Spain later in the year, £2,200. We've already spend hundreds shooting in London and where else in the UK we shoot will depend on what we can afford. Shooting in Ecuador would need £3000.

We shall look for separate funding for translation and subtitling at a later stage.

story:
Summary from Producer/Director Joanne Fish


Hi, This campaign has ended, but the fundraising continues at Cinema South.  You can still make a tax-deductible contribution, and we'll still send you the 'perks'.  Just go to this link, and click on "SUPPORT".  Cinema South is a 501 C-3 organization based in Nashville, Tennessee. 

http://cinemasouth.org/portfolio/mr-handys-blues/


Thanks to everyone who has contributed so far!!

"Mr. Handy's Blues: A Musical Documentary" is a true labor of love for me.  It's been eight years in the making, and I am committed to completing the film by the end of 2015.  The story of W.C. Handy has never been told on film and the mission of this project is to preserve his legacy for generations to come.  For some viewers this will be the first time they learn about the game-changing contributions that Handy made in the world of Blues music and Jazz.  His life began seven years after the Civil War and ended at the dawn of the Space Age. From a very young age Mr. Handy was a trailblazer, a pioneer whose heroic journey took him from tent shows in the Deep South to the heart of Broadway in New York City; from Clarksdale, Mississippi to a concert at Carnegie Hall.  Handy's life was full of family drama, racial tensions, hard times and redemption.  Overcoming incredible odds he became a world renown composer and opened his own music publishing company, which still stands over 100 years later. He is revered as an American Treasure and a seminal figure in the history of the Blues, but his memory is fading away with time.   I want to bring his story back to life using interviews with  musical luminaries, {Taj Mahal, Bobby Rush, Vince Giordano to name a few}, performances of his timeless songs by current artists, and his own words. Mr. Handy is affectionately known as The Father of the Blues, and his family tree spreads far and wide.  He persevered and thrived during a period in American History that was extremely difficult for African Americans to have their voices heard.  He was a man ahead of his time and he paved the way for thousands of others to succeed.  


W.C. Handy wrote St. Louis Blues in 1914 and it became a worldwide sensation.  It was the most recorded song of the first half of the 20th Century and lives on through the music of countless performers today.  {And a hockey team named after it in St. Louis!}

Your contributions mean everything to the success of the film.  I spent the first five years researching Handy’s life, and finding interviewees who could give us perspective on the magnitude of his contributions to the Blues, and early Jazz.  Under the umbrella of our non-profit fiscal sponsor, Cinema South, I have written more than ten grant proposals to foundations both private and public, and received monies from both sectors. My family and friends have been exceedingly generous from the beginning, helping me get started on Principal Photography and supporting me in many ways over this period.  I paid all my own travel and lodging expenses during the research and production phase so that all funds would be used for the actual filming.

I've spent the past two years on the road with a camera crew chronicling Handy’s journey. We’ve recorded over 30 interviews and captured even more current artists performing his classic Blues.  {Beale Street Blues, Memphis Blues, Yellow Dog Blues, St. Louis Blues, and Loveless Love, etc.}

Now it’s time to put it all together into a cinematic experience that will enlighten, educate and most of all entertain.  The contributions to this campaign will be used for editing, and for the purchase of archival footage and photos to support Mr. Handy’s story. 

I will keep updating the campaign with progress reports, and new perks.  I personally thank everyone who wants to be a part of preserving the legacy of this American Musical Icon.  My hope is that it will inspire kids today to pursue their dreams against all odds.

Please click here for a very short video with me at the Handy Home and Museum in Florence, AL.


What We Need & What You Get

Our goal of $22,000 for this campaign will be primarily used for the editing of the film.  I’ve gotten estimates from several post-production houses and the costs range between $15,000 to $18,000.  This covers the editing, color correction, sound mixing and DVD authoring. 

The rest of the monies will be used to license archival footage and photos that are essential to the film. These include a film of Mr. Handy’s funeral procession in New York City, clips from his appearance on the Ed Sullivan Show, footage of Harlem and the Cotton Club during the Harlem Renaissance and the Ethiopian Army marching to battle with Italy.  {Ethiopian Emperor Haile Selassie used the St. Louis Blues as the Battle Hymn for his troops during the 1936 Italian Invasion}. Licensing these film clips is expensive as this is extremely rare footage. 

We have some great items to thank you for your contribution.  An original poster for the film, designed by Patrice McPeak will be mailed to you signed by the Director {Joanne Fish}.  We have limited edition prints of a painting of Mr. Handy by Marianthe Boyagis Snyder, and original paintings by Marianthe and Outsider Artist Walter Power Pruett.  We also have CD’s from many of the fantastic Blues artists who appear in the film.  And we will offer DVD's and digital downloads of the film and other exclusive extras for private viewing. 

A portion of the monies raised will be donated to The Blues Foundation’s HART Fund {Handy Artists Relief Trust} an organization that is dedicated to helping Blues artists in need of medical care and/or funeral expenses.  {See the $150 Perk for more information.}

Please click on the GALLERY for photos and more information about our perks, and some pictures of Mr. Handy and others from the film.

Stretch Goal

If we can raise $40,000 we will be able to not only fully complete and promote the film, but we can produce the companion soundtrack to go with it. Anyone who donates at the $25.00+ level will automatically receive a copy of the soundtrack if we meet our stretch goal.

We will also be able to continue developing the educational component that will repurpose some of our material for use in schools at all levels.

Most of the music in "Mr. Handy’s Blues" is in the public domain.  But certain key performances, like excerpts from Louis Armstrong Plays W.C. Handy, and Bessie Smith’s 1924 recording of St. Louis Blues will have to be legally licensed as well.  We have many live performances of his songs, but there are some recordings that are crucial to the authentic telling of Mr. Handy’s story.

The film will be approximately 90 minutes in length.  This is a format that will be attractive to television broadcasters like Smithsonian Channel, PBS and The Sundance Channel.  We also plan to distribute the film through DVD sales and other streaming platforms. 

 

The Impact

The film not only tells the riveting story of W.C. Handy’s life, it also illustrates the evolution of the Blues as we know it.  Handy took an art form that was regional, and fairly unknown and revolutionized it. He was an educated man who was dedicated to bringing the music of his people to the world.  Through his compositions and recordings he introduced the folk music of the Mississippi Delta to a mainstream audience, and published sheet music arrangements that could be played in every home around the country.  As Mick Kolassa, Blues artist and one of our interviewees states :"He took the Blues to school."  Handy’s talent, business savvy and consummate showmanship shined a light on a crude form of music that was relegated to street corners and saloons. To understand the music scene of the 21st Century we have to appreciate the work of William Christopher Handy. He was a true American composer, and a visionary who rose above the social limitations of his race to achieve his goals and change the world of music forever.

About the Producer:

I'm an Emmy winning Producer who has worked in the documentary film and television world for almost thirty years. {History Channel, A&E, Lifetime, CBS, NBC, ABC Travel, CMT, etc.} My last independent documentary "The Sweet Lady with the Nasty Voice" told the story of Wanda Jackson, the Queen Of Rockabilly.  That film won several awards at film festivals, and was picked up for broadcast by the Smithsonian Channel for their premiere launch. As a student of roots music and history, I was drawn to Wanda's story in the same way I am passionate about W.C. Handy. They both forged their own paths with dignity, talent and grace. I am excited to bring his story to the screen and showcase the many artists who are honoring the Father of the Blues through their modern interpretations of his music.

Risks & Challenges

Cinema South is a verified 501 C-3 non-profit corporation, so all contributions are tax deductible.  All of our perks, except for the dvd and digital downloads will be fulfilled soon after the end of the campaign.

If our stated goal is not obtained, we will still be able to start the editing process, taking us further down the road to completion.  Networks and distributors require a completed work before purchase, so the more we put together, the better our chances of attracting potential buyers in a timely fashion.

We have already been contacted by several Film Festivals around the world, including Israel and Finland. Many theaters across the country have inquired about hosting screenings so we're excited to get the film ready for those opportunities. The Blues community has been extremely supportive and we plan to present the film at some of the many Blues Festivals that are held each year.

I believe that the biggest risk thus far was starting the project eight years ago. Since then we have put together a wonderful group of creative folks who have helped to navigate the way through to this point.  So many people have hopped on the Handy Bandwagon because they believe in the importance of Mr. Handy’s story, and the impact it can have on so many.  It’s been a fantastic journey and I am sure it’s just going to get better as we enter this final phase.

The challenge at hand is to raise enough funds to keep the positive momentum going to the end. {We don’t want to take another eight years to bring this film to you!}

Other Ways You Can Help

If you like what you see in this campaign please help us spread the word through your social circles.  Sharing is the key component in securing our success.  Indiegogo has tools that are very easy to use, and we appreciate everyone who takes the time to look at what we’re trying to accomplish. 

We’d like to thank some of the people who were committed to the film from the very beginning, and have stayed with us through thick and thin:

Gary Ahrens, Barbara Broach, Mark and Cathy Caldwell, the Fichtl Family, Wayne Godwin, everyone at the Handy Home and Museum in Florence, Alabama, and the Handy Home in Memphis, TN, Dr. and Mrs. Carlos Handy, the Memphis Blues Society, John Fuller, David Leonard, Dennis McDougall, Patrice McPeak, Mary Nicely,  Bruce Ricker, Jonathan Saad, Cinema South, Marcia Salter and Dr. Elliott Hurwitt for sharing his knowledge and research about Handy’s life with us.  And last but not least, our mascot and chief safety officer, Jackson! {pictured below}
story_txt:
Summary from Producer/Director Joanne FishHi, This campaign has ended, but the fundraising continues at Cinema South.  You can still make a tax-deductible contribution, and we'll still send you the 'perks'.  Just go to this link, and click on "SUPPORT".  Cinema South is a 501 C-3 organization based in Nashville, Tennessee.  http://cinemasouth.org/portfolio/mr-handys-blues/Thanks to everyone who has contributed so far!! "Mr. Handy's Blues: A Musical Documentary" is a true labor of love for me.  It's been eight years in the making, and I am committed to completing the film by the end of 2015.  The story of W.C. Handy has never been told on film and the mission of this project is to preserve his legacy for generations to come.  For some viewers this will be the first time they learn about the game-changing contributions that Handy made in the world of Blues music and Jazz.  His life began seven years after the Civil War and ended at the dawn of the Space Age. From a very young age Mr. Handy was a trailblazer, a pioneer whose heroic journey took him from tent shows in the Deep South to the heart of Broadway in New York City; from Clarksdale, Mississippi to a concert at Carnegie Hall.  Handy's life was full of family drama, racial tensions, hard times and redemption.  Overcoming incredible odds he became a world renown composer and opened his own music publishing company, which still stands over 100 years later. He is revered as an American Treasure and a seminal figure in the history of the Blues, but his memory is fading away with time.   I want to bring his story back to life using interviews with  musical luminaries, {Taj Mahal, Bobby Rush, Vince Giordano to name a few}, performances of his timeless songs by current artists, and his own words. Mr. Handy is affectionately known as The Father of the Blues, and his family tree spreads far and wide.  He persevered and thrived during a period in American History that was extremely difficult for African Americans to have their voices heard.  He was a man ahead of his time and he paved the way for thousands of others to succeed.   


W.C. Handy wrote St. Louis Blues in
1914 and it became a worldwide sensation. 
It was the most recorded song of the first half of the 20th Century and
lives on through the music of countless performers today.  {And a hockey team named after it in St. Louis!} 
Your contributions mean everything
to the success of the film.  I spent the first five
years researching Handy’s
life, and finding interviewees who could give us perspective on the magnitude
of his contributions to the Blues, and early Jazz.  Under the umbrella of our non-profit
fiscal sponsor, Cinema South, I have written more than ten grant proposals to
foundations both private and public, and received monies from both sectors. My family and friends have been exceedingly generous from the beginning, helping me get started on Principal Photography and supporting me in many ways over this period.  I paid all my own travel and lodging expenses during the research and production phase so that all funds would be used for the actual filming. 
I've spent the past two years on the road with a
camera crew chronicling Handy’s journey. We’ve recorded over 30 interviews and captured even more
current artists performing his classic Blues. 
{Beale Street Blues, Memphis Blues, Yellow Dog Blues, St. Louis Blues, and
 Loveless Love, etc.} 
Now it’s
time to put it all together into a cinematic experience that will enlighten,
educate and most of all entertain.  The
contributions to this campaign will be used for editing, and for the
purchase of archival footage and photos to support Mr. Handy’s story.

against all odds.

story:
SHOUT OUT UK are attempting to raise roughly £8,000 to produce a short film which challenges the negative perceptions surrounding homelessness in a comedic, creative and entertaining fashion. 

About Shout Out UK

SHOUT OUT UK is an independent news network that via journalism, film and events aims to show young people that politics has a direct impact on their lives. Since its launch, the company has become one of Britain’s fastest growing alternative, independent news platforms. In 2015, Shout Out UK completed its first 30-minute documentary film, Anonymous: A Million Men, which was subsequently sold to Shorts International (an offshoot of the AMC Network) for worldwide distribution. During March and April of 2015 Shout Out UK collaborated with Channel 4 and ITN Productions to launch Britain’s first ever Youth Leaders’ Debate. The event, which for the first time ever, gathered together the leaders of the seven largest British party youth wings to debate the key political issues affecting young people today. It aired at 8pm GMT on All 4 and after 10 minutes, the #YouthLeaders was trending on Twitter. 

Website: www.shoutoutuk.org
Showreel: https://vimeo.com/129761781 

About the Project

Lights! Camera! Action! THE DIRECTOR is a witty social comedy which revolves around a young filmmaker’s desperate attempts to make a serious documentary on homelessness. Things rapidly spiral out of control in this powerful comedy with a social heart and important moral message. 

Homelessness is one of the most significant and controversial issues facing modern society. According to the most recent statistics, there are more than 6, 000 people living on the streets of London. Moreover, homeless people are often thought of as being lazy, criminal or drug addicts – but this just ISN’T the case.

SHOUT OUT UK - the makers of Anonymous: A Million Men and Channel 4's Youth Leaders Debate - wishes to make a film which explores some of these issues in an entertaining, satirical and subversive way. Rather than making a serious documentary film - something which has been done before - we want to be more creative in our approach to dealing with these important social issues. 

Our Partners 

SHOUT OUT UK are very happy and proud that so many different organisations have agreed to support the production of THE DIRECTOR given it's strong social and moral message. These organisations include:

  • HUCK Magazine: an online global magazine which explores 'radical culture' from pop culture to political activism to music & art.
  • The Church Housing Trust: a charity dedicated to the rehabilitation and resettlement of homeless people of all ages and backgrounds.
  • AOK Rucksack Appeal: a charity which provides rucksacks of essential items to new homeless people. 
  • VInspired: The UK's leading youth volunteering charity providing 14-25 year olds with volunteering and social action opportunities. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We would appreciate a donation of any kind - big or small. If you are unable to support us financially then there are still a number of things you can do: 

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our film.
  • Sign up to our Thunderclap.
  • Check out Shout Out UK's official website for more information on what we do.
  • Join in with the conversation over Twitter via #TheDirector.

Simple as that. Thanks for your help.

story:
The Wounded Walk is on a mission. What started out as a walk across the United States to raise awareness for our nations wounded brothers and sisters in arms, has now become a full time occupation for Marines Adam Shatarsky and Ross Delafield.  Over several months, thousands of miles and many pairs of shoes, their courageous journey's have inspired the nation, leading to the formation of The Wounded Walk; an official 501c3 non profit focused specifically on helping our veterans suffering with PTSD.

Now they need your help.

In late 2015, The Wounded Walk will be teaming up with Emmy Award winning production company Lou Reda productions to film the documentary, “One Pill Twice Daily.” This raw and compelling documentary will take an in depth look at PTSD, the many methods for treating the disease, and The Wounded Walks mission to create experiences that empower veterans suffering from it. Known for the amazing visuals and production of History Channels WWII in HD and Vietnam in HD, Lou Reda productions aims to document Shatarsky and Delafields adventures across the country, highlighting  their mission and placing a spotlight on veterans using natural methods to overcome the injuries they sustained serving their country.

This campaign is of the utmost importance because our veterans suffering every day are tied down by the current pharmaceutical methods of treating PTSD, most of which do not work. The aim of this documentary is to shed light on this crippling affliction and spotlight alternative treatments that are available to our veterans.  With your donation we can show our nations veterans the many options available to them and empower those veterans to experience the life they are meant to experience; one full of promise, hope and dreams.

Here’s how your donations will be used:

-Production Costs (Crew and Equipment)

-Vehicles

-Travel

-Food, Lodging and gear

-Marketing Materials to promote film

-Surplus for The Wounded Walk Programs (to sponsor veterans in need)

Here's what you get:

Along with a tax deductible receipt for every donation, The Wounded Walk has created some fantastic perks to sweeten the deal. 

The official "Boots" and "Diamond Wings" T-shirts (both Men's and Women's)

The "Hope is a Waking Dream" flag

The Wounded Walk "C.M.E." Trucker Hat

And other super cool perks like personalized tags, an exclusive movie poster (hand drawn by a renowned artist), signed production notes, executive producer credit, the journey of a lifetime and many more.

Although the majority of the funds raised will be going to the production and release of The Wounded Walks upcoming film "One Pill, Twice Daily", we would also like to create a surplus to use in developing much needed programs that cater to the needs of physically and mentally wounded veterans. Our mission statement is:

"Creating Experiences that Empower Veterans to help Themselves and Others"

By creating experiences that empower veterans, rather than focusing solely on pharmaceutical treatments, we will be able to show our veterans that their lives can be amazing, rewarding and fulfilling.  Our bucket-list programs will give veterans suffering the ability to go on journeys of a lifetime; journeys all around the world with the ultimate end goal of healing from the inside out. We want to pave the way for our nations heroes by creating an atmosphere that allows not only growth, but the guidance that will help them transition back into civilian life on the right foot.


In closing, your donations will give us the ability to create experiences that save lives, one step at a time.


Thank you,


The Wounded Walk

story:
About a dog Summary

This is a Film I wrote and would love to make it a reality. 

It is about a woman who ends up fostering a dog, and through that dog she learns to love and come out of her shell. Yet, after years of having the dog, he gets sick. She finds out that he has cancer. So with the short time they have left she makes a bucket list for her dog and sets out to check them off and spend the best last few days with her dog:

  • I want to make this film so people will think twice about buying a dog and hopefully save a life and Adopt. There are so many great dogs in the animal shelter that are smarter and healthier then most pure bred dogs that are getting put down every day.
  • Also, I would love to change people's thought process that think pets are just possessions. They are a part of the family and should be treated as such. If just one person who sees this changes their mind on how they treat animals, then my film will be a success. 
  • Another major thing is, we have almost an ALL FEMALE CREW. I want people to know women can also create amazing films.

What We Need & What You Get

WE Need $5,000.

  • 100% of the money is going to the film. IE, paying people for their time, Food, lighting and camera equipment, locations, and submitting for film festivals.
  • For every $500 that is raised we will put up an interview of one of the actors or film crew so you can get to know us and keep up with the project.
  • If you donate over $100 we will send you a signed copy of the project once it's released to DVD.
  • If you donate over a $1,000 we will change one of the characters names in the movie to your name, and you will be added to the credits with special thanks. 

The Impact

By helping make this film possible you are going to help many women get more work in the film industry. 
You could also be helping hundreds of dogs find homes instead of being put down.
On top of all of that you will be helping me make one of my dreams come true.

Other Ways You Can Help

The biggest help is sharing this page with others so they can be aware of our film's goals and help back the project. If you can or can't donate but you know someone that supports women in film or dog rescue then please forward this to them. The more people that hear about this, the more likely this film will become a reality.

  • Every little bit helps. If you can only give $5 we will be over the moon with happiness. Just remember if everyone that sees this donates $5 it will add up fast. Then, before you know it, we will have enough to make this project a reality.  Thank you for your support!
story_txt:
About a dog Summary This is a Film I wrote and would love to make it a reality. 
It is about a woman who ends up fostering a dog, and through that dog she learns to love and come out of her shell. Yet, after years of having the dog, he gets sick. She finds out that he has cancer. So with the short time they have left she makes a bucket list for her dog and sets out to check them off and spend the best last few days with her dog:  I want to make this film so people will think twice about buying a dog and hopefully save a life and Adopt. There are so many great dogs in the animal shelter that are smarter and healthier then most pure bred dogs that are getting put down every day. Also, I would love to change people's thought process that think pets are just possessions. They are a part of the family and should be treated as such. If just one person who sees this changes their mind on how they treat animals, then my film will be a success.  Another major thing is, we have almost an ALL FEMALE CREW. I want people to know women can also create amazing films.

story:
Ice & Quiet - Documentary production

The Game Plan

Imagine living without hearing. You'd miss the sounds of the world - music, laughter, traffic noises as you try to cross the road, a friend shouting out in the street behind you, the roar of a crowd at a hockey game. Even the whistle of the referee or call of your teammates as you tried to play. Would you even try to play?

But what if there was a way you could despite this? What if deaf hockey was a thing?... Oh wait, it is. And it's got an exciting story we want to share with the world.

The Ontario Deaf Hockey Association was founded in 2011 to bring deaf and hearing individuals and athletes together and provide pathways in sport and hockey for deaf athletes in the province.  As our  athletes prepare for the Deaflympics (yeah, that's also a thing), we're putting together a documentary about deaf hockey to help build awareness of the sport and garner support for the love of the game.

And also just because it a fascinating topic, right?

As part of the documentary, we've partnered with many different organizations including the Hockey Hall of Fame, Glide,Karbon Sports, CrossIceHockey, Epic Toronto and Kobe Sportswear.

It's going to be an intriguing and arousing short documentary with game footage along with some fan interviews. But before we can put it all together, we need your help Raising CA$3,000 to cover things like equipment, location and interpreter costs. The remaining amount will be put back into the Ontario Deaf Hockey Association to ensure that the program's success to help athletes accomplish their dreams of playing hockey and representing their province and later, Team Canada at the Deaflympics.

So if you love hockey, are curious about a different version of the game or just want to be involved in an exciting documentary that will score goals at film festivals, here's your chance to get involved. We've got some great perks for all your generous support and because we're still in production there's even opportunity to be interviewed on screen!

What Winning Looks Like (what we need & what you get)

We're not asking for a lot, but every little bit you can contribute will make a significant difference. Your generosity will not only bring this documentary to life, but also give a voice to the voiceless and enable deaf kids and adults around Canada to dare to dream.

We're aiming to raise CA$3,000 for the short documentary and additional funds for the Ontario Deaf Hockey Association and the athletes involved.

As a thank you for your support, we've got some fantastic perks including social media shout outs, a download of the documentary and even an opportunity to be interviewed on the documentary during a game or have an acknowledgement in the credits.

So get involved today and give a voice to deaf hockey players across Ontario and Canada.

The SIGN-ificance of the Impact

Everyone of us is born with a dream of greatness. For many, that dream is in sport - a universal language which brings diverse groups of people together. But sadly, access to sport isn't always as easy as it should be.

According to the Canadian Association of the Deaf there are currently 350,000 culturally deaf Canadians and 3.15 million Canadians who identify as hard of hearing. Like with the hearing population, many love their hockey!

Deaf hockey breaks down the barriers for these fans and athletes and the Deaflympics provides a world class stage for our top athletes to represent their country.  It's an exciting sport with only a few small changes to the way it's played alongside everything you love our about our nation's game.

The documentary will raise awareness of this version of the game and help our stars as they work hard to represent themselves and their country. It will also show those who have a disability and those hockey-loving kids that they're not alone. They don't have to remain on the sidelines and they can still aspire for greatness now and in the future.

Will you help a child dream?

The Opposition (risks & challenges)

Putting a film together is never easy. Which is why we appreciate all of the hard work the cast and crew have put into this to make this film come to life and be able to spread the awareness about sports without barriers. We want to be able to have a message that if you can play, you can play.

Cheer us on (other ways you can help)

Looking for more ways to support the project and our wonderful athletes? Just as important as your generous financial support is your voice! So help us spread the word about the documentary, our association and deaf hockey in general.

Tell your friends and family about us. Use the buttons to share our crowdfunding campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and any other social media platform.

You can also follow us on Facebook and Twitter and visit our website for updates and news!
