story:
Invitation Relief

 

 

Invitation Relief: is a Non-Profit 501 3 (c) tax-exempt corporation focusing on Forced Migration and Health. 

This courageous initiative was founded in March 2006 by a Hassan Akmal, a graduate of the Forced Migration and Health Track of the Departments of Population and Family Health and Epidemiology at Columbia University's Mailman Graduate School of Public Health. The Founder, a former professional tennis player and Right to Play International Athlete Ambassador for the United States, represented the sport of tennis as a spokesperson while using sport for psychosocial development for disadvantaged children all over the world. 

 

 

The Impact: "Your Invitation Has Arrived"

 

Kids of the World is a worldwide project of Invitation Relief aimed at providing education and helping alleviate poverty globally in areas of forced migration. An online charity bazaar will be introduced in order to help raise funds for new and existing initiatives, as well as to sustain them long-term.

Invitation Relief launched the Human-Being Fund in 2013 which is currently raising funds for several international projects, including the charity bazaar.

 

Invitation Relief hopes to help underserved communities through improved access to education and enterprise by using cost effective technology and strengthening local resources: 'Micro/Macro-Enterprise'.

The mission is to optimize educational and medical infrastructure by increasing capacity of local personnel and organizations. By building a Online Charity Bazaar, funds raised will help build a stronger foundation for the education of underserved communities across the globe. 

Invitation Relief believes that native programs, infrastructure and organizations have unique strengths in identifying areas of need and opportunity. Thus, we are networking within communities to set up ongoing processes that will continue to grow a community's natural resources and confidence.

  • This project will be self-sustainable and will continue to grow and support multiple initiatives.
  • We are living in a time when natural disasters and conflict are at all time highs.
  • There is a shortage of food, clean water, funds, and non-governmental organizations (NGOs) targeting internally and externally displaced persons as a result of natural disasters and/or conflict.

Fundraising

 

We are currently raising funds for the following:

  • First-Ever Charity Bazaar Online Store
  • Merchandise/Inventory for Charity Bazaar
  • Invitation Relief Website
  • Inauguration and launch, 01/2016
  • Expenses to launch the Kids of the World Project in 2016 in multiple countries including Indonesia, Pakistan, India, Afghanistan, United States, Colombia (and other parts of South America), which has the third highest population of displaced persons in the world:
  • Funds will be used to sustain the Kids of the World Project and online charity bazaar
  • All funds will be held until fundraising goals are met.

We are close to our deadline so we need your help! Any donation amount is appreciated and word of mouth is very effective as well. If you can't donate, please help spread the word by any of the following:

  • Ask friends to help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign
  • Share us on Facebook
  • Join our group on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/groups/invitationrelief/
  • Like/share our YouTube video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tb0r2zF9rKQ
  • Share us on Twitter

Our Marketing Campaign is called "Faces of the World" featuring photos of street children and orphans from different parts of the world with their faces painted.

story:
The Call to Action

  • I am Dustin Darr, an undergrad Majoring in Media and Cultural Studies at the University of California Riverside, and I have a story to tell. I aspire to impact American culture through filmmaking, especially  at  a time like this in our history, at a moment when our country is at a cross roads once again. There is a problem with wealth distribution in the United States that is causing our middle class to disappear, making college more and more difficult to afford in the process. This has caused a decrease in our standard of living and has dramatically compromised American prosperity and the American Dream.
  • "Sketch" is a call to action - a revolution of cultural Ideals. It is a satire drama about an average college student named Dusty Kid, who is told by his father he can't follow his dreams in becoming a filmmaker. Rebelling against his father's economic power over his education, Dusty meets a group of outcast artists who seek to revolutionize their culture. However, in a rigged economy, they will be forced to use unorthodox methods to accomplish their dreams. We will educate and empower both younger and older generations about the destructive effects of college loan debt and tuition hikes and how they have been affecting our lives. In order to reach the largest audience, "Sketch" will be a web-series, created for and accessible to all those who are ready for the economic and educational revolution.

The Budget

  • As a young filmmaker, I know the tremendous difficulties that arise in creating a film. Without money and only a camera and dedicated casts, I have overcome these challenges and learned how to make a film without a budget. Although I have already acquired the equipment, actors, editing software, computers and lights needed to create "Sketch," we still need your help. In order to make this a reality, we need $3,500.  This budget will cover locations, transportation, costume, emergency costs and catering for cast and crew. Without funds to cover these expenses, it is not only difficult but impossible to finish a project longer than 15 minutes.
  • One thousand dollars will go to costumes, makeup and catering. Another thousand dollars will cover locations such as a cafe, lecture halls and classrooms, ect. The rest will go to transportation, greenscreens and any emergency equipment. 
  • If Our Goal is not met all the funds go to producing the perks and the production of the Project. 

The Cast

Audrey Napoli

   

Zachariah Jolin

Sydney Sroka

Damien Darr

Anthony Fisher

Lauren Velasco

Zach Porter

Marcus Cocova- Director of Photography

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you cannot donate, you can still participate in the revolution. By spreading the word about our project and sharing our campaign with your friends on social media, you can help make this dream a reality. If you are interested in being a part of one of our "Street Teams" or an "extra" atmospheric character in one of the scenes, please email us at SketchWebSeries@Yahoo.com. 

 Lets protect our dreams, a dream big enough to fit the world inside, a dream worth dreaming for, because If we dream just big enough, we might just do it. 
-Sketch

story:
Thank you for visiting our fundraising campaign for THE NORTH SHORE. We are excited to create this short film - but we need your help! Check out the video for more information about our film!


The Story

Marta finds herself back in her childhood home temporarily caring for Charlie, the son of her estranged sister whom she hardly knows. After Charlie mysteriously breaks his leg, Marta senses a presence in the house. Is she merely haunted by childhood memories or is it something more?

The Cast


Katherine C. McDonald | Marta

Katherine C. McDonald is an actress based in New York City. Favorite theatre roles include Rebecca in Ibsen’s Rosmersholm (Random Access Theatre) which she also adapted, Joan in After the Dance (Co-op Theatre East/The Dirty Blondes), Le Franc in Deathwatch (NYC Fringe), Lady Capulet in Romeo & Juliet (Inwood Shakespeare), and Martirio in The House of Bernarda Alba (Apollinaire Theatre Co, Boston). She’s also had lead roles in several independent films including Lost Language (Official Selections at both the NYC International and Manhattan Film Festivals). Originally from Texas, Katherine earned a B.A. in theatre performance and philosophy from Baylor University. She also trained at the Atlantic Acting School and the British American Drama Academy. More info/ voiceover & film reels at www.KatherineCMcDonald.com

Brian Roach | James

Brian Roach is a New York City based actor originally from upstate New York. He recently originated the lead of Greg in The Perfect Murder with Manhattan Repertory Theatre/Monkey In a Tuxedo Productions. Other recent credits include: NYC Theatre: Our Town (George Gibbs) with Tongue and Cheek Theater, The Laramie Project (Multiple roles) with Mount Carmel Theatre Company, The Laramie Project: 10 Years Later (Multiple Roles) with Mount Carmel Theatre Company, The Graduate (Carl & Ensemble) with the Heights Players; Film: Boy on a Bike, The Dream, Mutual Friends; TV: Mysteries at the Castle, Investigation Discovery: Deadly Sins, World's Astonishing News. BA in Human Development from Binghamton University, with additional coursework in acting at New York University and Weist Barron Studios.

Sam Schaub | Charlie

Jeremy Patrick Hamilton | Kev/Writer/Director 

Jeremy Patrick Hamilton is a New York based actor, writer and producer. Originally from New Mexico, he holds a BFA in Theater Performance from Eastern New Mexico University and has also studied acting and movement at the Caymichael Patten Studio in Manhattan. As a writer, he has studied at The Second City (New York) and at the Michael Imperioli helmed Studio Dante. With Hawk House Productions, Jeremy has collaborated on several film projects as well as worked as the Art Director for the Katy Scoggin directed short film “Flood”.


Where does your donation go? 

Great question! It takes a village...
In order for us to produce the type of film we would like to make, we need your help.
Here's a brief breakdown of where your donation will go:
  • Equipment & Editing - Lighting, Camera Lenses, Sound Equipment, etc.
  • Travel - We will be filming in a charming mid-century house located on the north shore of Long Island. Since most of those involved live in the city, we will need to make travel arrangements for cast and crew as well as all of our equipment. 
  • Crew - Director of Photography, Assistant Camera, Gaffer, Make-up Artists, Production Designer....you name it, we need 'em!
  • Catering - Our cast and crew will be staying on location, so we'll need to provide three square meals a day, plus snacks! 
  • Film Festival Application Fees - We would like to submit our film into as many film festivals as possible!


Other Ways You Can Help

Whether or not you are able to make a financial contribution, please consider sharing our project with family, friends, or anyone you think might be interested! Thank you so much for your support - we truly can not do it without you.

Travel - We will be filming in a charming mid-century house located on the north shore of Long Island. Since most of those involved live in the city, we will need to make travel arrangements for cast and crew as well as all of our equipment. 

Crew - Director of Photography, Assistant Camera, Gaffer, Make-up Artists, Production Designer....you name it, we need 'em!

Catering - Our cast and crew will be staying on location, so we'll need to provide three square meals a day, plus snacks! 

Film Festival Application Fees - We would like to submit our film into as many film festivals as possible!


    
Other Ways You Can Help Whether or not you are able to make a financial contribution, please consider sharing our project with family, friends, or anyone you think might be interested! Thank you so much for your support - we truly can not do it without you.

story:
A Word about My Background

Hi! I’m Patrick and I am a trans man. I am one of the 3 trans activists in Romania, a film director and one of the organisers of the first film festival devoted to Romania’s LGBTQ community, FAQiff. 

It took me 11 years to start my transition and live as myself. 

Those hard years taught me a lesson: some of us have to delve into the darkest parts of our soul and put it all out into the light in order to be able to do what most people find easy: breathe freely as the person we really are. Since I became an activist I’ve learned that personal stories are powerful weapons. I want to tell the story of the most important moment of my life: getting my mom’s acceptance and blessing to start my transition. 

Did I get them? You’ll have to wait for the movie to find that out.

This film has been on my mind for nearly 2 years and finally it's all coming together. We are shooting in February, to have it ready in time for the submission deadline of the Cannes Film Festival. We will be filming in the village where I grew up and in my grandparents’ house. 

Here's a glimpse of the village: 


Abreast centers on the most pivotal walk in my life, a walk my mom and I took together one winter day. That was when I opened up to her and tried to get her to see my transition through my eyes. That’s what the title refers to; walking side by side in the same direction, towards the same goal - I shared my decision with her so that she’d go on this journey with me. 

I dreamed big that day, but then again, it’s what I’ve always done. As a kid growing up in a small provincial village in Romania, I wouldn’t be where I am now if I hadn't chased my dreams. And the wilder they were, the more I held on to them. I am now living in the capital city, with 10 years’ worth of experience in the film industry under my belt. During that time, I’ve been a director, a script consultant, a story editor and a personal assistant to English directors working on Romanian projects. I’ve produced / directed / wrote over 100 hours of TV, all aired. 

I’m also the executive director of the first Romanian association that fights exclusively for the rights of trans people, TRANSform. Just a few months after we founded TRANSform, we had already formed a community of over 100 trans Romanians, living both here and abroad. 

We did it all on next to nothing, powered by the love and support of those who understand or live the fight of being a trans person in a transphobic country. In May 2014, I was given a full scholarship to attend the 5th Transgender European Council in Budapest, Hungary, with over 200 other participants coming from 50 countries. Then, in June 2014, I had the honor of producing and holding an interview with writer and lecturer Andrew Solomon, winner of the National Book Award, LGBT activist and a powerful voice in support of the arts.

Among my biggest achievements to date, organizing the first feminist and queer international film festival in Romania was a feat that the TRANSform team and I managed to make happen in November 2015. FAQiff was a labor of love, for which I was honored to put together the short film selection, out of over 1000 submissions.The first edition of FAQiff was held in one of Bucharest’s biggest arthouse cinemas, to a full house every night.

Why Abreast Matters to the Trans Community 

That Abreast sees the light of day is important not just to me as its creator but to the community as a whole. Most of us have lived through some version of this moment I’m describing in my short, and we know first-hand how loved ones reacting badly when we’re at our most vulnerable can hurt us, derail our dreams, even crush us beyond repair.

The trans community in Romania finds itself on the wrong end of so much misconception and narrow-mindedness every single day - which is why this film has to happen. It has to happen in full view, to spark a conversation that is long overdue in this country, and it has to ultimately foster acceptance and respect. 

So it’s paramount that Abreast be made with your help, through IndieGoGo, in order to gain the support of the worldwide community, a cachet of approval that will go a long way toward shifting public opinion on trans matters in Romania. 

Aside from gaining these credit points at home through the support of the international community, the campaign will also help us financially. The money raised will put Abreast through post-production as well as go towards paying festival submission fees. I will not stop until I’ve put Abreast in the hands of every selector of every major film festival out there.

This Is Bigger Than Me: You Are Effecting Real Change

This film is not just about my story. As one of the few visible activists in my country, I have learned that, in an overly regulated and closed society such as ours, it is important that the stories of the ones who cannot yet speak up be made known to the world. These stories alone can help build a community that will eventually prevail. What I mean by that is I hope this film will give people courage to take the first step, as hard as I know that is. That’s why, with Abreast, I’m trying to reach as many people as possible, both those in need of acceptance from their families, and also those struggling to come to terms with a loved one going through a transition to become their true selves.

What We Need & What You Get

We want to create a community around Abreast, and that’s where you come in - not just as financial contributors to our cause, but also by helping us get the word out and create some buzz around the film and its purpose.

The bulk of the 7,000 dollars we’re asking for - as much as 90% of it - will go into post-producing Abreast, and I’ll be putting whatever money remains into festival submissions fees and attendant costs. Even if the campaign ends up raising a fraction of our goal, it will all still go toward making Abreast happen - it’s a story so personal and yet so resoundingly ours, the community’s as a whole, that I’ll sell everything I’ve got before I let it die.

Moving on to a lighter subject, I really hope you’ll like the perks we’ve prepared for you, our IGG family: pins, personal live streaming sessions from the set, posters, DVDs with the final-cut of the film, making of and bloopers, portraits made by the same artist who signs the Abreast poster and in the same style, and even credits as associate producer.  

The Impact 

If you are a trans person, or you have trans friends or simply a humane interest in our struggle, you know how hard it is. Contributing to this will make you an ally to one of the most unfairly and illegally treated minorities in Romania. If you ever visit Romania, you will find a family here, a network of support made up of open-hearted people you will have in your corner no matter what!

I have been in the film industry for over a decade. I have been thinking about and shaping this project for a while now, getting the best possible professionals on board. And so I can say without any false modesty, as an artist, director and production manager, that I know this project will meet the highest quality standards. I already have the support of senior film professionals such as Maia Morgenstern, best known internationally for her role in The Passion of the Christ, as well as other highly regarded Romanian film pros. I also know that this film will be a turning point in the life of my community and it will not pass unnoticed in international film festivals.

My film will be ready in 2 months, if we come up with the minimum amount of 7,000 dollars, and, with the help of my network of filmmakers and promoters, I will disseminate it across all possible channels. Your name will be in the credits, and so a LOT of people will find out about your invaluable help in making Abreast happen!

Risks & Challenges

Right now the primary obstacle in making Abreast a reality is represented by production costs. Once these are taken care of I am confident that I will be able to promote my work via a great diversity of channels, including submitting it to festivals such as Cannes, Berlin and others.

I am currently pursuing other possible avenues, like trying to get sponsorships from local businesses. Having said that and considering the transphobic climate in Romania, it’s really this IndieGoGo campaign and you guys that I genuinely think will help overcome the challenge of meeting production costs.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please use all social sharing tools at your disposal to promote my project to other trans people and/or friends and supporters of the trans people’s fight for recognition! It is essential that as many people as possible learn about my initiative to make Romanian trans people’s voice heard. This is the first project of its kind, and we need all the support we can get from outside our country, so that, little by little, we can make Romanian society acknowledge the harm it’s inflicting on us by letting hate and misinformation run rampant.

story:
Hi there,

My name is Nate Abtan, I am a 24 year-old college student and New York native. I came out to California to pursue a healthier lifestyle for myself. Throughout my journey, I have met a wonderful group of guys involved in the arts. All of us are pursuing careers in theater and film. We recently watched an early showing of 'The Revenant' and were blown away by both the performances and the portrayal of a stunning, yet dangerous wilderness. For the past couple of weeks we've been planning a short comedic parody of the The Revenant, titled 'The Petulant'.

We are looking to raise $3,000 so that we can rent props, costumes, permits and transportation up to a location north of Fresno, CA, where we will be filming it.

We do not expect to make any money off of this film, but have high hopes of it going viral. All benefactors will be acknowledged and we will be promoting the project around Park City during the Sundance Film Festival.

We will also be taking a lot of Behind the Scenes footage to bring you in on the experience of making this project. We will be posting an extended behind-the-scenes video shortly after the release of the parody.

This is simply a project of creativity and passion, an homage to the powerful original work. We are immensely appreciative of everyone who is helping bring our idea to fruition.

Thank you for checking us out!
-Nate Abtan, Yisrael Dubov, Daniel Bacsik, Sean Topps, and Mendel Katz


pet·u·lant

/ˈpeCHələnt/

adjective
        (of a person or their manner) childishly sulky or bad-tempered.

story:
Short Summary

MY HEART IS NO LONGER AN ORPHAN

a Yugoslav Love Story

She was seventeen and he twenty years old, when they met at a poetry read in a city in Macedonia, then part of country known as the jewel of the Balkans.

He was more of a poet than she was, always brooding and sad even when he was happy. She was a bubbly tomboy who liked his attention and was tickled by the nickname he gave her, Paola.  Salvatore Adamo’s Paola Dulce Paola played on every radio station in Europe and the thought that he could compare her to the real princess amused her. He claimed his Paola was just as pretty and as personable as the real Paola Margherita Giuseppina Maria Antonia Consiglia.

They had three days together and he left the Festival convinced that he he had found his half.  She was molded by the sun, he said, and she was the one.  They promised to write until they meet again at another poetry read, in August.  

For the next 3 months they wrote and made plans, and he would revisit those letters and the events of that distant 1969 now and then, as if to punish himself. 

In the city of Struga where every August poets gather to read their dreams, he searches for Paola but cannot find her.  Heartbroken, he is reluctant to leave but under pressure from his fellow travel companions, he abides.  Paola arrives two hours later.

Over the course of the next 49 years he would create his own myth and wallow in the guilt of not having waited for her.   Trapped into two marriages, both empty of any emotional connections, he would carry Paola’s absence in his heart and through the haunting imagery of his poetic verses.  The handsome youth turns into a dark and a somber man who lives with Paola’s absence and a cry that emanates from his heart…. Why are you not here?

Young hearts wound easily and Paola would take his absence as a clear sign that he did not care. She locks away the memory of the promise he held and moves on.  Shortly after Struga 69 she leaves her native land, curious to understand the word.  Off first to Paris, she would eventually settle in New York City. She doesn’t just walk through live, she dives.

In 1984, she would arrive at the Sarajevo Airport, to work on covering the Winter Olympics the same day he would fly to yet another festival in Struga, the town in which they missed one another.

In 1991 he would be in Belgrade for the Annual Book Fair when she is there producing a film.

They would miss one another at the Nikola Tesla airport, when she leaves for the United States and he flies back to his hometown in Montenegro.

In the early 90s, Paola watches from afar as her native land dives into the abyss of hatred, but she fears for no one, he is absent from the hallways of her memories.

In the midst of the horror he writes his last poem:  My Father’s rifle.

He would be reminded of her every time the name Paola  comes up-- when the real princess’s husband, the Belgian King to be visits Yugoslavia for talks with Marshal Tito, when the Princess, now Sua Altessa Royale, vacations on the Adriatic Coast, when the scandal of her husband illegitimate daughter is strewn over the European yellow press, when Salvatore Adamo explains on an Italian talk show what inspired him to write Paola Dulce Paola.

An old man at 70, much too old for his age, he has turned to God for answers, and every Sunday he asks the same question - Why did I leave?  Why didn’t I wait?  Is it because I did not have faith in my own capacity to love?  I did know she was the one, yet I bend under pressure to marry and raise a daughter that was not mine. Why?

Forty nine years later, on a crisp Sunday in May  in 2018 , at the end of another Sunday church service, he muses, looking down at his smartphone…I could have found her, if these little gadgets existed then, he says.  It was destiny, says a churchgoer he has befriended. 

But destiny can be challenged.

In New York City, Paola enters her apartment and hears the familiar email jingle. She walks to the monitor. The message on the screen reads: Paola Dulce Paola, do you remember Prilep and 1969? I never forgot.

***

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

And ode to a beautiful land 

 

Risks & Challenges

This iwllbe a two-weeks shoot which does not  invoive  special effects or  very high end and costly produciotn scenees. Tsi sis an ancotrs' dirven film.   The story is told thugh poetry,  lonely walks of the poeple missing one another and poetry readings. . 

 

 The events take palce dugthe happyYugoslav time, whent he cutnry held thepormise of a great brightfutre ofr itspoeple and hwne  people love s and hoped... The film willnto tellteh dark sotry of Yugslvia; so many films ahve benemade that   only  porote the hate among thepoele ; 1969 was a year fullfoporimse and hope and os tdid htelove sotry. Themtafor of hte film is in thta voth bend up tragically. but were tow happy moement sin  the existnes ofhte tow lvers which trnascends the happineed of hte poeple in hte ocytrn that isolonger.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can donate, but here are ways you can help:

  • Get the word out! We need as much help as we can get, so please tell your friends and invite them to help!
  • Share this Indiegogo: scroll back up to the top and click those social links!
  • LIKE us on Facebook

story:
The Choice Project is a documentary film about one of most important decisions that each of us must make everyday - the food we choose to eat. The Choice Project has been featured on Animal Planet, BBC Brasil, Fox News, CBS News, Daily Mail, and many other notable media outlets.


The Choice Project began as an experiment performed by health and fitness enthusiast, Michael Konowalski. Originally from Poland, Michael works as a nutritionist and has always pursued an active lifestyle. When he first arrived in America, he was astonished to learn about American culture and dieting habits. He ditched his diet and training regime to embark on a year-long journey to fully embrace the American lifestyle. He ate fast food regularly, took pills when he didn’t feel well, and sat on the couch to watch TV on most nights. He began to feel like most people, that he didn’t have a choice anymore - and it wasn’t long before his body started to feel the effects. He knew he needed to do something DRASTIC.

Michael put his body - physically and mentally - to the test yet again. He figured that the canned dog food he was feeding his Boxer twice a day had to be more nutritious than the food he had been eating himself. He changed his diet once again, but this time, he would be sharing meals with man’s best friend for his new “Pet Food Diet”. Throughout his fascinating journey, Michael was followed by numerous health specialists and spoke to experts in the field about the obesity epidemic in the United States. He recorded his experiences in hopes of creating this inspiring documentary and prove that we do have a CHOICE. What will yours be?

What We Need

All of the footage has been recorded; all that's needed now is post-production. Inbornmedia Production House will cut 65 hours of footage, design motion graphics and titles, score and sound mix, complete voice over and color correction. This project has been funded out-of-pocket up until this point, and now we need our community's help to bring the full-feature film to life!

▶ Editing - The editor has to cut 65 hours of footage Micheal has recorded for a year and edit about one hour movie 
▶ Directing - Our director has to build an engaging story from all pieces and spend a few weeks of his life arguing with the stubborn editor in one room 
▶ Motion Graphics and Titles - Our graphics designer has to make the story visually attractive 
▶ Score - Paying for all music used in the movie 
▶ Voice over - This is the voice and narration that will lead us through the plot smoothly 
▶ Sound design - We need good sound effects and good music throughout the whole movie 
▶ Sound Mix - Getting the audio ready for broadcast 
▶ Color Correction - Getting the video ready for broadcast 
▶ Festival submissions - Paying submission fees for festivals worldwide 

Why It Matters

The start of the new year is a time of resolutions for many people. We want to spread the message that people have a choice when it comes to nutrition and health! We’ve been working on this project for five years now and it is time to share our efforts with America. The success of the movie validates all of the hard work and countless hours that volunteers have dedicated to the project.

How to Help for FREE

If you’re not able to donate, you can still help by spreading the word!
  • Use Indiegogo’s share tools to share this campaign on your Facebook, Twitter & Instagram and be sure to tag us in it!
  • Comment on this campaign. Go to the top of the page and click on the “Comments”. We’d love to hear what you’re thinking!
  • Follow The Choice Project on social media to see our progress!

story:
Case Overview

The names Max Martin. I'm a Private Eye from 1946. I look pretty good for my age, I know. I was sent to this year by some voodoo magic put on me in a lousy deli while I was workin' on a case. With your help, I can find Julie West's prized possession, solve the case, and make it home all before my brother gets back from his sabbatical. I need to solve this. If I don't- I don't know if I'll ever make it home. 

All the answers lie with the Totem and the elusive Ms. West. 


Case Specifics

Here's a little more detail for ya baby-faces out there:


  • Crackpot team
I'm still adjusting to this new life so I had to hire a few yuppies to help out. But they ain't cheap.

  • Food
To keep the new kids quiet I gotta feed them everyday we're working and boy oh boy can they eat. Especially one- you know who you are. But I'm happy to do it. A little food ain't nothing if it means I can get home. 

  • Equipment
I gotta say- this modern technology is tempting me to stay. All I needed before was some dust, a brush, keen eyes, and a sharp wit. Now I gotta get myself a computer, some fancy cameras, and a whole lot more dodads. My team knows how to work them all though so I just gotta make sure we have enough batteries for it all. 

  • Travel
Do I need to explain any further than gas? How do people nowadays go anywhere?

  • Bribes
This is my favorite part of the PI game. Seeing who will crack for a little bit of money. Flash a little green and see who opens the doors to let you in. The team has found some confidants but only if the price is right. Don't let the leads go cold, people, don't do it. These young ones worked hard for it.

  • Misc
You never know who you're gonna have to bail out from the slammer. I've spent a few nights there myself. Being a Private Eye isn't always easy or glamorous. Sometimes you're sleeping next to a guy who had a little bit too much at the bars. 
If we don't hit the whole amount needed we'll still keep plowing ahead in this case. Justice will prevail or my name isn't Max Martin.

Earning Your Stripes

There are a lot of ways to be a part of this case. Just look at the ways you can move up the ranks in the force! But if you for some reason aren't able to put some gas in our tank then feel free to let your friends know about our mission. Share my case with the world! Who knows? Maybe another confidant is right around the corner!

  • Word of mouth is an easy tool in the PI world. Just give this campaign a share on social media.

Team Bios

They're a good group of kids, fresh faced and eager. After this case though they'll be hardened veterans.

You got the leader of the new crew. My right hand man- Dan. He'll be making a lot of the decisions that I don't have time to think about. 

His right hand is Abbi. She'll be making sure we don't blow through all the funds we have. It's gonna be harder than it looks because I have my eye on a new piece of equipment.

Dan's left hand is Charlotte. She's gonna make sure that Dan doesn't slack off when it comes to solving this case. She's gonna keep my team on track.

story:
The film | Il film

James, a theoretical physicist who has come close to winning the Nobel Prize many times, suddenly drops out of everything, leaving England and retiring to a small town in Liguria, a region in the Italian riviera. Ben, his son, comes to Italy to convince him to return to his former life. Their meeting will reveal the mystery behind the unexpected retirement of James.

James, un fisico teorico più volte vicino a vincere il Premio Nobel, improvvisamente molla tutto e si ritira dall'Inghilterra presso un piccolo borgo della Liguria. Ben, suo figlio, giunge in Italia per convincere il padre a riprendere la sua vita. Il loro incontro rivelerà il mistero che si cela dietro l'inaspettato ritiro di James. 

The project | Il progetto

A Cup of Tea is an independent short film produced by Giotto Produzioni in association with Studio Moglia & Associati, with the contribution of Genova Liguria Film Commission and Mediateca Regionale Ligure, shot in and around the wonderful Gulf of Poets in the province of La Spezia (Liguria). This is the first time an international story for the big screen has been set in this area. Our idea was to use wonderful locations where we could adapt an intriguing plot that would surprise the audience with its atmosphere, an unexpected ending and an aura of mystery throughout. So our intention is not only to promote the amazing places in this part of Liguria but also, by telling the story in English, promote both the story and as a consequence the film internationally. Even though the shooting was completely set in Liguria, the director and the actors worked during the post-production at 5A Studios (London), for the A.D.R. recording.

A Cup of Tea è un cortometraggio indipendente prodotto da Giotto Produzioni in associazione con Studio Moglia & Associati, con il contributo di Genova Liguria Film Commission e Mediateca Regionale Ligure, girato a fine estate sopra lo splendido Golfo dei Poeti, in provincia della Spezia. Per la prima volta presso questi luoghi è stata ambientata una storia per il grande schermo e di respiro internazionale. L'idea è stata quella di utilizzare splendide location per adattare una storia intrigante che sorprenderà lo spettatore per la sua atmosfera e per il suo esito finale, rimanendo sempre sul filo del mistero. Il nostro intento è valorizzare quindi le magnifiche location che offre questo scorcio di Liguria ma raccontando in inglese, rendendo quindi la storia e il film apprezzabili in pieno anche al di fuori dei nostri confini. Nonostante le riprese sia state completamente realizzate in Liguria, il regista e gli attori hanno lavorato presso i 5A Studios di Londra durante la post-produzione, relativamente alla fase di doppiaggio dei dialoghi.

Your support | Il tuo supporto

Now the film is finished so the time has come to release it. The best way to get a short film known and appreciated is by sending it to as many international film festivals as possible, so that it can be chosen and then regarded by experts and the general public. Sending a film to several festivals can involve many charges, from the mere entry fees up to the delivery of the film's copy and, if the film is selected, composition of a DCP on hard disk for the première. Your support enables us to face these forthcoming costs, with the advantage that you will know exactly what your own support is set apart for. For a concluded work and not a project still just at an initial stage. 

Ora che il film è completato è arrivato il momento di distribuirlo. Il modo migliore per far conoscere ed apprezzare un cortometraggio è inviarlo al maggior numero possibile di festival internazionali, per fare in modo che venga selezionato e quindi notato da pubblico ad addetti ai lavori. L'invio di un'opera cinematografica ad un elevato numero di festival può comportare diverse spese, dalla semplice iscrizione alla spedizione di una copia del film e, in caso di selezione, la preparazione del formato DCP su hard disk per la proiezione ufficiale. Il tuo supporto può aiutarci ad affrontare queste spese future, con la consapevolezza che tale aiuto sia indirizzato verso un'opera già ultimata e non soltanto un progetto ancora in embrione.

Your reward | La tua ricompensa

All that we'll give you in return for your help is an 8 GB USB flash drive inside a collectors' elegant package with an official photo from the set, chosen among the five images available to portray a scene of the film. This is the flash drive content:

  • "A Cup of Tea" in HD, in English and with Italian subtitles
  • the making of
  • the official trailer
  • more than 150 backstage photos 
  • the original soundtrack
  • the film poster in high resolution
  • pdf with info in English and Italian

Ciò che riceverai in cambio del tuo supporto è una pen drive USB da 8 GB che troverai in un'elegante confezione da collezione, raffigurante all'interno una foto ufficiale dal set, tra cinque diverse disponibili, a rappresentare una scena del film. Il contenuto della pen drive comprende:

  • "A Cup of Tea" in HD, in inglese e con sottotitoli in italiano
  • il making of
  • il trailer ufficiale
  • più di 150 foto di backstage 
  • la colonna sonora originale
  • la locandina del film in alta risoluzione
  • pdf informativo in inglese e italiano

story:
Documentary about socio-political situation in Kosovo by Serbian journalist Milenko Sreckovic

Documentary about Kosovo will be a critical research of the living conditions of people in this region. It will reveal the real truth about Kosovo, one that is unknown and repressed by corruption, crime and ethnic hatred. Many relevant layers of the history will be presented and main contemporary issues dealt with in overt and unembellished manner: in the first place the question of whether there is any possible way out of poverty, ethnically motivated murders and accompanying destruction. By delving into these issues, this documentary will also uncover the role of international factors in general, in the war zones such as Kosovo. It will examine to what extent the international missions such as EULEX and UNMIK, as well as NATO troops within KFOR (Kosovo Force), manage to provide decent life and sufficient livelihood for all ethnic groups living in Kosovo. Did they succeed to eradicate or at least reduce ethnic cleansing, corruption and crime during their presence, or their involvement in Kosovo crisis had some other effects? Finally, we would like to emphasize that this film will be based only on our research on the field, dealing with reliable/credible sources and verifiable facts, without any biases favoring ethnic hatred or interests of different controversial (xenophobic, chauvinistic) groups. The movie will be subtitled in English in order to be available to the world wide audience.

By the means of this documentary we will be able to investigate and present the reality of everyday life in Kosovo to the international audience from the anti-imperialistic social perspective. The daily torments and misery of a great number of people, who seems to be neglected not just by the international public and media, but also by the diplomacy and politicians, will reach the light of the day. We will use many channels to spread this ugly truth as wide as possible, in the hope that institutions and organizations in charge of monitoring and rectifying this kind of situations – massive-scale violations of human rights – will reexamine their role in the escalation of internal conflicts and deterioration of inter-ethnic relations in Kosovo, and thus allow for more appropriate solution to be reached. At this point, we are not in the position to indicate what this solution should be, but we are confident that it cannot be found without taking into account the voice and the will of the people – of all ethnic origins – whose experience and opinions are one of the main subjects of our movie. To this end, our documentary will be aired on TV networks, international documentary festivals and, finally, made available to watch in the internet. Our systematic presentation of the real state of affairs in Kosovo, and refutation of current blatant propaganda, should convince the officials from both local and global camps that they cannot continue to turn the blind eye to this blind spot of South-East Europe, ignoring the fate of the hundreds of thousands, treated as for them the most basic human laws and regulations do not apply.

The money raised from contributors should help us to cover all necessary costs of travel, food, accommodation and equipment during the shooting of the documentary, as well as to allow us to buy copyrights of the video material from the archives we need. According to our estimations, the final amount needed for successful completion of our project will be around 7.400$. These resources will also be used to hire professional cameraman and editor, pay unexpected contingencies and, if necessary, to procure the services of local officials. All payments will be duly recorded, with tickets, receipts or signed descriptive notes, and records will be properly kept for auditing.

Our project’s primary value is in giving voice to the oppressed social groups, denied of democratic representatives, or represented in such a way which could not possibly protect or advance their basic rights and interests. We also hope to raise general awareness about criminal injustice, ongoing segregation, political and police oppression, economic difficulties and double standards taking place on the part of European soil itself. According to our sources, media fabricated stories about Kosovo have been used to cover up a much more important question – relating not just to Kosovo, but to all countries and provinces forced to meet a similar fate, be they in Europe, or Africa, or Middle East etc. – and that is what is the real purpose and tangible achievement of international missions? Are they capable to protect all ethnic groups from the violent attacks, post-war retaliations and ethnically motivated executions, and to establish legal and administrative system free of corruption, as they do not hesitate to guarantee? At the moment, we cannot deal with this problem in other countries. But, with regard to Kosovo, our film will break through the facade of media whitewashing and empty political slang concealing the simple and dreadful facts, investigate how things are really going on under the bell jar, show the real people’s suffering and destitution, deliver their own words, thoughts, fears and desires and spread their yet unheard message to the world.

If you are not in the position to donate money, please spread the word about this project and send it to your friends by the Indiegogo share tools.

Production team - biographies

(Scriptwriter Vladimir Bogićević and director Milenko Srećković

(Milenko Srećković, director)

Milenko Srećković is born in 1982 in Veliko Krčmare near Kragujevac. He finished elementary school in Rača and technical high school in Kragujevac. He graduated at the Department for General Literature and Theory of Literature of the Belgrade Faculty of Philology.

He is the columnist of daily newspaper “Politika” since November 2013. He is a founder of the Freedom Fight Movement (Pokret za slobodu), and as the Secretary of the Coordination Committee of Workers Protests he organized many protests against privatization theft.

He was editor of the Serbian edition of “Z magazine” (2007-2009) and of internet magazine in English, “Freedom Fight Info”. He also edited books in Serbian “Deindustrialization and Workers Resistance” (2011), “Land and Freedom” (2011), “Struggle for the Future” (2013) and “Landgrabbing – Resistance and Alternatives” (2014).

In April 2015 he published the book “Svako zaslužuje spas” (Everybody deserves to be saved), compilation of publicist works from 2013 to 2015 (available in Serbian here). And in December 2015 he published the book “Corporate Imperialism: The Zones of Exploitation in Serbia” (available in English here and in Serbian here).

In July 2016 he made a documentary film ''Just a Witness'' that deals with ethnic cleansing commited after the arrival of NATO troops in Kosovo. The trailer for the movie you can see here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vc_a-YvwLXc, or read an interview about it here: http://www.politika.rs/sr/clanak/358450/Americki-pesnik-kao-ocevidac-progona

(Vladimir Bogićević, scriptwriter)

Vladimir Bogićević is born in 1980 in Belgrade. He finished elementary school and high school in Petrovac, and graduated at the Department for General Literature and Theory of Literature of the Belgrade Faculty of Philology. He works as a teaching associate and prepares his doctoral thesis at the same Faculty today.

He wrote two books of short stories and poetry – “Druga strana Mebijusove trake” (The Other Side of The Moebius Strip) in 1998 and “Deklinacije” (Declinations) in 2006 – and a number of essays and scientific papers in the field of philology (“Two Revitalizing Counter-Cultures” in 2016, “In Search of Unpresentable: ‘Detectives of Sublime’ in (Post)Modern American Novel” in 2015, “The Worlds of Master and Margarita” in 2014, “Language and Subjectivity in ‘Hamlet’” in 2005, etc.). He has freelanced as a translator, proofreader and reviewer of various cultural, political and literary papers, for various employers (Faculty of Philosophy in Kosovska Mitrovica, Anti-Corruption Council in Belgrade, etc.).

Since 2007, he is a member of Freedom Fight Movement (Pokret za slobodu), for which he performed miscellaneous tasks – wrote, translated and edited numerous articles, bulletins, conference reports, web pages, etc. He participated to the publication of Serbian edition of “Z magazine” (2007-2009) and internet magazine “Freedom Fight Info” and took part in editing most of the books published by Freedom Fight Movement since 2011.

*
If you are not in the position to donate money, please spread the word about this project and send it to your friends by the Indiegogo share tools.

It will reveal the real truth about Kosovo, one that is unknown and repressed
by corruption, crime and ethnic hatred. Many relevant layers of the history
will be presented and main contemporary issues dealt with in overt and
unembellished manner: in the first place the question of whether there is any
possible way out of poverty, ethnically motivated murders and accompanying
destruction. By delving into these issues, this documentary will also uncover
the role of international factors in general, in the war zones such as Kosovo. It will examine to what extent the international
missions such as EULEX and UNMIK, as well as NATO troops within KFOR (Kosovo
Force), manage to provide decent life and sufficient livelihood for all ethnic
groups living in Kosovo. Did they succeed to eradicate or at least reduce
ethnic cleansing, corruption and crime during their presence, or their
involvement in Kosovo crisis had some other effects? Finally, we would like to
emphasize that this film will be based only on our research on the field,
dealing with reliable/credible sources and verifiable facts, without any biases
favoring ethnic hatred or interests of different controversial (xenophobic,
chauvinistic) groups. The movie will be subtitled in English in order to be
available to the world wide audience.By
the means of this documentary we will be able to investigate and present the reality of everyday life in Kosovo to the
international audience from the anti-imperialistic social perspective. The
daily torments and misery of a great number of people, who seems to be
neglected not just by the international public and media, but also by the
diplomacy and politicians, will reach the light of the day. We will use many
channels to spread this ugly truth as wide as possible, in the hope that
institutions and organizations in charge of monitoring and rectifying this kind
of situations – massive-scale violations of human rights – will reexamine their
role in the escalation of internal conflicts and deterioration of inter-ethnic
relations in Kosovo, and thus allow for more appropriate solution to be reached.
At this point, we are not in the position to indicate what this solution should
be, but we are confident that it cannot be found without taking into account
the voice and the will of the people – of all ethnic origins – whose experience
and opinions are one of the main subjects of our movie. To this end, our
documentary will be aired on TV networks, international documentary festivals
and, finally, made available to watch in the internet. Our systematic
presentation of the real state of affairs in Kosovo, and refutation of current
blatant propaganda, should convince the officials from both local and global
camps that they cannot continue to turn the blind eye to this blind spot of
South-East Europe, ignoring the fate of the hundreds of thousands, treated as
for them the most basic human laws and regulations do not apply.
The money raised from contributors should help us to cover all necessary costs of travel, food, accommodation and equipment during the shooting of the documentary, as well as to allow us to buy copyrights of the video material from the archives we need. According to our estimations, the final
amount needed for successful completion of our project will be around 7.400$. These resources will also be used to hire
professional cameraman and editor, pay unexpected contingencies and, if necessary, to procure the
services of local officials. All payments
will be duly recorded, with tickets, receipts or signed descriptive notes, and
records will be properly kept for auditing.
Our project’s primary value is in giving voice to the
oppressed social groups, denied of democratic representatives, or represented
in such a way which could not possibly protect or advance their basic rights
and interests. We also hope to raise general awareness about criminal
injustice, ongoing segregation, political and police oppression, economic
difficulties and double standards taking place on the part of European soil
itself. According to our sources, media fabricated stories about Kosovo have
been used to cover up a much more important question – relating not just to
Kosovo, but to all countries and provinces forced to meet a similar fate, be
they in Europe, or Africa, or Middle East etc. – and that is what is the real
purpose and tangible achievement of international missions? Are they capable to
protect all ethnic groups from the violent attacks, post-war retaliations and
ethnically motivated executions, and to establish legal and administrative
system free of corruption, as they do not hesitate to guarantee? At the moment,
we cannot deal with this problem in other countries. But, with regard to
Kosovo, our film will break through the facade of media whitewashing and empty
political slang concealing the simple and dreadful facts, investigate how
things are really going on under the bell jar, show the real people’s suffering
and destitution, deliver their own words, thoughts, fears and desires and
spread their yet unheard message to the world.
If you
are not in the position to donate money, please spread the word about this
project and send it to your friends by the Indiegogo share tools.Production team - biographies
(Scriptwriter Vladimir Bogićević and director Milenko Srećković(Milenko Srećković, director)Milenko Srećković is born in 1982 in Veliko Krčmare near Kragujevac. He finished elementary school in Rača
and technical high school in Kragujevac. He graduated at the Department for
General Literature and Theory of Literature of the Belgrade Faculty of
Philology. He is the columnist of
daily newspaper “Politika” since November 2013. He is a founder of the Freedom
Fight Movement (Pokret za slobodu), and as the Secretary of the Coordination
Committee of Workers Protests he organized many protests against privatization
theft. He was editor of the Serbian
edition of “Z magazine” (2007-2009) and of internet magazine in English, “Freedom Fight Info”. He also edited books in Serbian “Deindustrialization and Workers
Resistance” (2011), “Land and Freedom” (2011), “Struggle for the Future” (2013)
and “Landgrabbing – Resistance and Alternatives” (2014). In April 2015 he
published the book “Svako zaslužuje spas” (Everybody deserves to be saved),
compilation of publicist works from 2013 to 2015 (available in Serbian here). And in December 2015 he published the book “Corporate Imperialism: The Zones of Exploitation in Serbia” (available in English here and in Serbian here).In July 2016 he made a documentary film ''Just a Witness'' that deals with ethnic cleansing commited after the arrival of NATO troops in Kosovo. The trailer for the movie you can see here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vc_a-YvwLXc, or read an interview about it here: http://www.politika.rs/sr/clanak/358450/Americki-pesnik-kao-ocevidac-progona(Vladimir Bogićević, scriptwriter)Vladimir Bogićević is born in 1980 in Belgrade. He
finished elementary school and high school in Petrovac, and graduated at the
Department for General Literature and Theory of Literature of the Belgrade
Faculty of Philology. He works as a teaching associate and prepares his
doctoral thesis at the same Faculty today.He wrote two books of short stories and poetry – “Druga strana Mebijusove
trake” (The Other Side of The Moebius Strip) in 1998 and “Deklinacije”
(Declinations) in 2006 – and a number of essays and scientific papers in the
field of philology (“Two Revitalizing Counter-Cultures” in 2016, “In Search of
Unpresentable: ‘Detectives of Sublime’ in (Post)Modern American Novel” in 2015,
“The Worlds of Master and Margarita” in 2014, “Language and Subjectivity in
‘Hamlet’” in 2005, etc.). He has freelanced as a translator, proofreader and
reviewer of various cultural, political and literary papers, for various
employers (Faculty of Philosophy in Kosovska Mitrovica, Anti-Corruption Council
in Belgrade, etc.).
Since 2007, he is a member of Freedom Fight Movement (Pokret za slobodu), for which he performed
miscellaneous tasks – wrote, translated and edited numerous articles,
bulletins, conference reports, web pages, etc. He participated to the
publication of Serbian edition of “Z magazine” (2007-2009) and internet
magazine “Freedom Fight Info” and took part in editing most of the books
published by Freedom Fight Movement since 2011.*If you
are not in the position to donate money, please spread the word about this
project and send it to your friends by the Indiegogo share tools.

story:
The Motive

Leading experts in health and fitness, exercise enthusiasts or those just starting their healthy lifestyle journeys have one thing in common…they’re HUMAN. Yes, yes, I hear you, “no s**t Sherlock!” But wait for it I’ve got another obvious one for you, “people like people.”

Profound conclusions these may not be, but personal experiences shared personally speak volumes. And in my view it’s far more powerful and far more effective in communicating and motivating us. 

fizzYcaL’s mission is “documenting fitness and celebrating everyday fitness heroes.” Behind those few words is one of my favourite tenets – “each one teach one.” 


The Idea

A regular fizzYcaL documentary web series on YouTube and Facebook that captures interesting and captivating individuals on different paths of their health and fitness journeys. 

For example, stories that fizzYcaL has been responsible for capturing range from the capoeirista from Rio who has pioneered a way to teach young kids, to young swimmers and Olympic hopefuls from Mozambique, to the American fitness celebrity visiting London for the first time and to the Londoner and former fat man who for the good of his family turned to a healthy lifestyle.


The Challenge

As an almost one man band juggling filming content for fizzYcaL, with managing its social media, blog and clothing line has been a challenge. 

I’m not yet ready to hang up my video camera entirely but I do strongly feel that you as fizzYcaL’s audience would love to see, hear and experience regularly delivered high quality documentaries from health and fitness experts from all over the world.


The Funds

£10,000 may seem like a lot of money to raise in one month but it will be used to commission filmmakers both in the UK and abroad.

If the full funds are met the aim is to upload a fizzYcaL documentary every two – three weeks starting from March 2016.

And the costs for 3-5 minute short documentaries vary from £300-£600 to film, edit and obtain royalty free music.

Also around 5% of whatever is raised will go to indiegogo.

Any remainder will go towards satisfying the demand for expanding fizzYcaL's clothing range. And if the target's well and truly smashed expect fizzYcaL bikinis and trunks on sale this summer! :-)


The Perks

The core perks for the campaign are:

- A town crier style burpee push-up challenge performed and filmed at Trafalgar Square. For every pledge made above £7 and within the target amount I will shout out your name and perform one burpee push-up.

- Early online access to the documentaries before they are publicly available.

- Producer credits at the end of one of the documentaries (the brand's current social media reach is about 26k and the video will be promoted on all of fizzYcaL's platforms) for the £100 and £150 perks. 

- Limited edition fizzYcaL clothing and the one-time return of some classics only available to indiegogo backers.

- 50% off fizzYcaL wear for a whole year.

- Food and drinks sponsors can have their logos appear for up to 5 seconds before the start of each video with the words, "this episode was brought to you by." Due to YouTube's current product placement policy this will be for Facebook video only (current reach on all Facebook's pages/profiles is 14k). And your ingredients must be largely natural and vegetarian.


The Hope

In the next few years I hope to look upon my pledge video without the cringey stomach churning feeling that I have at the time of writing this (I lost count how many takes I did). I also look forward to building working relationships with the filmmakers that you help to commission and to see how the brand develops over another 8 years.

If you're unable to pledge please share on your social media using the #DocumentingFitness and if you know of any filmmakers that would be interested in working with fizzYcaL please contact me via this page with an example of their work. 

Thanks for taking the time out to watch and read this!

Wishing you wellness!

story:
Greetings Indiegogo community! We are well underway with our SAG-AFTRA New Media Web Series entitled "Memoirs of a Godfather". Please watch the video to learn more about the project and also to catch some sneak peeks from our episode one. Memoirs of a Godfather is a dark comedy which starts off during 1932 (The Great depression era). The story is an all original,  registered and copyrighted film project. It centers around a Godfather and his small time gang of organized crime and the antics and comical interactions between the town folk and the local criminal element. The story is not fashioned after the typical Chicago or big city crime boss style, rather when I (Stephen Dean-Producer/Director/Writer) created this story the Godfather's "operations" ideally take place in a much smaller town in the more rural areas of the southeast outside of Atlanta. Instead of fixating on the stereotypically violent aspects of organized crime, this series is focused more upon the inadequacies of the Godfather and his henchmen. The series contains varying levels of comedy such as slap stick, farcical/screwball, sophomoric, and situational humor. It is light hearted fun and entertainment with limited violence or gore but an unlimited amount of silly, goofy.... fun! 

My production outfit (Dean Film Works) is based out of northeast Georgia. Our film project is based out of Flowery Branch and Winder, Georgia (approximately 30 minutes northeast of Atlanta) and we film at multiple location outside of the city.

We could really use your help to keep the production running in not only a functional, but also enjoyably smooth manner! We just completed production for episode one on December 27th, 2015. We are approximately 85% through post production (film/video editing, etc.) for episode one now. We will be beginning production on episode two as soon as we receive funding. Episode one was sadly an unfunded project through kickstarter and only $7 from Indiegogo so with that said the production company (me) personally financed all related production cost which was relatively lofty. Our food bill alone for cast and crew for day one (snacks and food) was approximately $400. With so many people being involved with this project and more actors being introduced as the series progresses, your support and contributions are more important than ever. These contributions are needed for the most basic things such as food, MUAH (makeup and hair supplies/cost), props, wardrobe, travel stipends for actors traveling from afar. We truly appreciate your time and your consideration to support our project. We are all team players and we would love to have you be a part of our team. Please consider joining us by making a donation to this fun, exciting, and unique film project!

Thanks again and PLEASE DONATE!

Stephen Dean

Producer/Director/Writer

Memoirs of a Godfather - A SAG-AFTRA New Media Web Series

story:
A little bit of context

Four years ago, Twitter was missing something. You had people, and you had companies, and you had D-list celebrities trying to adjust their fifteen minutes of fame for Daylight Savings. But what you didn't really have was a sense of community. Enter @WeAreAustralia. Since then, the account has become one of the forefathers of the Rotation Curation movement, and has developed a commitment to showcasing the Australia that doesn't usually get shown. It's extremely rewarding.

But there's a problem

Four years of finding a wide variety of curators, acting as a consultant for others starting their own Rotation Curation accounts, keeping track of what happens on the account, dealing with questions, and trying to stay ahead of social change takes a lot of time and energy for one person. And while the account will always be against corporate influence, it's not as feasible as it used to be. Frankly, we can't continue to be a world leader without assistance. That's where you, lovely citizens of the interwebz, come in. (Please never let the "word" "interwebz" be used ever again.)

Here's what's going on

With the power to devote more time to running @WeAreAustralia, the account can only keep getting bigger and better as we enter our fifth (!) year. It's already pretty great. But it's not flawless. What are we looking at? More variety. More transparency. More fun. Frankly, more professionalism.

This account has already helped changed the world - while the world plays catch-up, it has been a strong advocate of equality in all its forms: from indigenous rights, to transgender awareness before Caitlyn Jenner introduced herself to the world, to destigmatising mental wellbeing issues, to supporting sex workers and refugees and female gamers, to simple things like gender equality between curators. It needs to continue. It's too important to stop.

You can help!

Your donation will help improve @WeAreAustralia enormously. With enough funding, we can afford to actively search for great curators rather than the mixed results we sometimes get with people who actively seek out the chance to volunteer. We can make the account a safer and less confronting space for our curators. We can make the experience more rewarding, both for you and the curators. Every dollar counts - even with just $5 from each of @WeAreAustralia's followers, that's more than $40,000. It's small potatoes in the world of technology, but from an account that's been run basically for free for four years, that's enormous. It's, well, freedom, in more ways than I can possibly explain.

Impact levels are currently set at the following:

$1000: An updated, more transparent code of conduct for curators and followers.

$2000: A list of all past curators will be made publicly available.

$3000: The archive of all past tweets will be made publicly available.

$4000: A separate admin Twitter account will be created to handle volunteers and comments about the account's handling.

$6,000: Storifys will be created for each new curator's week.

$8,000: @WeAreAustralia will hold another "Best of" month, and followers will be able to nominate their favourite past curators.

$10,000: Three additional theme months throughout 2016, with the themes to be announced at a later date.

$12,000: Storifys will be created for past curators. (Obviously this will take significantly more time than for current curators; apologies in advance.)

$15,000: A sister account will be set up on Instagram.

story:
One Square Inch of Silence

Who's on the Team?

My name is Matt Mikkelsen and I'm a nature sound recordist. For the past 3 years I've spent hours listening to and recording natural sounds like birds, waterfalls, and oceans.  I've worked as an audio engineer on research projects, documentaries and TV shows, but nothing is as special to me as recording nature sounds. The problem with recording good natural sound is that noise pollution is more prevalent than ever before, so finding truly "quiet" areas is nearly impossible.

My name is Palmer Morse; I'm a documentary filmmaker from Ithaca, New York. For years I've been interested in filming life as we know it including topics ranging from social injustice to preservation of culture. I've worked on documentary films ranging from an Al Jazeera English series, several award-winning feature documentaries, and films of my own creation. In my travels and experiences I've discovered a different kind of sound in each setting, yet a consistent interference of noise created by humans that seems to be inescapable as well. As media-creators, this is an issue that both Matt and I have discussed at length in recent years as creators of media. We hope that this film will serve a greater purpose by addressing the lack of and need for natural silence in our daily lives.

Why are we Raising Money?

We are raising money to fund production of a unique documentary about an Emmy award winning sound recordist by the name of Gordon Hempton. Gordon has been a sound recordist for many years, but he also runs a non-profit organization called One Square Inch of Silence, This organization aims to protect one square inch of land in Olympic National Park from noise pollution, and to raise awareness about how noise impacts our physical and mental well being.  

How will the Money be Used?

If we meet our fundraising goal, we will be able to fly to Olympic National Park to interview Gordon and visit One Square Inch, which is arguably the only place in mainland America where noise pollution is largely absent. We will then fly with Gordon to Haleakalā National Park in Hawaii, and capture him recording in the quietest natural place on earth. This film will be about Gordon, and his quest for silence.

We are trying to raise 6,000 dollars to help with airfare, production equipment rentals, permits and travel costs for the trip. The money will not be used to pay anyone, it will be used exclusively for the costs incurred on our trip. If our goal is exceeded, we will use the money to cover post production costs such as audio mastering, film color correcting, and film festival submission fees. By donating, you are eligible for all kinds of special perks, including access to a copy of the film, so check out our contribution levels!

What is the Impact of this Film?

The impact of this film is far reaching and includes sharing Gordon's incredible story, bringing our viewers to some of the quietest  and most remote places in the world, and showing our audience the importance of natural silence. If you donate to this film, you are contributing to an extremely unique and important cause.

What are the Risks and Challenges?

Our challenges are mostly funding related, however weeks of planning will be necessary to complete a successful trip of this nature. The biggest risk we face which would hinder the project is the possibility of getting altitude sickness upon our arrival to the Haleakalā crater, which lies between 6,500-10,000 feet above sea level. The risk of this happening is low, however it is a possibility. We are going to do everything in our power to mitigate this risk by training for the altitude.

If you can contribute financially, great! If not please share our page to people you know who may be inclined to donate. Every dollar counts!

For years I've been interested in filming life as we know it including topics ranging from social injustice to preservation of culture. I've worked on documentary films ranging from an Al Jazeera English series, several award-winning feature documentaries, and films of my own creation. In my travels and experiences I've discovered a different kind of sound in each setting, yet a consistent interference of noise created by humans that seems to be inescapable as well. As media-creators, this is an issue that both Matt and I have discussed at length in recent years as creators of media. We hope that this film will serve a greater purpose by addressing the lack of and need for natural silence in our daily lives.Why are we Raising Money?We are raising money to fund production of a unique documentary about an Emmy award winning sound recordist by the name of Gordon Hempton. Gordon has been a sound recordist for many years, but he also runs a non-profit organization called One Square Inch of Silence, This organization aims to protect one square inch of land in Olympic National Park from noise pollution, and to raise awareness about how noise impacts our physical and mental well being.  How will the Money be Used?If we meet our fundraising goal, we will be able to fly to Olympic National Park to interview Gordon and visit One Square Inch, which is arguably the only place in mainland America where noise pollution is largely absent. We will then fly with Gordon to Haleakalā National Park in Hawaii, and capture him recording in the quietest natural place on earth. This film will be about Gordon, and his quest for silence. We are trying to raise 6,000 dollars to help with airfare, production equipment rentals, permits and travel costs for the trip. The money will not be used to pay anyone, it will be used exclusively for the costs incurred on our trip. If our goal is exceeded, we will use the money to cover post production costs such as audio mastering, film color correcting, and film festival submission fees. By donating, you are eligible for all kinds of special perks, including access to a copy of the film, so check out our contribution levels! What is the Impact of this Film?The impact of this film is far reaching and includes sharing Gordon's incredible story, bringing our viewers to some of the quietest  and most remote places in the world, and showing our audience the importance of natural silence. If you donate to this film, you are contributing to an extremely unique and important cause.What are the Risks and Challenges?Our challenges are mostly funding related, however weeks of planning will be necessary to complete a successful trip of this nature. The biggest risk we face which would hinder the project is the possibility of getting altitude sickness upon our arrival to the Haleakalā crater, which lies between 6,500-10,000 feet above sea level. The risk of this happening is low, however it is a possibility. We are going to do everything in our power to mitigate this risk by training for the altitude.If you can contribute financially, great! If not please share our page to people you know who may be inclined to donate. Every dollar counts!

story:
extinction

An Infinite Earths Film Production

The story of two sisters doing whatever it takes to survive in post-apocalyptic Ireland.

This independent film will be Infinite Earth's debut feature length production. We plan on bringing our years of professional experience in both music and commercial video and photography to fruition with a fantastic, believable, film-able, story.

 Months of preparation has included:

  • a full finished screenplay
  • extensive storyboarding for every scene
  • an exhaustive budget for every expense we expect to encounter during the production
  • the assembly of an unbelievably talented cast

We have trimmed all of the trimmable expenses down to a point where we can ALMOST film this to the highest possible quality already. That's where you come in...

We have the cameras. We have the lighting. We have the sound equipment. We have the actors, and we have the story. What we need are:

  • Amazing props
  • VFX in post. 

We are so close to making this film a reality and we couldn't be more excited. We will be eternally grateful to anyone who can contribute anything towards making this film a reality, no matter how small, and we hope our wonderful perks illustrate just how important you and your contributions are to us.

Many Thanks,

 Evan Heneghan

INFINITE EARTHS FILM PRODUCTION

Instagram - Facebook - Website


Film Synopsis


It starts with an extensively drug resistant strain of TB in Western Australia, and total extinction of all human, animal, plant, and bacterial life on the planet. Only the birds remain. The birds, and a few bedraggled and starving survivors. Some are the lucky ones who survived their infection. Others are the resourceful ones who managed to avoid the airborne Red11 infection altogether.

Aoife and Niamh are two of the latter, sisters who live on in post-apocalyptic Ireland, having avoided the disease altogether through reclusiveness, caution, and luck. They spend their days trawling the Irish countryside for anything that will help keep them alive, staying one foot ahead of starvation and infection, not daring to approach the lawless anarchy of the big towns and cities that are left. At night they retreat to their base, a small house deep in the wilderness, where they read, play board games, and remember the past.

Their routine is turned upside down when they encounter an intruder, a desperate loner trying to outrun a group he calls ‘The Lost Boys’. Knowing the danger he poses them as the only other person who knows the location of their house, the girls cannot let him go. They consider what they should do with him in grim conversation, and end up holding him as a prisoner.  He speaks of a rumored town out west near Galway, the town of New Hope, where people have come together and civilisation has started again. When The Lost Boys catch up with them the girls are forced to flee their last refuge and take off on a desperate and deadly journey across the barren country in the pursuit of New Hope...

 

Our Team


EVAN HENEGHAN  - Director, Screenwriter, Producer


Evan is a graduate of Media Studies and English in Maynooth University  with a Masters in Screenwriting from IADT. He has years of professional experience in commercial video and sound, working with clients such as Alison Canavan, Homebase, and The Clarion Hotel Group, along with Irish musical talent including The Manhattan Syndrome. Creatively, he is a massive fan of the works of Alfonso Cuarón,  Alejandro González Iñárritu, and Charlie Kaufman.
​
As a creative writer and director Evan is interested in exploring themes of loneliness, disenfranchisement, and hope. He likes to film in a naturalistic and collaborative style. 

  

 PEARSE HEALY - Cinematographer, Photographer


A professional Photographer and Cinematographer with Brownbrogue Ltd. and Infinite Earths, Pearse's love of clean lines and colour dictate the style and tone of his work.  He loves to watch movies by Stanley Kubrick, Lance Acord, and Guillermo Del Toro.

A strong visual code of minimalism, symmetry, and the ambition to create something special drive Pearse as a Cinematographer.


ANNA MURRAY (M.Phil, B.Mus, ARIAM)

Composer, Audio Mixer

Anna is a multimedia composer, musician and writer based in Dublin. She obtained her Bachelor of Music degree from the National University of Ireland Maynooth in 2009, where she specialised in composition for mixed media. In 2011 she was awarded an MPhil degree in Music and Media Technologies from Trinity College Dublin. She is also an Associate of the Royal Irish Academy of Music

As a pianist and composer, Anna has studied with Leonora Carney, Adrian Vernon Fish, Gordon Delap, Donnacha Dennehy and Linda Buckley. She has had works performed by The Crash Ensemble, the Rhombus Ensemble, Philip Lawson, David Adams and the Gap Static Piano Trio and has also had works presented at the Hilltown New Music Festival.
