story:
Not just another vampire story! This story describes the scientific foundation that proves the vampires live among us. This story is true . . .

A thousand years ago when Vikings sailed to the center of the New World.  One of the crew, a pious priest, was changed forever.  Through a transfer of DNA between species, he became a vampire-like transgenic predator.  He preyed upon his own kind; he reproduced; eventually he died.  Ultimately the Vikings buried him in a unique coffin at the bottom of a Canadian lake.

A thousand years later, anthropologist Steven Atticus found the priest, his journal, and learned the truth about human evolution.  Steven Atticus now had proof that transgenic predators live among us as a global sub-subspecies, predators who appear just like us – indistinguishable from humans! Ironically, these predators prey on the very humans from which they evolved.

When Steven learns that one of these predators has drifted into Panama City, Florida, he quickly finds himself a member of a law enforcement/science Task Force.  This predator is the quintessential bad guy.  According to Lt. John Willoughby, Panama City PD, “Harrison Van Gilter exemplifies the most despicable qualities of Ted Bundy, the Boston Strangler, and Jack the Ripper.”

Ascent of Evil reveals the truth about vampires.  On Sanguin Island in Massachusetts, we get a glimpse into the life of these ruthless killers.  In the mansion of Harrison’s brother, Robert, we view the use of pawns:  humans stripped of their identity and exploited to sustain the lives of vicious predators.

Now the coastal community of Panama City is threatened by a unique killer.  Harrison Van Gilter is a charming and intelligent psychopathic predator.  Lt. John Willoughby, FBI special agent Mark Pierce, and other members of the Task Force must confront a serial killer like none other!  Spring Break is coming and Harrison Van Gilter is anticipating the harvest!




Short Summary

Michael Brim, the author of the ASCENT OF EVIL screenplay derived from his THE DARK LYFE TRILOGY of books, is now Michael Brim the executive producer of Ascent of Evil the movie. Michael has surrounded himself with key players from the film industry who have decades of accumulated experience; experience that is critical for the successful production of a blockbuster film.


Writing was always an essetial component of Michael's career. As a professional biologist he authored dozens of scientific papers for the federal government. In his retirement he has become passionate about using science to provoke his readers to accept unanticipated realities. His goal was to create biologically credible vampires: An authentic subspecies living among us. His readers agree he succeeded.

Michael has chosen Keith Payson to co-produce and line-produce his project. Keith has over twenty-five years of experience producing TV commercials, episodics and feature films. As our budget specialist, Keith is the focal point of this indiegogo campaign. It is critical the first dollars spent from whatever we receive be dedicated to:

  • Development of a detailed budget based on the script.
  • The creation of a complete shooting schedule.
  • A detailed description of how we will utilize production funds of $25 million dollars to produce a film that represents a successful business venture including production and distribution strategies, and potential return for our investors.

Our Creative team

In addition to Micheal and Keith, other members of our creative team include:

  • Miles Anthony, a talent agent at Marlowes in London. Mr. Anthony has experience in talent negotiations, casting and film production.
  • Phil Martin is a talent agent at PMW with offices in the UK and US. He has extensive experience in talent negotiations.
  • Juliana R. Payson is a medical artist and consultant on the anthropological aspect of production design and is our storyboard illustrator.
  • Mark Brim is an executive with Brothersons Press and Brim Business Inc. Mark has extensive experience as a government emergency-response photographer, portrait photographer, and graphic design specialist.
  • John Cork is a documentary film maker with extensive experience related to the production of Special Features components of contemporary filmmaking.
  • Julie Gordon is a Florida Film Commissioner who helped host the first script read at Gulf Coast State College, Panama City, Florida. Julie has been a supportive partner from the very beginning of our project.


What We Need & What You Get

All of the members of our creative team have put a lot of sweat equity into the project. (i.e., Lots of work; No pay).  We have come as far as we can without some modest funding. Reasonable compensation is required for the tools described above, primarily budgets, schedule, business plan and a retainer for a quality entertainment attorney. In addition, if procedes allow we will develop a more complete set of storyboards and include them in the business plan. And we may also include photographs with a variety of filming locations.

The budget for the Ascent of Evil film project is $25 million. The funds needed to meet development costs, by comparison, are minimal: $25,000. 

These funds will allow us to put forward a professional business plan which is guaranteed to draw the necessary interest and respect from potential investors required to achieve a fully funded status. 

Very Unusual and Fun Perks!

  • We have some unique perks for you, which include; Prints of our original storyboard artwork, a limited number of autographed copies of the first edition award winning trade paperback, autographed copies of the script, ebook copies of the trilogy novels,  signed museum quality prints of the movie poster.
  • You won't go away empty handed, regardless of your donation, you will have something in hand that we believe you'll value as a project supporter. Even if we don't reach our goal, any funds obtained will get us closer toward the presentation of our business plan to prospective investors.
  • As special bonus perks we have nicely bound scripts, and for those who are interested and able a private consultation regarding your script with either Michael or Keith, which will include the creation of a budget and a schedule for your movie. We also have unusual but very fun donation level perk that will appeal to your deepest part of your movie fan personality. We will include your likeness in a storyboard. You will be cast as one of the characters in Ascent of Evil. Juliana our Medical illustrator will create original artwork worthy of framing as a panel of storyboards depicting a scene from Ascent of Evil with one of the characters in your likeness. If you want us to, we will even depict your wife and kids!

The Impact

Horror and sci-fi movies have a special place in the history of American cinema. They each play a substantial and therapeutic role in the collective expression of the  American psyche. Ever since the Cold War of the 1950’s the sci-fi and horror genres in film have expressed the bucolic American social landscape pitted against our deepest and darkest existential fears by questioning the viability of American society and what it means to accept the anesthetizing effect of the American Dream as the best possible outcome for our lives.

Living life in a relatively safe society but knowing that at any time one of many dangers might threaten our well being may leave us feeling we have no control in protecting ourselves against potential threats: hunger, sickness, war, political catastrophe, poverty, epidemics, crime, alien invasion, serial killers or the upheaval of natural disasters.  This psychologically stressful mental state requires an occasional release preferably a method that can be implemented in a safe and controlled environment: in a movie theater of one’s living room.

The juxtaposition of a horror film when viewed in comparison to our own real life drama provides us with an experience that is deeply impactful. Through the horror film experience we clarify our many fears in a rational manner. Some psychological and emotional solutions are best left to cinematic fantasy. The result is something directly parallel to a resurgence of hope!  The cinematic experience provides a temporary ability to move forward in our routine lives regardless of the frightful magnitude of our imagined or possibly real fears.

The horror of vampires living as a subspecies among us, although fantastical by today's modern understanding of our existence, is not as far-fetched and out of the realm of possibility as you might think. It is quite easy to sense some truth to the possibility of their existence. Much anecdotal evidence exists to indicate parallel yet divergent evolutionary development. 


  • There is an undercurrent of discontent among the majority of society who feel that the elite of our population are only in it for themselves, democratically out of control. Our film resonates with this current mood of societal oppression. Characters in our film provide a metaphor for those groups in our society that are overlooked and disenfranchised. 
  • Keith Payson has produced 12 feature films and negotiated multi-film contracts for independent film producers, we want this to happen for Ascent of Evil. For this project to be a success we need your help, we need the strength of a fan base, those who appreciate horror film and want to see the genre progress.
  • We currently have letters of intent from investors committed to providing 50% of the film production funds required (12.5 million dollars).  Our total film production budget for the filming of Ascent of Evil is $25 million dollars. A condition to receiving the 12.5 million already committed is that we find additional investors to put in the first of the production funds already required. With your support and donations we will create a polished business plan, which is the proper and professional way to make a presentation to potential investors. And with your support we are all but guaranteed to lift ourselves to the next phase of operation. The amount we have requested will provide the tools required to approach major studios, directors, bankers, venture capitalists, and of course major star-talent!

Risks & Challenges

The risks and challenges are minor at this stage, other than our time and your donations.  Keith has produced numerous films in his career and has stellar reputation for being able to manage the fiscal integrity of our film project. He, and our other team members can clearly and succinctly communicate our vision to anyone who is a lover of science fiction and horror. And now we introduce a brand new paradigm to the vampire film genre. We reveal a thrilling new biological reality of these once - mythical predators! 


The challenge we have accepted is the telling of an iconic and fascinating story but in a brand new and mesmerising way.

Clearly there are risks in any investment, but we have carefully evaluated a multitude of financial factors related to this project's return on investment. We have chosen to move forward slowly, carefully, and prudently to arrive at reasonable and rational investment strategies. The challenge of our next phase of production is to use the tools that your donations are providing us to present the viability of this business venture and this collective artistic expression as one that investors will prosper from. In order to do that we must gain the confidence of our investors by convincing them that we will complete the project on or under budget and within the scheduled timeframe, in other words we must convince you that this creative team has the ability to meet and possibly even exceed these responsibilities.

Other Ways You Can Help

We realise some individuals simply can't contribute money, but that doesn't mean you can't help. You can help immensely if you join our team by focusing on the following.

  • Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. This is a multigenre film that will satisfy horror, scifi, and crime-thriller fans. Tell your family, tell your friends. - Consider arranging a group donation if possible - 
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools! - Use the social media hashtag #AscentofEvil - and one of our Vampires will track you down.
story_txt:
Not just another vampire story! This story describes the scientific foundation that proves the vampires live among us. This story is true . . .A thousand years ago when Vikings sailed to the center of the New World.  One of the crew, a pious priest, was changed forever.  Through a transfer of DNA between species, he became a vampire-like transgenic predator.  He preyed upon his own kind; he reproduced; eventually he died.  Ultimately the Vikings buried him in a unique coffin at the bottom of a Canadian lake.A thousand years later, anthropologist Steven Atticus found the priest, his journal, and learned the truth about human evolution.  Steven Atticus now had proof that transgenic predators live among us as a global sub-subspecies, predators who appear just like us – indistinguishable from humans! Ironically, these predators prey on the very humans from which they evolved.When Steven learns that one of these predators has drifted into Panama City, Florida, he quickly finds himself a member of a law enforcement/science Task Force.  This predator is the quintessential bad guy.  According to Lt. John Willoughby, Panama City PD, “Harrison Van Gilter exemplifies the most despicable qualities of Ted Bundy, the Boston Strangler, and Jack the Ripper.”
Ascent of Evil reveals the truth about vampires.  On Sanguin Island in Massachusetts, we get a glimpse into the life of these ruthless killers.  In the mansion of Harrison’s brother, Robert, we view the use of pawns:  humans stripped of their identity and exploited to sustain the lives of vicious predators.Now the coastal community of Panama City is threatened by a unique killer.  Harrison Van Gilter is a charming and intelligent psychopathic predator.  Lt. John Willoughby, FBI special agent Mark Pierce, and other members of the Task Force must confront a serial killer like none other!  Spring Break is coming and Harrison Van Gilter is anticipating the harvest!


Short Summary Michael Brim, the author of the ASCENT OF EVIL screenplay derived from his THE DARK LYFE TRILOGY of books, is now Michael Brim the executive producer of Ascent of Evil the movie. Michael has surrounded himself with key players from the film industry who have decades of accumulated experience; experience that is critical for the successful production of a blockbuster film.

Writing was always an essetial component of Michael's career. As a professional biologist he authored dozens of scientific papers for the federal government. In his retirement he has become passionate about using science to provoke his readers to accept unanticipated realities. His goal was to create biologically credible vampires: An authentic subspecies living among us. His readers agree he succeeded.
Michael has chosen Keith Payson to co-produce and line-produce his project. Keith has over twenty-five years of experience producing TV commercials, episodics and feature films. As our budget specialist, Keith is the focal point of this indiegogo campaign. It is critical the first dollars spent from whatever we receive be dedicated to:



Development of a detailed budget based on the script.

The creation of a complete shooting schedule.

A detailed description of how we will utilize production funds of $25 million dollars to produce a film that represents a successful business venture including production and distribution strategies, and potential return for our investors.

story:
Hello humans!

This is the Pidgeon for the Pidgeon Drummer project. If you're still confused about the whole thing, here is a few things you should know about my channel:

  • I'm releasing weekly drum covers every tuesday and tips and tricks the day after;
  • I don't monetize my videos, so my content can be available for FREE, no adds;
  • After receiving my diagnose while I was on treatment for depression, social anxiety and all their friends, I realized I had no idea of what "borderline" means and that's one of my main boosters to keep this project going: we need information. Real information about our daily real life struggles that somehow, no one seems to notice. And guess what? If you have access to information, it actually gets better. Better than you ever imagined. Cool, right? Help me spread the good news!

The Pidgeon managed to transform its issues, doubts and struggles on the Promos you can already access on my channel. Take a minute or two to watch them! If you still believes this cuckoo bird, maybe you can lend a hand!

Help Pidgs ;)

Here is what the Pidgeon could achieve with this first money injection:

  • Improve the audio quality by getting my first own drum kit (that's right, Pidgs has been playing the drums for 12 years now and do not own a kit) AND a proper editing software (for both audio and video);
  • Improve the production value even more by getting a semi-pro camera;
  • Shoot outside. That's right! with a few short travels, we could get some awesome shots on natural mind blowing places! Help with the gas money ;)
  • Pay part of the Pidgeon student loan. Ok, I know this sounds extremely "meh", but the Pidgeons treatment ate all its money like a berserker cookie-monster and part of this help would actually help this craycray bird!

Why?

Have you ever feel like trying the drums but something silly held you back? Are you a nerdfighter? A whovian? Dig games? Indie games? Tabletop? Do you feel kinda alone in the world sometimes? If you at least took a second to think about a yes for any of those, I may be able to help you =) how?

  • I am shooting the drum covers with the best learning angles so you get a clear view and know when I'm hitting what,
  • Every wednesday, I'll release an Instruction Day video, where we chat, talk tips and tricks and discuss anything you feel like saying. I'm here for you!
  • The Pidgeon developed the channel on a achievement-based game format, so you should get ready for unexpected extra content on saturdays ;) this includes viewers collaborations (send me your art!), interviews, next cover poll and anything this noisy bird thinks of - muahahaha!

Challenges

Since my channel is only starting, I already have an awesome birdbase going on on my social media channels. This is awesome and unexpected enough, at least so soon! At the same time, Pidgs don't have a large traffic on its Patreon page, because I'm only starting to post my content. Having that in mind, I'm fully aware that my goal may not be achieved. In this case my priority will be buying an acoustic drum kit and paying bills. Your rewards will be delivered regardless! And the channel will go on, obviously ;)

Thanks but no thanks

If you are as broke as me, you can still contribute in many other ways:

  • Share this campaign with people who may dig my channel! You can use indiegogo's sharing tools, only one-click away from sharing the love!
  • If you work for some company who may have one of the materials I need to improve the quality of my videos or have this old camera laying around, feeling all alone, maybe I could use it =] any kind of help is more than welcome!
  • WUUUUT, you are an artist too? Send me your material so I can put it up as part of my videos! If you sing, play, draw, paint, dance, do a wonderful impression of that walking worm or is just bored, chirp me at chirp@thepidgeondrummer.com and let's create something awesome!
  • Follow and share my Patreon page and become friends with the bird on twitter and instagram for the latest news, achievement easter eggs and dinosaur gifs.

If you're still not quite sure about it: THANK YOU for taking the time to read all this, you are awesome and I hope you have a kick*ss week ^ ^

story:
Die Geschichte

(if you not from Germany check the english version from Veritas on our website and contact us! :) )

Der Film VERITAS erzählt die Geschichte von Emma Fleming. Eine ehemalige Polizistin erster Klasse, welche nach einem tragischen Unfall ihren Dienst bei der Mordkommission quittiert. 

 Drei Jahre nach diesem tragischen Unfall scheinen sich die Morde aus Emma´s Vergangenheit zu wiederholen und ihr ehemaliger Partner Christopher Cimon erscheint eines Tages vor ihrer Tür, um sie ein letztes mal um Hilfe zu bitten.



In der Hoffnung ihrem Trauma so ein Ende zu setzen, willigt Emma ein der Polizei in diesem Fall als Beraterin zu helfen. Gemeinsam mit Christopher und seinem neu frisch ausgebildeten Partner Patrick Jansen macht sich Emma auf die Suche nach dem wahren Palstek - Mörder und wird dabei immer mehr von den Ereignissen ihrer Vergangenheit eingeholt. 
Ein Wettlauf gegen die Zeit beginnt, als Emma merkt dass es sich um einen weit größeren Plan handelt, als jeder es vermuten mag. Der Plan zu einem perfektem Verbrechen.


( Es handelt sich NICHT um einen Animationsfilm, sondern um einen Realfilm. Die Bilder sind lediglich Storyboardzeichnungen)

Emma stellt nur einen Menschen von vielen da, die tagtäglich mit ihren tiefsten Ängsten zu kämpfen haben. Menschen die uns stark und selbstbewusst erscheinen, doch innerlich ein Wrack sind.  Es geht darum die Kraft und den Mut zu besitzen über seinen eigenen Schatten zu springen. Seine Ängste zu bekämpfen und sich ihnen zu stellen. Denn der einzige Mensch, der uns im Weg zu unserem Glück steht sind meistens wir selbst. 

Das als Kurzfilm entworfene Kriminaldrama begleitet nicht nur unsere Drei Kommissare bei den Ermittlungen und der Jagd auf den Palstek-Mörder, sondern setzt sich ebenfalls mit Emma und ihrem Trauma auseinander, welches mehr als hilfreich bei der Lösung des Verbrechens ist. So fern sich Emma darauf einlässt.


CREW 


CAST

Das Casting für ist im Gange. Ihr seid Schauspieler und interessiert euch für den Film? Dann schreibt uns an und ihr bekommt einen Auszug, welche Rollen uns noch fehlen. Mail an: veritasfilmofficial@gmail.com


Kosten

Die Kosten der Produktion entstehen durch:

- Kamera und Licht Equipment
- Versicherung
- Fahrkosten
- Speisen und Getränke für Cast/Crew für 10 Tage

Wir das Spendenziel erreicht läuft die Kampagne natürlich weiter. So können wir einiges mehr in Sachen Kamera und Licht Equipment auffahren. Dazu können Festivalkosten bezahlt werden, Effekte, Kostüme etc. Aber lernen wir erst einmal das Gehen, bevor wir das Laufen lernen. Lasst uns diese Kampagne gemeinsam zum Erfolg führen!

Sollten wir mehr als den Zielbetrag von 5000 €  einnehmen, können wir das Projekt noch besser machen:

- Umfangreicheres Kamerarquipment:
- Dolly
- Slider
- Umfangreicheres Licht Equipment
- Zusätzliche Effekte
- Aufrüstung in der Ausstattung und Kostüme
- unvorhergesehene Zusatzkosten, die bei der Produktion entstehen abdecken


Zahlung via Überweisung

Die Überweisung funktioniert nur mit PayPal.

Solltet ihr kein PayPal- Konto haben, so könnt ihr den Betrag auch auf das folgende Konto überweisen. 

Kontodaten:

Stefanie Scholtysek

Sparkasse Iserlohn

BIC: WELADED1ISL

IBAN: DE98 4455 0045 0018 6773 10

Verwendungszweck: Veritas -  <eure e-mailadresse>


Auf der rechten Seite könnt ihr eure Spende direkt via Indigogo online abschließen. Außerdem findet ihr dort eine Liste unserer Perks. Denn wir wollen das Projekt auch für euch interessant gestalten und euch nicht leer ausgehen lassen.

Zu unseren Unterstützungsgeschenken gehört unter anderem: Eine digitale VERITAS - Postkarte, ein Fotobuch mit Infos zu der Produktion, Cast und Crew und viele Hintergrundinformationen. Den Film als Download oder sogar als DVD Box mit zusätzlichen Extras wie ein Making Of, Outtakes und einer Fotogalerie. Unseren Soundtrack als Download, Poster, Einladung zur Premiere und noch vieles mehr! Schaut doch einfach nochmal auf der rechten Seite nach. Wir sind sicher das für jeden etwas dabei ist!


Jede noch so kleine Spende wird von uns gewürdigt und bringt uns Stück für Stück zu unserem Ziel! Solltet ihr besondere Wünsche haben wie zum Beispiel signierte Perks, sind uns diese sehr willkommen. Spricht uns einfach darauf an!



Und zum Schluss: So kannst du uns noch helfen.
Spread The Word!
Willkommen im 21. Jahrhundert! Teilt den Link der Kampagne mit euren Freunden, Kollegen,  der Familie.  Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr oder Instagram? Vollkommen egal! Erzählt einfach jedem davon und wer einen noch genaueren Blick auf unser Projekt werfen möchte findet hier einen Link zu unserer Facebook-Seite VERITAS oder zu unserer offiziellen Veritas-Website
Wenn ihr selber Filmschaffende seit dann könnt ihr euch ebenfalls gerne bei uns melden. Vielleicht finden wir einen Platz in der Crew oder als Schauspieler für euch. Die Castings für die letzten Rollenbesetzungen laufen! Schickt uns eine Nachricht und euer Showreel (Schauspieler)!
Schreibt uns an: veritasfilmofficial@gmail.com 

Vielen Dank für eure Zeit!
Euer VERITAS-Team
story_txt:
Die Geschichte
(if you not from Germany check the english version from Veritas on our website and contact us! :) ) Der Film VERITAS erzählt die Geschichte von Emma Fleming. Eine ehemalige Polizistin erster Klasse, welche nach einem tragischen Unfall ihren Dienst bei der Mordkommission quittiert. 
 Drei Jahre nach diesem tragischen Unfall scheinen sich die Morde aus Emma´s Vergangenheit zu wiederholen und ihr ehemaliger Partner Christopher Cimon erscheint eines Tages vor ihrer Tür, um sie ein letztes mal um Hilfe zu bitten.





In der Hoffnung ihrem Trauma so ein Ende zu setzen, willigt Emma ein der Polizei in diesem Fall als Beraterin zu helfen. Gemeinsam mit Christopher und seinem neu frisch ausgebildeten Partner Patrick Jansen macht sich Emma auf die Suche nach dem wahren Palstek - Mörder und wird dabei immer mehr von den Ereignissen ihrer Vergangenheit eingeholt. Ein Wettlauf gegen die Zeit beginnt, als Emma merkt dass es sich um einen weit größeren Plan handelt, als jeder es vermuten mag. Der Plan zu einem perfektem Verbrechen.





( Es handelt sich NICHT um einen Animationsfilm, sondern um einen Realfilm. Die Bilder sind lediglich Storyboardzeichnungen)
Emma stellt nur einen Menschen von vielen da, die tagtäglich mit ihren tiefsten Ängsten zu kämpfen haben. Menschen die uns stark und selbstbewusst erscheinen, doch innerlich ein Wrack sind.  Es geht darum die Kraft und den Mut zu besitzen über seinen eigenen Schatten zu springen. Seine Ängste zu bekämpfen und sich ihnen zu stellen. Denn der einzige Mensch, der uns im Weg zu unserem Glück steht sind meistens wir selbst. 
Das als Kurzfilm entworfene Kriminaldrama begleitet nicht nur unsere Drei Kommissare bei den Ermittlungen und der Jagd auf den Palstek-Mörder, sondern setzt sich ebenfalls mit Emma und ihrem Trauma auseinander, welches mehr als hilfreich bei der Lösung des Verbrechens ist. So fern sich Emma darauf einlässt.

CREW 




CAST
Das Casting für ist im Gange. Ihr seid Schauspieler und interessiert euch für den Film? Dann schreibt uns an und ihr bekommt einen Auszug, welche Rollen uns noch fehlen. Mail an: veritasfilmofficial@gmail.com



Kosten
Die Kosten der Produktion entstehen durch:
- Kamera und Licht Equipment- Versicherung- Fahrkosten- Speisen und Getränke für Cast/Crew für 10 Tage
Wir das Spendenziel erreicht läuft die Kampagne natürlich weiter. So können wir einiges mehr in Sachen Kamera und Licht Equipment auffahren. Dazu können Festivalkosten bezahlt werden, Effekte, Kostüme etc. Aber lernen wir erst einmal das Gehen, bevor wir das Laufen lernen. Lasst uns diese Kampagne gemeinsam zum Erfolg führen!
Sollten wir mehr als den Zielbetrag von 5000 €  einnehmen, können wir das Projekt noch besser machen:
- Umfangreicheres Kamerarquipment:- Dolly- Slider- Umfangreicheres Licht Equipment- Zusätzliche Effekte- Aufrüstung in der Ausstattung und Kostüme- unvorhergesehene Zusatzkosten, die bei der Produktion entstehen abdecken

Zahlung via Überweisung
Die Überweisung funktioniert nur mit PayPal.
Solltet ihr kein PayPal- Konto haben, so könnt ihr den Betrag auch auf das folgende Konto überweisen. 
Kontodaten:
Stefanie Scholtysek
Sparkasse Iserlohn
BIC: WELADED1ISL
IBAN: DE98 4455 0045 0018 6773 10
Verwendungszweck: Veritas -  <eure e-mailadresse>

Auf der rechten Seite könnt ihr eure Spende direkt via Indigogo online abschließen. Außerdem findet ihr dort eine Liste unserer Perks. Denn wir wollen das Projekt auch für euch interessant gestalten und euch nicht leer ausgehen lassen.Zu unseren Unterstützungsgeschenken gehört unter anderem: Eine digitale VERITAS - Postkarte, ein Fotobuch mit Infos zu der Produktion, Cast und Crew und viele Hintergrundinformationen. Den Film als Download oder sogar als DVD Box mit zusätzlichen Extras wie ein Making Of, Outtakes und einer Fotogalerie. Unseren Soundtrack als Download, Poster, Einladung zur Premiere und noch vieles mehr! Schaut doch einfach nochmal auf der rechten Seite nach. Wir sind sicher das für jeden etwas dabei ist!

Jede noch so kleine Spende wird von uns gewürdigt und bringt uns Stück für Stück zu unserem Ziel! Solltet ihr besondere Wünsche haben wie zum Beispiel signierte Perks, sind uns diese sehr willkommen. Spricht uns einfach darauf an!



 Und zum Schluss: So kannst du uns noch helfen.Spread The Word!Willkommen im 21. Jahrhundert! Teilt den Link der Kampagne mit euren Freunden, Kollegen,  der Familie.  Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr oder Instagram? Vollkommen egal! Erzählt einfach jedem davon und wer einen noch genaueren Blick auf unser Projekt werfen möchte findet hier einen Link zu unserer Facebook-Seite VERITAS oder zu unserer offiziellen Veritas-Website

Euer VERITAS-Team

story:
Thank you to all our contributors! Our Indiegogo campaign is now closed, but you can visit us on our website for more info: 

ExpectingSunshine.com

And to make a donation: 

Please, click here to contribute to the film.


About the Project:

Expecting Sunshine the Documentary tells the story of writer and artist Alexis Marie Chute, as she sets out to rediscover her identity as a mother - and as a woman - after one of the most primal types of losses; the death of her newborn at birth. The story is framed within the three trimesters of her pregnancy that followed. Through artistic visuals, profound interviews, “luminous prose and with such clear-eyed insight,” Chute reveals the turbulent 40-week experience of having a baby after loss. Poignant, touching, tender and inspiring, Expecting Sunshine “makes death a starting point for the continuation of life.”



Why this Project is Meaningful and Needs your Support:

In 2010, Alexis Marie Chute’s son Zachary died at birth. He had a random genetic condition and a large tumor around his heart. Doctors predicted that Zachary would be stillborn, but he was born alive. He never made a sound or opened his eyes. Alexis Marie and her husband Aaron rocked and sang to Zachary. They only had a moment with their son before he died – and that was the moment that changed their lives forever.



When Alexis Marie got pregnant again with her next child, at first she was thrilled. Soon, though, that excitement turned to worry and a debilitating fear for her next baby's life and safety. Would this child suffer the same fate? 

In the 40 weeks that followed, she realized she needed to address her grief for Zachary, which she had tried to bury, before the birth of the child that followed. That is when Expecting Sunshine the Memoir was born; it became a creative narrative of survival. Expecting Sunshine the Documentary is the visual and literary manifestation of that experience.

The topic of Expecting Sunshine the Documentary is often taboo and uncomfortable for people who have not experienced this type of loss – which is exactly why there is a need for this film. Many do not know what to say or how to empathize with the bereaved parents, despite wishing to help. What this means is that families can feel isolated and suffer in silence, especially when they struggle with subsequent pregnancies.




This film will encourage discussion, community and healing for so many people. It will start a dialogue. It will shed light on a secret pain. It will be an education on healthy (and not-so-healthy) approaches to grief and healing. It will also show how creativity can be a balm to the wounded spirit. In this way, Expecting Sunshine will speak to viewers on many levels.


Pregnancy After Loss:

What many do not realize is that pregnancy after loss is actually an incredibly difficult time. Some believe conceiving after loss is a natural state of moving-on or a helpful distraction. On the contrary, it often brings to the surface many unaddressed issues, relational strains and fears.



Expecting Sunshine the Documentary chronicles Alexis Marie Chute’s experience of surviving pregnancy following Zachary's death and navigating the delicate balance of anticipation and anxiety.

As an artist and writer, the perspective Alexis Marie brings to this project is a surreal and intimate one. She invites viewers into her creative perceptions of grief and healing, presenting her darkest days and also her moments of hard-earned resiliency and triumph. Anyone who has lost a person will connect with her reflections and be inspired by her stubborn determination to find the sunshine, the hope in times of personal trials.  


(Image by Pregnancy After Loss Support. Click for info.)


Statistics:

It is very likely that you or someone you know has been affected by the death of a child. The statistics around baby loss are heartbreaking and are worth noting as they relate to the film. 


What do the statistics around baby loss mean in practical language? They equal a huge number of people that are affected by miscarriage, stillbirth, SIDS and other types of losses of children – every year, around the world.

Alexis Marie Chute and her crew believe that family is everything. Children are incredibly important, and their deaths leave a profound gap in the hearts and lives of not only their parents, but their extended families and communities. 
Alexis Marie believes in celebrating each child’s life, however brief, and honouring the individual experience of grief.

What We Need & How We Will Thank You:

Our crowdfunding goal is $25,000. It sounds like a lot of money, but we are passionate about our project and making it the best it can be. Please see the pie chart for the break-down of where the money will go.


Every contribution is not only a financial gift to bring the vision into being, but is also a public statement that this topic matters, that it needs to be talked about, and that there is strength in community.

We are fortunate to have many talented volunteers on our crew who have allowed us to do more with less. It is because of their tireless work, passion and dedication that we can focus our funds across many areas.



How the Contributions will be Spent:

  • Filming (14%) – camera operators, props, costumes, artistic collaboration and equipment
  • Travel (18%) – flights, mileage, hotels and meals while on the road filming experts and families
  • Marketing & Publicity (20%) – flyers, press release writing, press kits, PR and other promotions
  • Thank-You’s & Perks (8%) – cards and gifts for interviewees and other volunteers and participants, and perks for our fabulous contributors (YOU!)
  • Post-Production (14%) – editing, music, composer, and legal support
  • Distribution (12%) – film festivals, entry fees, shipping and DVD’s
  • Contingencies (8%) – all the little things that pop up unexpectedly
  • Indiegogo & Fees (6%) – 5% to the helpful folks at Indiegogo and other fees for PayPal and for credit card payments


Our Perks:

We want to honour our contributors and their unique needs through the types of perks we offer. We have created ways to celebrate children no longer with us, and the ‘Rainbow Babies’ that came after them. The perks also range from limited edition signed DVD’s to a VIP evening at the film premier.

For those who  are able, we would love to welcome you to the "Associate Producer"and "Executive Producer" status within the film. Your generosity is immensely appreciated. 

In the end, though, we realize that contributing to the success of a truly meaningful project is the greatest reward. Thank you for making this project possible!

* Please see the list of our perks on the right. 



Other Ways You Can Help:

Please help us spread the word about Expecting Sunshine the Documentary! You can do this by telling your family, friends and colleagues about the project and sharing our Indiegogo fundraising campaign with them. Join in and be a part of the buzz! We appreciate every email, phone call, tweet, and post made on our behalf. 

Thank you in advance!

Share our website: www.ExpectingSunshine.com

Like us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/expectingsunshine

Follow us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/expectsunbook

Subscribe to our YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/user/AlexisMarieChute

Learn more about life (and pregnancy) after the loss of a child on Wanted, Chosen, Planned: http://www.wantedchosenplanned.com/



More about Alexis Marie Chute:

Alexis Marie Chute is a leading expert in creativity and healing. After her son Zachary died at birth in 2010 she used her extensive background in visual art and writing to help heal herself. Since then, she has become an advocate in supporting and educating others on how to process their grief in creative and authentic ways, promoting healing through the arts and sharing stories in community.

For fifteen years, Alexis Marie Chute has been a professional artist, photographer and writer. She has her Bachelor of Fine Art in visual art from the University of Alberta and her Masters of Fine Art in Creative Writing from Lesley University in Cambridge, MA, graduating as class valedictorian. She has received over 30 noteworthy distinctions, such as The John Poole Award for promotion of the Arts (2015), and was named an “Emerging Canadian Photographer” by Photo Life Magazine and a “Top 40 Under 40” by Avenue Magazine. Alexis Marie was featured in print and video as a Mother-Expert in Today’s Parent Magazine’s Miscarriage and Pregnancy Loss awareness campaign, which won first place at the 38th Annual National Magazine Awards for Best Editorial Package on the Web.

She is a highly regarded speaker and has presented on art, writing, bereavement and the healing capacities of creativity around the world, including conferences such as the Biennial International Perinatal Bereavement Conference (2014, 2016), International Conference on Stillbrith, SIDS and Baby Survival (2014), and The Compassionate Friends National Conference (2014, 2015). She has been the keynote speaker at many major bereavement events including The Walk to Remember, the Baby Steps Memorial Walk, and Alberta Health Services Annual May and Christmas Memorials.

She is an art and writing teacher and mentor, and a bereavement and healing activist. She has written a memoir on loss called Expecting Sunshine and pens an ongoing blog called www.WantedChosenPlanned.com about the death of her son where she offers support for other grieving families. Alexis Marie is widely published in anthologies, newspapers and magazines and her artworks on loss, healing and resiliency have been exhibited across North America. www.AlexisMarieChute.com 

As an author, she is represented by Morty Mint at Mint Literary Agency. As an artist, she is represented by the AR&S Gallery at the Art Gallery of Alberta. For all PR inquiries and interviews, please contact Rachel Sentes of Gal Friday Publicity.

story:
We're making an amazing short film, using all of the right tools, and taking the time we need to make it right! All disciplines of filmmaking are to be used for this....from production design, to building props and sets, to practical effects, to visual effects! We've storyboarded the whole thing and want to keep you involved every step of the way. We'll be posting videos, images, concept art, prop development, and everything we do from here until the premiere so check back often! 

We have an incredibly talented team. Our camera department is lead by Ben Heald, DOP, a local videographer with very real industry experience on movies like the new Ghostbusters. Our director just wrapped shadowing famous director Jim Loach on a feature production, is a post-production and directing pro, and a local here in Boston. We'll be posting profiles of everyone involved in our extras section over the duration of the campaign!

This production is the beginning of many more to come. We want The People's Productions to be all about you, the viewer! We want to keep our movies (soon to be features) independent, and reflective of a very real community involvement...from idea stage to conception, everything will be tracked, shared, voted on, and open to comments on social media. We want to keep the people involved! If you like Protocol, you'll love where we go from here, and we'll be taking votes on our next category of movie!

story:
See our trailer above!


The Film

"The Green Book Chronicles" is a one hour documentary featuring live action interviews with people who used the "The Negro Motorist Green Books" (later called "The Negro Travelers Green Books"), published by Victor H. Green from 1936 - 67, and related stories about traveling during Jim Crow. Interviews are interwoven with a variety of mixed-media art and animated segments, derived from post cards, maps, posters, and other vintage imagery from the era, as well as period and newly commissioned music. Interview locations have included the Jacob Lawrence "Migration Series" at the Museum of Modern Art and the largest known collection of Green Books at the Schomburg Center for Research in Black Culture (division of the New York Public Library).

Our film was recently profiled in the New York Times by Eve M. Kahn:

http://www.nytimes.com/2015/08/07/arts/design/the-green-book-legacy-a-beacon-for-black-travelers.html?_r=0

Visit our full production website: http://greenbookchronicles.com

And Like our Facebook Page: https://www.facebook.com/greenbookchronicles/?f...

Above: Co-Producer, Calvin Ramsey (left) interviews Charles Yarbrough (right) at home in Harlem about traveling during Jim Crow

Below left: Director / Co-Producer Becky Wible Searles reviews the Schomburg Collection of over 20 Green Books with Associate Chief Librarian, Maira Liriano

Below right: Ramona Green, niece by marriage of Victor Green, looks over Green Books at the Schomburg with Howard Glener, whose father was a printer of the Green Books early on (photos by Jimmy Searles)

      

Above: One of 60 paintings from Jacob Lawrence's "Migration Series" (1941) at the Museum of Modern Art, NYC, curated by Leah Dickerman


The Inspiration

Victor H. Green was a Harlem  letter carrier with a 7th grade education who used his pre-internet post office network to help make difficult and even dangerous travel situations safe and enjoyable for African-Americans, both in the US and abroad. Starting in 1936 and for the rest of his life, he published guidebooks to connect travelers with motels, restaurants, gas stations, and other black and white-owned businesses who would welcome African-Americans.  During this time of the Great Migration, many Southern black families attempted to escape Jim Crow laws by moving North, needing information and guidance from the Green Books about how to safely visit family and friends who remained back home. As cars became more affordable through the middle of the 20th century, African-Americans found they needed safe havens in order to travel anywhere in the country, not just in the South.

In this film, we want to honor and celebrate Victor Green and others who have been incredibly resourceful and determined to help others on the road during the Jim Crow era.

Below: Victor H. Green (c. 1955) flanked by Green Books from 1940 and 1949

The Team

Through his award-winning children's book, "Ruth and the Green Book" (2010), Calvin Alexander Ramsey (Co-Producer) has helped rescue Victor H. Green's 30 year series of travel guides for African Americans from obscurity. For the last decade, Ramsey has emerged as one of the foremost experts on the Green Books, also producing a play for adults and currently developing a musical. Born in Baltimore, growing up Ramsey's family relocated to South Carolina as part of the "reverse migration." Calvin lectures extensively about the Green Book in the New York area and beyond as well as on radio.

You can hear Calvin speaking about the Green Book with interview clips from the film on the WUNC North Carolina public radio show, "The State of Things" here:  http://wunc.org/post/green-book-chronicleshttp://wunc.org/post/green-book-chronicles

For 14 years, Becky Wible Searles (Director/Co-Producer) owned her own award-winning animation production company in New York City, creating short form mixed-media animation with live action for clients including Nickelodeon, National Geographic, AT&T, Showtime, and Kool-Aid, appearing on-camera in two episodes of the PBS series, "Reading Rainbow". She has been on the animation faculty of Savannah College of Art and Design (SCAD) Atlanta since 2009,  with previous positions at SCAD's Savannah campus as well as NYC's School of Visual Arts and Pratt Institute. Originally from Ohio, Becky's distant family ancestors owned a tavern on Lake Erie that was rumored to be a stop on the Underground Railway.

From Becky and Calvin:

Sharing a love for untold stories, we joined forces in 2012 to explore combining live action documentary interviews about the Green Book, and related travel stories during Jim Crow, with vintage travel imagery and animation inspired by the Green Books themselves. What started out as a short film with a student, faculty, and volunteer professional crew at SCAD Atlanta has blossomed into a much more extensive one hour film project with broadcast potential, demanding that we take it to another level.

After producing the initial short film material, we regrouped and moved forward in summer 2015 with a professional crew (including some SCAD graduates) to film additional interviews and footage in a number of NYC locations, including the Jacob Lawrence "Migration Series" at the Museum of Modern Art and the extensive Green Book collection at the Schomburg Center for Research in Black Culture, as well as various locations in Harlem, including the legendary jazz club, Minton's. 

Simultaneously we've been connecting with and gathering material from many other individuals and organizations nationwide who have Green Book and Jim Crow-era travel stories to tell, such as the Hotel Dumas in Roanoke, Va (a sort of Minton's for the Southeast) and the National Association of Letter Carriers in Washington, DC of which Victor Green was a member, to name just a few. A number of additional animation segments are also underway and the first piece of music has been commissioned and completed for the "Mapping Jim Crow" section of the film by Hank Roberts and Tenzin from Lyra Music, an excerpt of which can be heard in the trailer.

And we are very excited to recently welcome Dr. Michael R. Ragan and Dr. Deborah V. Payton George from Miami as Associate Producers for "The Green Book Chronicles"! (pictured below).

TREMENDOUS THANKS to the many students, crew, interviewees, and friends who have helped us get this far! YOUR SUPPORT can help us get to the finish line with a one hour, high quality film, suitable for film festivals, television, and DVD release!

(Illustration above by Yohey Horishita / "Traveling Couple" still from animation at the top of the page by Ammar Nasri and Zhou Quan)


Why this campaign? Why now?

We need to keep our momentum going in order to complete the film in early 2016. While $60,000 from this campaign won't complete the film, it will help fund the essentials we need right now:

  • Rough cut edit, including Editor
  • Additional interviews and location footage, including crew and travel costs (we travel and shoot light, but it still takes money!)
  • Additional archival materials and rights
  • Preliminary sound design, including music rights and commissions
  • Additional artwork, animation, and motion graphics
With a solid rough cut, we feel we will be in an excellent place to then raise finishing funds. And if we can raise more than our goal now, of course that would put us even nearer to completion!


Thank you for your interest! Other ways you can help...

Understood that not everyone who is interested in "The Green Book Chronicles" can help us financially! But sharing this site, our production website, and/or our Facebook page shares the story of Victor Green and the Green Books... and that's what we are all about!

Production Website: http://greenbookchronicles.com/
Facebook Page: https://www.facebook.com/greenbookchronicles/?f...

story_txt:
See our trailer above!The Film"The Green Book Chronicles" is a one hour documentary featuring live action interviews with people who used the "The Negro Motorist Green Books" (later called "The Negro Travelers Green Books"), published by Victor H. Green from 1936 - 67, and related stories about traveling during Jim Crow. Interviews are interwoven with a variety of mixed-media art and animated segments, derived from post cards, maps, posters, and other vintage imagery from the era, as well as period and newly commissioned music. Interview locations have included the Jacob Lawrence "Migration Series" at the Museum of Modern Art and the largest known collection of Green Books at the Schomburg Center for Research in Black Culture (division of the New York Public Library). Our film was recently profiled in the New York Times by Eve M. Kahn:

http://www.nytimes.com/2015/08/07/arts/design/the-green-book-legacy-a-beacon-for-black-travelers.html?_r=0Visit our full production website: http://greenbookchronicles.com And Like our Facebook Page: https://www.facebook.com/greenbookchronicles/?f...Above: Co-Producer, Calvin Ramsey (left) interviews Charles Yarbrough (right) at home in Harlem about traveling during Jim CrowBelow left: Director / Co-Producer Becky Wible Searles reviews the Schomburg Collection of over 20 Green Books with Associate Chief Librarian, Maira LirianoBelow right: Ramona Green, niece by marriage of Victor Green, looks over Green Books at the Schomburg with Howard Glener, whose father was a printer of the Green Books early on (photos by Jimmy Searles)       Above: One of 60 paintings from Jacob Lawrence's "Migration Series" (1941) at the Museum of Modern Art, NYC, curated by Leah Dickerman  The Inspiration

Victor H. Green was a Harlem  letter carrier with a 7th 
grade education who used his pre-internet post office network to help make 
difficult and even dangerous travel situations safe and enjoyable for 
African-Americans, both in the US and abroad. Starting in 1936 and for the rest of his 
life, he published guidebooks to connect travelers with motels, restaurants, gas stations, and other black and white-owned businesses who would 
welcome African-Americans.  During this time of the Great Migration, many Southern black families attempted to escape Jim Crow laws by moving North, needing information and guidance from the Green Books about how to safely visit family and friends who remained back home. As cars became more affordable through the middle of the 20th century, African-Americans found they needed safe havens in order to travel anywhere in the country, not just in the South.In this film, we want to honor and 
celebrate Victor Green and others who have been incredibly resourceful 
and determined to help others on the road during the Jim Crow era.Below: Victor H. Green (c. 1955) flanked by Green Books from 1940 and 1949







The Team

Through his award-winning children's book, "Ruth and the Green Book" (2010), Calvin Alexander Ramsey (Co-Producer) has helped rescue Victor H. Green's 30 year series of travel guides for African Americans from obscurity. For the last decade, Ramsey has emerged as one of the foremost experts on the Green Books, also producing a play for adults and currently developing a musical. Born in Baltimore, growing up Ramsey's family relocated to South Carolina as part of the "reverse migration." Calvin lectures extensively about the Green Book in the New York area and beyond as well as on radio. You can hear Calvin speaking about the Green Book with interview clips from the film on the WUNC North Carolina public radio show, "The State of Things" here:   http://wunc.org/post/green-book-chronicleshttp://wunc.org/post/green-book-chronicles
For 14 years, Becky Wible Searles (Director/Co-Producer) owned her own award-winning animation production company in New York City, creating short form mixed-media animation with live action for clients including Nickelodeon, National Geographic, AT&T, Showtime, and Kool-Aid, appearing on-camera in two episodes of the PBS series, "Reading Rainbow". She has been on the animation faculty of Savannah College of Art and Design (SCAD) Atlanta since 2009,  with previous positions at SCAD's Savannah campus as well as NYC's School of Visual Arts and Pratt Institute. Originally from Ohio, Becky's distant family ancestors owned a tavern on Lake Erie that was rumored to be a stop on the Underground Railway.



From Becky and Calvin:

After producing the initial short film material, we regrouped and moved forward in summer 2015 with a professional crew (including some SCAD graduates) to film additional interviews and footage in a number of NYC locations, including the Jacob Lawrence "Migration Series" at the Museum of Modern Art and the extensive Green Book collection at the Schomburg Center for Research in Black Culture, as well as various locations in Harlem, including the legendary jazz club, Minton's.  
Simultaneously we've been connecting with and gathering material from many other individuals and organizations nationwide who have Green Book and Jim Crow-era travel stories to tell, such as the Hotel Dumas in Roanoke, Va (a sort of Minton's for the Southeast) and the National Association of Letter Carriers in Washington, DC of which Victor Green was a member, to name just a few. A number of additional animation segments are also underway and the first piece of music has been commissioned and completed for the "Mapping Jim Crow" section of the film by Hank Roberts and Tenzin from Lyra Music, an excerpt of which can be heard in the trailer.
And we are very excited to recently welcome Dr. Michael R. Ragan and Dr. 
Deborah V. Payton George from Miami as Associate Producers for "The Green Book 
Chronicles"! (pictured below).


TREMENDOUS THANKS to the many students, crew, interviewees, and friends who have helped us get this far! YOUR SUPPORT can help us get to the finish line with a one hour, high quality film, suitable for film festivals, television, and DVD release! 


(Illustration above by Yohey Horishita / "Traveling Couple" still from animation at the top of the page by Ammar Nasri and Zhou Quan)

We need to keep our momentum going in order to complete the film in early 2016. While $60,000 from this campaign won't complete the film, it will help fund the essentials we need right now:

With a solid rough cut, we feel we will be in an excellent place to then raise finishing funds. And if we can raise more than our goal now, of course that would put us even nearer to completion!

story:
Thanks for checking out the Indiegogo crowd-funding campaign for post-production expenses on Shared Rooms, the new gay-themed holiday comedy feature film from writer/director Rob Williams, producer Rodney Johnson and production company Guest House Films (the team that brought you the hit Christmas comedy Make The Yuletide Gay, as well as Role/Play, Out To Kill, The Men Next Door, Long-Term Relationship and more). 

What is Shared Rooms?

Shared Rooms is a feel-good romantic comedy that explores the meaning of home and family through three interrelated stories of gay men finding connections during the week between Christmas and New Year’s Day:

  • A married couple who take in a teenage relative who was kicked out of his home after his parents discovered he was gay.
  • A pair of roommates forced to share a bed for the week, much to the delight (and horror) of the one harboring a secret crush on the other.
  • Two men looking for a quick hookup who end up finding a much stronger connection.

What We Need

We completed principal photography in November 2015, and now we're deep into post production - and that's where we need your help. Our goal is to raise $5,000 to cover some of the Shared Rooms post-production expenses. The funds we raise will go directly to these items:

  • Editing
  • Music composer (for the film's original score)
  • Music licensing
  • Sound design
  • Film festival submissions
We actually need more than $5,000 to cover these expenses, but we're setting a modest goal with the hopes that we can reach or exceed it!

Progress So Far

We are extremely happy with how the film is coming along, especially its overall look - it was shot on the Red Dragon camera in 4K, so the picture looks amazing! Here's the first clip we've released from the film:


Check out the pictures of our cast in the Gallery, along with a few select images from the film. Yes, it's a feel-good holiday film, but it's also very sexy in some places - in case that matters to you. :-)

Every member of the cast gave great performances, and they have great chemistry together. Shooting three distinct storylines was a challenge for us, but the actors brought their A game every single day, which makes for a great film and for a smooth editing process!

We're currently submitting a work-in-progress cut to film festivals, and we're extremely thrilled to be getting so many requests from other film festivals as well as international distributors. This Indiegogo campaign will let us make the best movie possible so that all the people who want to see Shared Rooms will love it as much as we do.

What You Get

We have asked our fans what they want from a crowd-funding campaign, and the overwhelming response is simply getting the movie on DVD/VOD when it comes out and getting their names in the Special Thanks credits of the film, along with traditional rewards such as signed scripts and posters. But we want to offer more, so the Shared Rooms post-production campaign offers some unique perks:

  • Teaser posters signed by members of the Shared Rooms cast.
  • Be one of the first people to see the movie at the exclusive Cast-and-Crew Screening.
  • Naming a character in a future Guest House Films production.
  • Exclusive behind-the-scenes photos from the film's production on a Guest House Films-branded USB drive.
  • A private screening of the film during a three-night Las Vegas VIP getaway with the Guest House Films team.
  • For the first time ever, contributors can get our films Role/Play, The Men Next Door and Out To Kill on Blu-Ray! These films aren't available on Blu-Ray commercially and will only be made for the Shared Rooms contributors. This is truly a perk you can't find anywhere else!
If there's something you'd like that isn't listed in our available perks, feel free to ask us and we might be able to add it to the list!

One big way you can help us out is to "like" the Shared Rooms Facebook page. Increasing the number of "likes" we have can help generate more interest from film festivals and distributors - and it's fast and free!

story:
Short Summary

"...as soon as he touched his custom-guitar, sending a shower of harmonics into the the silence, he rendered all musings about categorisation redundant, . . . he demonstrated just how much musical territory, opened up by Hendrix in the 1960s, still remains for subsequent generations of guitarists to explore." The London Times


José Pires de Almeida Neto has a sophisticated fan base, those who understand the power of his music and the spirit it carries. He came to the United States in 1978 at the age of 24 without speaking much English and to follow his music passion. Soon after his arrival in 1979, Neto auditioned for the legendary Harry Belafonte  who then invited Neto to join his band. For thirty years Neto toured and performed with Belafonte and then became his music director as well for ten years.

José is a founding member of the band Fourth World  with the  legendary master percussionist Airto Moreira and Brazil's Queen of Jazz Flora Purim who started José's journey at Ronnie's Scotts Jazz Club in 1990. Neto is still composing and recording with Airto Moreira today.

In 1995, Jim Capaldi, the great drummer and songwriter of Traffic, came to Ronnie Scotts Jazz Club in London in the afternoon and jammed with José Neto and Airto Moreira. After Capaldi saw the their band Fourth World perform that night, he brought master musician Steve Winwood the very next day to hear the band and Neto's "apocalyptic sounds" as his music has been described in The London Times. That introduction to Steve led them to a musical friendship with multiple jams with Neto's own band, The Netoband. A few years later Winwood asked Neto to join him in an Organ Trio, Winwood's new project (more Traffic style) and they recorded About Time. Neto has been Winwood's guitarist for the last 14 years and has collaborated with Winwood on several songs for the CDs About Time and Nine Lives.

Neto has been leading his own band The Netoband for over 25 years. Those members are Gary Brown, Frank Martin, Celso Alberti and Café. They've toured internationally and each member is a highly respected musician in his own right.

Neto also plays, performs and records with producer and master drummer Narada Michael Walden and Kirtan master Jai Utall.

Despite all of Neto's contributions to international world music, Director Barbara McVeigh was incredibly surprised to learn how little the mainstream knows about Neto.  He didn't even have a Wikipedia entry up until last year.  Yet, she discovered there was a select group of international fans who were highly devoted to Neto's music and how well he was respected by legendary musicians and producers.

As Barbara got to know Neto, she began to understand him. He's very soft spoken and self effacing. There is no ego involved and he always looks to shine the spotlight on someone else. As music journalist Paul Liberatore says about Neto, "He is in service to music and not to fame." 

This film will cast the light on this man behind the white guitar as we follow him to Brazil, New York,  England and California to learn about his past and those who have taught and inspired him to be the man and musician he is today. Neto's diverse musical journey and deep life challenges have taught him the values of loyalty, devotion and positive vision that speak through his sounds and performing spirit. He has touched the lives of the most unsuspecting fans worldwide.

A big thank you to Deborah Santana's organization Do A Little Fund of the SF Foundation for seed money and confidence for this project. We believe this film will carry a very inspiring story as we create some magic. 

What We Need & What You Get

This is our first funding campaign for this project. Based on good faith and collective vision, our team has already started a film treatment and initial filming of Airto Moreira, Paul Liberatore and Neto's American family, Joe Lordan.

Our team includes:

-Barbara McVeigh, Director from California
- Kimberly Blum, Producer/Editor from California
- José Luis Mejias, Filmmaker/Writer/Music Anthropologist from Spain/Colombia
- Taylor Griffith, Photographer from California

and others in London and Los Angeles.

This round of funding will go strictly to expenses only related to the making  of the documentary film as we capture Neto's musical history and talk to those who have inspired him from legacy musicians to Neto's good friend Joe, a retired police officer who worked the streets of the San Francisco Filmore District in the 1960s.

The perks for this film project include opportunities to collect great jazz music, house concerts and more. We have been hosting house parties and sharing other events as they build. Early supporters will be part of our journey and have privileged opportunities to engage in our events.

The Impact

We believe this film will inspire others to understand music on a new level and live a life true to oneself.

"Our film The Man Behind the White Guitar carries a spirit that touched me years ago when I first listened to José Neto's music. It's powerful." - Barbara McVeigh

Barbara McVeigh has cowritten and produced one other film Racing with Copepods which features Dr. Sylvia Earle of Mission Blue, a world speaker and advocate for our oceans. That film was funded by 11th Hour Racing, a program of The Schmidt Family Foundation and individual supporters and businesses. The film is screening internationally as it sets to inspire advocacy, environmental education and international ocean "Hope Spots" for our planet.

Risks & Challenges

We have a committed crew - writers, editors, filmmakers who have already contributed creative efforts to date based on a collective vision alone. A note from the director:

Film Director/Producer Barbara McVeigh: "This project is my passion as the message goes deep for me. My full commitment is to make and complete a meaningful film about José Neto, his music and his values of loyalty, devotion and having a positive spirit to share with and inspire the world."  

We hope to reach our financial goal, If not, our spirit and commitment will still be devoted to complete this documentary. We are currently and actively seeking grants and other funds from angel investors. We appreciate contacts and support.

All film projects have risks. This crew has full intention and drive to create a powerful film.

Other Ways You Can Help

Films require funding - the team needs to eat and pay rent while they craft a story about amazing legacy musicians to share and inspire others.

Please support and join us. Our community is building and we invite you to share our Facebook page, website and campaign with others as we unite to build a vision about loyalty, devotion and sharing a positive spirit through the power of music and musicianship.

Photo of José Neto by Ronaldo Aguiar
Thank you Fenix Club in San Rafael, California for footage.
story_txt:
Short Summary "...as soon as he touched his custom-guitar, sending a shower of harmonics into the the silence, he rendered all musings about categorisation redundant, . . . he demonstrated just how much musical territory, opened up by Hendrix in the 1960s, still remains for subsequent generations of guitarists to explore." The London Times



 José Pires de Almeida Neto has a sophisticated fan base, those who 
understand the power of his music and the spirit it carries. He came to the United States in 1978 at the age of 24 without speaking much English and to follow his music passion. Soon after his arrival in 1979, Neto auditioned for the legendary Harry Belafonte  who then invited Neto to join his band. For thirty years Neto toured and performed with Belafonte and then became his music director as well for ten years. 
José is a founding member of the band Fourth World  with the  legendary master percussionist Airto Moreira and Brazil's Queen of Jazz Flora Purim who
 started José's journey at Ronnie's Scotts Jazz Club in 1990. Neto is 
still composing and recording with Airto Moreira today. 
In 1995, Jim Capaldi, the great drummer and songwriter of Traffic, came to Ronnie Scotts Jazz Club in London in the afternoon and jammed with José Neto and Airto Moreira. After Capaldi saw the their band Fourth World perform that night, he brought master musician Steve Winwood the very 
next day to hear the band and Neto's "apocalyptic sounds" as his music has been 
described in The London Times. That introduction to Steve led
them to a musical friendship with multiple jams with Neto's own band, The Netoband. A few years later Winwood asked Neto to join him in an Organ Trio, Winwood's new project (more Traffic style) and they recorded About Time. Neto has been Winwood's guitarist for the last 14 years and has collaborated with Winwood on several songs for the CDs About Time and Nine Lives. 

Neto has been leading his own band The Netoband for over 25 years. Those members are Gary Brown, Frank Martin, Celso Alberti and Café. They've toured internationally and each member is a highly respected musician in his own right. 
Neto also plays, performs and records with producer and master drummer Narada Michael Walden and Kirtan master Jai Utall. 
Despite all of Neto's contributions to international world music, Director Barbara McVeigh was incredibly surprised to learn how little the mainstream knows about Neto.  He didn't even have a Wikipedia entry up until last year.  Yet, she discovered there was a select group of international fans who were highly devoted to Neto's music and how well he was respected by legendary musicians and producers.
As Barbara got to know Neto, she began to understand him. He's very soft spoken and self effacing. There is no ego involved and he always looks to shine the spotlight on someone else. As music journalist Paul Liberatore says about Neto, "He is in service to music and not to fame."  
This film will cast the light on this man behind the white guitar as we 
follow him to Brazil, New York,  England and California to learn about 
his past and those who have taught and inspired him to be the man and 
musician he is today. Neto's diverse musical journey and deep life 
challenges have taught him 
the values of loyalty, devotion and positive vision that speak through 
his sounds and performing spirit. He has touched the lives of the most 
unsuspecting fans worldwide. 


A big thank you to Deborah Santana's organization Do A Little Fund of the SF Foundation for seed money and confidence for this project. We believe this film will carry a very inspiring story as we create some magic.  
  What We Need & What You Get This is our first funding campaign for this project. Based on good faith and collective vision, our team has already started a film treatment and initial filming of Airto Moreira, Paul Liberatore and Neto's American family, Joe Lordan. 
Our team includes:
-Barbara McVeigh, Director from California- Kimberly Blum, Producer/Editor from California- José Luis Mejias, Filmmaker/Writer/Music Anthropologist from Spain/Colombia- Taylor Griffith, Photographer from California
and others in London and Los Angeles. 
 This round of funding will go strictly to expenses only related to the making  of the documentary film as we capture Neto's musical history and talk to those who have inspired him from legacy musicians to Neto's good friend Joe, a retired police officer who worked the streets of the San Francisco Filmore District in the 1960s. 
 
The perks for this film project include opportunities to collect great jazz music, house concerts and more. We have been hosting house parties and sharing other events as they build. Early supporters will be part of our journey and have privileged opportunities to engage in our events.
    The Impact We believe this film will inspire others to understand music on a new level and live a life true to oneself.
"Our film The Man Behind the White Guitar carries a spirit that touched 
me years ago when I first listened to José Neto's music. It's powerful."
 - Barbara McVeighBarbara McVeigh has cowritten and produced one other film Racing with Copepods which features Dr. Sylvia Earle of Mission Blue, a world speaker and advocate for our oceans. That film was funded by 11th Hour Racing, a program of The Schmidt Family Foundation and individual supporters and businesses. The film is screening internationally as it sets to inspire advocacy, environmental education and international ocean "Hope Spots" for our planet.    Risks & Challenges
We have a committed crew - writers, editors, filmmakers who have already contributed creative efforts to date based on a collective vision alone. A note from the director:Film Director/Producer Barbara McVeigh: "This project is my passion as 
the message goes deep for me. My full commitment is to make and complete a 
meaningful film about José Neto, his music and his values of loyalty, devotion and having a positive spirit to share with and inspire the world."  We hope to reach our financial goal, If not, our spirit and commitment will still be devoted to complete this documentary. We are currently and actively seeking grants and other funds from angel investors. We appreciate contacts and support. All film projects have risks. This crew has full intention and drive to create a powerful film. 
  Other Ways You Can HelpFilms require funding - the team needs to eat and pay rent while they craft a story about amazing legacy musicians to share and inspire others. Please support and join us. Our community is building and we invite you to share our Facebook page, website and campaign with others as we unite to build a vision about loyalty, devotion and sharing a positive spirit through the power of music and musicianship. story:
What's a Podcast? - A Documentary Film

Podcasting is the new Punk Rock!

Podcasting saved my life.

What IS a Podcast? Podcasting is a new digital communications medium that

is not only changing the way people consume media, it is changing peoples lives.

Through my journey, I have met fellow podcasters, and listeners, whom I now

call friends. The inspiration and comfort this medium gives to so many is a story that hasn’t yet received the attention it deserves.

In 2009 things went crazy for me and my family. We were living in Virginia when I was downsized, leaving us with a mortgage and a feeling of What now?  Times were tough. No one was hiring. This downward spiral lasted for a few years, forcing us to return home to New Jersey to live with relatives.

I was in a deep, dark depression. At my lowest, I picked up a book from the

famous movie director and podcast pioneer, Kevin Smith. The book gave me permission to do something crazy, if not desperate. 

Do it

Start a podcast

Go talk on the internet with your friends.

And so I did, starting my own highly successful podcast: ThatMan on Fatman.

But this film is not just about my journey. Its the journey of the many

podcasters, and listeners, friends and family, and how this medium is changing, helping, and even saving peoples lives, let alone building communities. The world is now at everyone's fingertips and podcasters are the pioneers of a new digital age and medium.

Please join me in this insider look of a world heading for tomorrow.

To Accomplish This Vision

Based on researching other projects in the same range and scope of the documentary we will be shooting, and discussions with other experienced filmmakers, we are looking to keep the production budget to 15k (U.S. Dollars) and anticipate the costs to fall into the following cost centers.

  • Research, Archival Photographs, Stock Footage & Film Clips -8%

  • Production Expenses - Costs associated camera, sound, lighting and grip equipment, the facilities and the services required to shoot the documentary. - 21%

  • Travel Expenses - There will be filming in multiple locations. - 19%

  • Editorial - Editing Fee - 20%

  • Music - Film Scoring & Music Rights - 8%

  • Administrative Costs/Professional Fees - 8%

  • Insurance - 8%

  • Promotional  - 8%

 Please note, our initial IGG campaign took in about $2200. And between that and our own personal investments, this project has gotten further than we ever anticipated. At this time we could really use your help to offset the costs of wrapping up shooting.

Social Impact

As an avid and active podcaster, I have experienced and witnessed how this new communications medium has enriched peoples lives. Yet podcasting is still a mystery to many. This film hopes to shed a real light on the people who have pioneered, embraced, and are even redefining the potential of this new communications tool. It's an amazing story about technology and about people that just needs to be told.

Risks & Challenges

  • First Time Director/Filmmaker - It is true that this is our first production, but to compensate we brought in an experienced team that believe in the project. A veteran of independent film, Bob Hawk (as Consulting Producer) and experienced filmmaker David Madison (as Directory of Photography & Associate Producer.)
  • Independent Project - Virtually anything can go wrong. We understand this is a risk. But we have taken (and will continue to take) all steps necessary to legally protect the integrity of this project (such as incorporating, production insurance, E&I, etc.) so that contributors can feel confident that ThatMan Productions LLC will deliver on this project. We have a true passion for this medium and want to give this project our all.

Other Ways You Can Help

Besides helping fund the project, by far the best way anyone can help is to spread the word:

  • Share about this IndyGoGo campaign with friends, and podcast listeners and creators.
  • Share the "Pitch Video"
  • Like Us on Facebook
  • Follow Us on Twitter
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
No matter how you can help, we truly appreciate it. Especially sharing about the project on social media. This is a passion project we intend to see through.
