story:
Ways of Being is a novel initiative by a few young guys from Northeast India. The Director of the project Rajib Phukan and the Script Writer and the Art Director Guna Moni Boruah are based in Assam, India, while the Assistant Director Abhishek Bhattacharyya is based in Austin, Texas. Rajib was trained in Jyoti Chitraban Film and Television Institute, Guwahati and he has worked as the Assistant Director of Drona, The Seventeens, As the River Flows, Right Here Right Now, and Hands of the Dragon. Guna received his training at National School of Drama, New Delhi and he is now a well established theatre director and actor in India. Abhishek completed his training in Digital Filmmaking at Austin School of Film and his debut project as a director, Eggshells will be screened at SXSW, 2016. Abikal Borah, who has developed the concept of the project is a historian by profession. Abikal is also based in Austin, Texas. In short, we are a group of people with diverse expertise who shares a common interest.  

We all have grown up with the sounds of folk music in the Brahmaputra valley. We strongly feel they need to be represented on a global platform. This documentary film is our long cherished dream. By showcasing the life stories of five extremely gifted musicians, we hope to offer a sense of the folk musical forms in the region.

Simultaneously, Ways of Being will also depict an ethnographic representation of everyday life in the Brahmaputra valley. The documentary will show how indigenous musical forms came into being and survived for generations amidst the thick and thin of everyday struggle. The musicians will also introduce the fascinating stories about the processes of manufacturing indigenous musical instruments. They will also inform the audience about the folklore associated with them. While listening to the life stories of the musicians, the audience will discover the state of agrarian economy, consequences of natural calamity, and contemporary history of violence in the valley. In other words, Ways of Being will present a sociological take on the culture of the region.

Your contributions to the project will help those unrecognized musicians to reach out to a global audience. We plan to invest your donations in the production process which will include hiring expertise for video editing, sound studio, renting camera, lights, and other necessary technical equipment. We also intend to offer an honorarium to the musicians depending on the status of the funding. 

Please spread the word out there for us if you like our concept and think that this documentary is worth watching and worth supporting. Share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, etc. There are sharing tools on Indiegogo too! Thanks!!

story:
Sublime Visions engages the leading chemists, doctors, therapists and visionaries who are actively working with psychedelics as contemporary therapeutic medicines to inspire and facilitate deep healing processes. The mission of this multi­platform project is to unveil the personal side of psychedelic medicines, and to be an approachable and identifiable source of information that builds greater awareness of advances in the reputable use of psychedelics in medicine, art and education.

In its final form, this project will be a book, an exhibition, a film, a web, and social media presence all aimed at a general audience.  As an artistic creation, it will resonate emotionally with the audience, while carrying the weight of credible, up to date information.  The photography will be a finely crafted collection of environmental portraits and detail oriented ethnographic photographs of each participant.  

By visiting the living and working environments of the participants, thus sharing their personal story, we gain a greater understanding of who they are, what their values and morals are and what motivates them.  We will see with our own eyes how each person has integrated their work in their lives.  Once we are able to see and understand a person, it becomes easier to trust the work that they are doing.  

The photographs, stories and inverviews will allow each viewer to personally discover the people working with the medicines, and will show a glimpse into the essence that makes each individual unique and principled.


The Multidisciplinary Association for Psychedelic Studies (MAPS) is serving as non-profit fiscal sponsor for Sublime Visions, and helping liaison with Sublime Visions participants and project promotion.  MAPS is a 501(c)(3) non-profit research and educational organization that develops medical, legal, and cultural contexts for people to benefit from the careful uses of psychedelics and marijuana. Their fiscal sponsorship gives Sublime Visions availability for grants as well as making all donations to Sublime Visions tax-deductible in the U.S. MAPS is not directly funding the project.
    www.maps.org


Already, we have had the honor to visit with a few extraordinary, kind, open and accomplished people who have been gracious in inviting us into their homes and hearts; and have promised agreements for future visits with more.


*Alexandar's 'Sasha' Shulgin's home laboratory

Alexandar ‘Sasha’ Shulgin, Ph.D. ~ an American Medicinal Chemist, Biochemist, Pharmacologist, Psychopharmacologist and Author. 

Sasha began studying organic chemistry as a Harvard university student at the age of 16, and went on to earn his Ph.D. in biochemistry from the University of California Berkeley in 1954.  He has a vast lifetime of accomplishments, studies and publications, including receiving several awards from the DEA.  Sasha and his wife Ann Shulgin authored the books PIHKAL and TIHKAL, which have become guides of psychoactive drugs for an entire generation.  Sasha is credited with introducing MDMA (Ecstasy) to psychologists in the late 1970’s for psychopharmaceutical use, and due in part to his extensive work in the field of psychedelic research and the rational drug design of psychedelic drugs, he is considered the ‘Godfather of Psychedelics’.

(Since Sasha Shulgin is deceased, this part of the project will be documented in a unique special way)

www.shulginresearch.org


Ralph Metzner, Ph.D. ~ Psychologist, Psychotherapist, Writer, Professor and Researcher. 

Ralph earned his Ph.D. in Psychology from Harvard where he also participated in psychedelic research in the early 1960’s with Timothy Leary and Richard Alpert (Ram Dass). He is a Professor Emeritus at the California Institute of Integral Studies, is the co­founder and President of the Green Earth Foundation, and is a consciousness researcher of over 45 years devoted to healing and harmonizing the relationship between humans and the Earth. 

www.ralphmetznerblog.com

www.greenearthfound.org

Richard M. Wolfe ~ Media Executive, Electrical Engineer, Policy Maker and Board Member.

Richard is a Harvard Business School graduate and Media Executive who was the primary facilitator in the decriminalization of marijuana in Ohio. He is a board member at the Heffter Research Institute and of the LA chapter of the Association of Satellite Professionals, Past vice chairman of the Engineering Committee of the Association of Maximum Service Television, (MSTV) Washington, DC and holds an FCC First Class Operators license. Richard is an policy maker and advocate in the movement for psychedelic research.

http://www.heffter.org/board-wolfe.htm


Distinguished professionals coming up next:


Stanislav Grof, M.D., Ph.D. ~ a Psychiatrist, Professor, Researcher and Founder.

Stanislav received his M.D. from Charles University in Prague and his Ph.D. in medicine at the Czechoslovakian Academy of Sciences. In 1967, he was invited as an Assistant Professor of Psychiatry at Johns Hopkins University School of Medicine. Grof is known for his early studies of LSD psychedelic therapy, and following the suppression of legal LSD use in the late 1960s, he went on to develop "Holotropic Breathwork". Grof is one of the founders of the field of transpersonal psychology and a researcher into the use of non­ordinary states of consciousness for purposes of exploring, healing, and obtaining growth and insights into the human psyche.

www.stanislavgrof.com


James Fadiman, Ph.D. ~ Psychologist, Writer, Psychedelic Researcher and Institute Founder.

James earned his BA from Harvard, as well as earning his Masters and his Ph.D. in psychology from Stanford University.  He is co-founder of the Sofia University, and is well known for his work in psychedelic research since the 1960’s including his current research of micro-dosing with LSD.  In his guide to effects of psychedelic use for spiritual (high dose), therapeutic (moderate dose), and problem-solving (low dose) purposes, Fadiman outlines best practices for safe, sacred entheogenic voyages.

www.jamesfadiman.com


Rick Doblin, Ph.D. ~ Public Policy Expert, MAPS Founder and Executive Director.

Rick earned his doctorate from Harvard University in 2001. Among many accomplishments, he conducted a thirty­four year follow­up study to Timothy Leary’s Concord Prison Experiment, was among the first to be certified as a Holotropic Breathwork practitioner under Stanislav Grof, and is the founder and Executive Director of the Multidisciplinary Association for Psychedelic Studies (MAPS) where he is dedicated to making MDMA an FDA approved medicine.

www.maps.org


*Alexandar's 'Sasha' Shulgin's home laboratory


We’ve just gotten started ~ there are many more astounding people to go!

Sublime Visions is a true collaborative effort

There have been many friends and colleagues who have contributed to its creation to this point. I would very much like to give Deep Gratitude to Everyone who has helped make it what it is so far:

Rick Doblin, Ph.D. - Founder and Executive Director of MAPS - for his vision in seeing that MAPS and Sublime Visions have parallel missions, and to saying ‘Yes’ in being our fiscal sponsor and support for the project.  www.maps.org

Brad Burge -MAPS Director of Communications and Marketing - words cannot express the deep gratitude I have for this man, for his vast generosity in helping with every aspect that Sublime Visions has requested of him.  He is a true ally, and one of the most kind and honest men I’ve ever known.  www.maps.org/about/staff

David Bronner of Dr. Bronner Soap - for being our ‘Angel Investor’.  He was the first to support us with a considerable financial contribution, which made our visit with Ralph Metzner and the rest of this campaign possible.  www.drbronner.com

Sam Sternlight - for his expert contractual advice and assistance with our MAPS fiscal sponsorship. insightfin.com

Susan Middleton for her mentorship and willing council every time I need a second set of eyes.  www.susanmiddleton.com

Seabrook Leaf - for taking me to my first MAPS conference where he introduced me to Dr. Sasha Shulgin, and for being a deep well of inspiration.

Ann Shulgin - for welcoming me into her home, and granting permission to publish photographs of Sasha’s Laboratory.  www.shulginresearch.org

Mark Martini for his unending dedication to the Shulgin’s and their legacy; and for his contributions to the psychedelic community.  www.facebook.com/TheElysiumFoundation

James Oroc, Author of Tryptamine Palace, who has a profound understanding of the psychedelic culture and for imagining the title of this project - Sublime Visions: Explorers of the Edge of Consciousness.  www.tryptaminepalace.com 

Savannah Omaha for helping transform thoughts into action with her transcription and editing of the original project proposal - the first steps of bringing any project to life.  

Roy Haber, P.C. for his instantaneous belief in Sublime Visions, and introduction to Richard Wolfe.

Bryan Bennett for facilitating continued visits with Richard Wolfe with open kindness.

Claudia Wolfe for graciously welcoming us into their home and co-creating such a beautiful portrait of Richard.

Stu Nami Smith for freely giving his generous time and expertise in creating and maintaining our website. www.facebook.com/stunamiart

Seumas Coutts, Ph.D. for his assistance in refining the original proposal and for filming the interview with Ralph Metzner.  www.linkedin.com/in/srcoutts

Bobby Lee for his generosity with his gear, his assistance in the filming of Ralph Metzner and post production work, and his continued dedication in being an integral member of the Sublime Visions Team.  tokayartwear.com

Veronica Shanti, my sister, who has the best taste in music of anyone I know, and has always led me to the most inspiring sounds.  For this she gave me a selection of music to be accompany the content of the film ~ of which I chose The Human Experience and Ion Driver.  kdrt.org/program/vees-beats

David Block (The Human Experience) for his long-term musical inspiration and song Into the Mothership which appears at the beginning of this film.  soundcloud.com/thehumanexperience

Dennis Bunton (Ion Driver) for his song Deep Sands which appears in this film. www.facebook.com/iondrivermusic

Michaleah Ivie for her perfection in styling and extraordinary interviewing abilities, she brought out the best in me, and does in everyone.  www.miraculah.com

Daniel Garcia for his expertise and beautiful eye with video and editing which created the film for this campaign, his attention to detail in putting the elements together for this campaign, and his continued dedication in being an integral member of the Sublime Visions Team. ddddgggg.com

And of course to my entire community; who have believed in, supported and encouraged Sublime Visions from the moment I first began speaking of it - who are a continual reminder that this is exactly what our world needs to bridge the gap between fear and understanding.


David Bronner of Dr. Bronner Soap has generously donated a small gift that got us started with our first interview with Ralph Metzner.  


Organizations supporting Sublime Visions


How your gift helps, and where your money is going: 

Projected Budget

We are reaching out for support and contributions for a total budget of $100,000 USD to cover equipment and travel costs, as well as take care of production expenses.  

Any amount that you would so generously contribute will be a most appreciated in support to our ultimate goal.  Please feel free to contact us with any questions. 

Pre-production:  Researching and establishing relationships with subjects, arrange meetings and photography shoots with participants, contact and establish foreword writers, establish content writer, gather public story contributions, equipment and travel preparation, establish relations with publishers and online communities, establish exhibit venues.

Production:  Original Photography and Videography to be created in the field at each subjects place of work or residence.   Recordings of each sitting during photography sessions.  Original writing for the book will convey why each subject is featured, a personal story of who they are and why they do their work, the importance of their work, and how their work is helping the lives of others and themselves.  Included with be a cohesion of contributed public stories that share how a particular medicine has helped their lives.

Post-production: Image editing, processing, retouching and proofing for reproduction.

This initial $100K budget estimates the costs of preparing for and producing the core material only.  Book publication and exhibition production budgets are separate and will be dependent upon publisher and volume of material to be exhibited. 

*This budget is subject to change with market prices, adjusting project needs and other unforeseen expenses. Your tax deductible donation to Sublime Visions does not imply ownership or authorship of the project. All donors are protected to the letter of the law from any legal responsibilities resulting from production.  

*Ralph Metzner's home detail.


OUR TEAM

Geneva Shanti is a San Francisco Art Institute and Brooks Institute of Photography graduate, and has received several awards and grants in her career.  She has also associate produced six major publications and their accompanying exhibitions with world renowned photographers Susan Middleton and David Liittschwager with over 16 years of collaborations with them.  Her uniquely touching photographs have been published and collected in commercial and fine art throughout the world.  She also teaches and leads photography workshops, helping others understand their tools while refining their visual language. 

Daniel Garcia was born in Guatemala in the 80´s during the boom in digital art, and he has always been drawn to digital media and its limitless capabilities. Since a very early age, he was exposed to the creative communication, seeing as his father was a creative director for an international advertising firm. This had a huge effect on him as an individual, and as an artist. He is now truly, a multi-modality artist, focusing on music, film, and photography.  His intention is to serve other artists and to help them expand and grow through communicating the essence of what they are, and mean to say to their audience.

Bobby Lee is the Principal Designer at Tokay Artwear and Post Production Editor & founding member at A2B IMAGING.  Being a passionate photographer, he has gained extensive skills and knowledge through his studies and education in multiple areas of the art and production world.  Each project that Bobby Lee takes on consists of multiple works often in a range of media grouped around specific themes and media and often introduces new interests leading to the next body of work. 

*Richard Wolfe's home detail.


Other Ways You Can Help

SHARE THIS CAMPAIGN - REACH OUT, CONNECT TO YOUR NETWORK, CONTRIBUTE YOUR STORIES, INTRODUCE PEOPLE TO THE PROJECT

Join our Facebook page, share the word and contribute!  Our Facebook page is Sublime Visions and our website is www.sublime-visions.org.  Please like and promote our pages and follow us.  


Thank You for contributing to Sublime Visions in ways that inspire you!
story_txt:
Sublime Visions engages the leading chemists, doctors, therapists and visionaries who are actively working with psychedelics as contemporary therapeutic medicines to inspire and facilitate deep healing processes. The mission of this multi­platform project is to unveil the personal side of psychedelic medicines, and to be an approachable and identifiable source of information that builds greater awareness of advances in the reputable use of psychedelics in medicine, art and education.In its final form, this project will be a book, an exhibition, a film, a web, and social media presence all aimed at a general audience.  As an artistic creation, it will resonate emotionally with the audience, while carrying the weight of credible, up to date information.  The photography will be a finely crafted collection of environmental portraits and detail oriented ethnographic photographs of each participant.  By visiting the living and working environments of the participants, thus sharing their personal story, we gain a greater understanding of who they are, what their values and morals are and what motivates them.  We will see with our own eyes how each person has integrated their work in their lives.  Once we are able to see and understand a person, it becomes easier to trust the work that they are doing.  The photographs, stories and inverviews will allow each viewer to personally discover the people working with the medicines, and will show a glimpse into the essence that makes each individual unique and principled.The Multidisciplinary Association for Psychedelic Studies (MAPS) is serving as non-profit fiscal sponsor for Sublime Visions, and helping liaison with Sublime Visions participants and project promotion.  MAPS is a 501(c)(3) non-profit research and educational organization that develops medical, legal, and cultural contexts for people to benefit from the careful uses of psychedelics and marijuana. Their fiscal sponsorship gives Sublime Visions availability for grants as well as making all donations to Sublime Visions tax-deductible in the U.S. MAPS is not directly funding the project.    www.maps.orgAlready, we have had the honor to visit with a few extraordinary, kind, open and accomplished people who have been gracious in inviting us into their homes and hearts; and have promised agreements for future visits with more.*Alexandar's 'Sasha' Shulgin's home laboratoryAlexandar ‘Sasha’ Shulgin, Ph.D. ~ an American Medicinal Chemist, Biochemist, Pharmacologist, Psychopharmacologist and Author. 
Sasha began studying organic chemistry as a Harvard university student at the age of 16, and went on to earn his Ph.D. in biochemistry from the University of California Berkeley in 1954.  He has a vast lifetime of accomplishments, studies and publications, including receiving several awards from the DEA.  Sasha and his wife Ann Shulgin authored the books PIHKAL and TIHKAL, which have become guides of psychoactive drugs for an entire generation.  Sasha is credited with introducing MDMA (Ecstasy) to psychologists in the late 1970’s for psychopharmaceutical use, and due in part to his extensive work in the field of psychedelic research and the rational drug design of psychedelic drugs, he is considered the ‘Godfather of Psychedelics’.
(Since Sasha Shulgin is deceased, this part of the project will be documented in a unique special way)
www.shulginresearch.org

Ralph Metzner, Ph.D. ~ Psychologist, Psychotherapist, Writer, Professor and Researcher. 
Ralph earned his Ph.D. in Psychology from Harvard where he also participated in psychedelic research in the early 1960’s with Timothy Leary and Richard Alpert (Ram Dass). He is a Professor Emeritus at the California Institute of Integral Studies, is the co­founder and President of the Green Earth Foundation, and is a consciousness researcher of over 45 years devoted to healing and harmonizing the relationship between humans and the Earth. 
www.ralphmetznerblog.com
www.greenearthfound.orgRichard M. Wolfe ~ Media Executive, Electrical Engineer, Policy Maker and Board Member.
Richard is a Harvard Business School graduate and Media Executive who was the primary facilitator in the decriminalization of marijuana in Ohio. He is a board member at the Heffter Research Institute and of the LA chapter of the Association of Satellite Professionals, Past vice chairman of the Engineering Committee of the Association of Maximum Service Television, (MSTV) Washington, DC and holds an FCC First Class Operators license. Richard is an policy maker and advocate in the movement for psychedelic research.
http://www.heffter.org/board-wolfe.htmDistinguished professionals coming up next:

Stanislav Grof, M.D., Ph.D. ~ a Psychiatrist, Professor, Researcher and Founder.
Stanislav received his M.D. from Charles University in Prague and his Ph.D. in medicine at the Czechoslovakian Academy of Sciences. In 1967, he was invited as an Assistant Professor of Psychiatry at Johns Hopkins University School of Medicine. Grof is known for his early studies of LSD psychedelic therapy, and following the suppression of legal LSD use in the late 1960s, he went on to develop "Holotropic Breathwork". Grof is one of the founders of the field of transpersonal psychology and a researcher into the use of non­ordinary states of consciousness for purposes of exploring, healing, and obtaining growth and insights into the human psyche.
www.stanislavgrof.com

James Fadiman, Ph.D. ~ Psychologist, Writer, Psychedelic Researcher and Institute Founder.
James earned his BA from Harvard, as well as earning his Masters and his Ph.D. in psychology from Stanford University.  He is co-founder of the Sofia University, and is well known for his work in psychedelic research since the 1960’s including his current research of micro-dosing with LSD.  In his guide to effects of psychedelic use for spiritual (high dose), therapeutic (moderate dose), and problem-solving (low dose) purposes, Fadiman outlines best practices for safe, sacred entheogenic voyages.www.jamesfadiman.com

Rick Doblin, Ph.D. ~ Public Policy Expert, MAPS Founder and Executive Director.
Rick earned his doctorate from Harvard University in 2001. Among many accomplishments, he conducted a thirty­four year follow­up study to Timothy Leary’s Concord Prison Experiment, was among the first to be certified as a Holotropic Breathwork practitioner under Stanislav Grof, and is the founder and Executive Director of the Multidisciplinary Association for Psychedelic Studies (MAPS) where he is dedicated to making MDMA an FDA approved medicine.
www.maps.org*Alexandar's 'Sasha' Shulgin's home laboratoryWe’ve just gotten started ~ there are many more astounding people to go!



Sublime Visions is a true collaborative effort
There have been many friends and colleagues who have contributed to its creation to this point. I would very much like to give Deep Gratitude to Everyone who has helped make it what it is so far:

Rick Doblin, Ph.D. - Founder and Executive Director of MAPS - for his vision in seeing that MAPS and Sublime Visions have parallel missions, and to saying ‘Yes’ in being our fiscal sponsor and support for the project.  www.maps.org
Brad Burge -MAPS Director of Communications and Marketing - words cannot express the deep gratitude I have for this man, for his vast generosity in helping with every aspect that Sublime Visions has requested of him.  He is a true ally, and one of the most kind and honest men I’ve ever known.  www.maps.org/about/staff
David Bronner of Dr. Bronner Soap - for being our ‘Angel Investor’.  He was the first to support us with a considerable financial contribution, which made our visit with Ralph Metzner and the rest of this campaign possible.  www.drbronner.com
Sam Sternlight - for his expert contractual advice and assistance with our MAPS fiscal sponsorship. insightfin.com

Susan Middleton for her mentorship and willing council every time I need a second set of eyes.  www.susanmiddleton.com
Seabrook Leaf - for taking me to my first MAPS conference where he introduced me to Dr. Sasha Shulgin, and for being a deep well of inspiration.
Ann Shulgin - for welcoming me into her home, and granting permission to publish photographs of Sasha’s Laboratory.  www.shulginresearch.org
Mark Martini for his unending dedication to the Shulgin’s and their legacy; and for his contributions to the psychedelic community.  www.facebook.com/TheElysiumFoundation
James Oroc, Author of Tryptamine Palace, who has a profound understanding of the psychedelic culture and for imagining the title of this project - Sublime Visions: Explorers of the Edge of Consciousness.  www.tryptaminepalace.com 
Savannah Omaha for helping transform thoughts into action with her transcription and editing of the original project proposal - the first steps of bringing any project to life.  
Roy Haber, P.C. for his instantaneous belief in Sublime Visions, and introduction to Richard Wolfe.
Bryan Bennett for facilitating continued visits with Richard Wolfe with open kindness.
Claudia Wolfe for graciously welcoming us into their home and co-creating such a beautiful portrait of Richard.

Stu Nami Smith for freely giving his generous time and expertise in creating and maintaining our website. www.facebook.com/stunamiart
Seumas Coutts, Ph.D. for his assistance in refining the original proposal and for filming the interview with Ralph Metzner.  www.linkedin.com/in/srcoutts
Bobby Lee for his generosity with his gear, his assistance in the filming of Ralph Metzner and post production work, and his continued dedication in being an integral member of the Sublime Visions Team.  tokayartwear.com
Veronica Shanti, my sister, who has the best taste in music of anyone I know, and has always led me to the most inspiring sounds.  For this she gave me a selection of music to be accompany the content of the film ~ of which I chose The Human Experience and Ion Driver.  kdrt.org/program/vees-beats
David Block (The Human Experience) for his long-term musical inspiration and song Into the Mothership which appears at the beginning of this film.  soundcloud.com/thehumanexperience

Dennis Bunton (Ion Driver) for his song Deep Sands which appears in this film. www.facebook.com/iondrivermusic
Michaleah Ivie for her perfection in styling and extraordinary interviewing abilities, she brought out the best in me, and does in everyone.  www.miraculah.com

Daniel Garcia for his expertise and beautiful eye with video and editing which created the film for this campaign, his attention to detail in putting the elements together for this campaign, and his continued dedication in being an integral member of the Sublime Visions Team. ddddgggg.com
And of course to my entire community; who have believed in, supported and encouraged Sublime Visions from the moment I first began speaking of it - who are a continual reminder that this is exactly what our world needs to bridge the gap between fear and understanding.


David Bronner of Dr. Bronner Soap has generously donated a small gift that got us started with our first interview with Ralph Metzner.

story:
Overcoming Adversity

Life is full of challenges. This is especially true for Scotty Smiley, a retired US Army veteran from Spokane, Washington.  On April 6, 2005, during his deployment in Mosul, Iraq, Scotty was hit by a suicide car bomb, leaving him permanently blind.

Scotty has spent the last ten years attempting feats deemed extremely difficult for those with sight, and nearly impossible without it. Scotty has climbed mountains, gone skydiving, surfed, and written a book, all without the use of his eyes. On June 28, 2015, Scotty competed in the Coeur d'Alene Ironman triathlon, accompanied by his racing guide and brother-in-law, Andy Cooper.


Beat Feet: a documentary by SkEye Studios

In March of 2015, SkEye Studios traveled from our home in Portland, Oregon, to Spokane, Washington, where we interviewed Scotty and his wife Tiffany for the first time.

When we first heard Scotty's story, we wanted to drop everything and tell it. As a very young production company with only 3 employees, this seemed impossible to do on our own. We reached out and were met with a wealth of support from those who responded to our call for help. Our previous campaign met and exceeded our financial goal in just a few weeks.

While the support we received from that first campaign was enough to fund the development and principal photography of Beat Feet, we knew it would take more resources to give Scotty's story the recognition it deserves.


Since we traveled to Coeur d'Alene in June to film Scotty's Ironman race, we have spent hundreds of hours assembling and refining the footage we shot, spending long nights and weekends putting the finishing touches on the film. It is now about 90 percent complete, but we need your help to tell this story to the world. 

Narrated by Coach Mike Krzyzewski

We are very excited to welcome head coach of Duke basketball Mike Krzyzewski as part of the documentary team as narrator.  Coach K is long time friend and supporter of Scott Smiley.



Perks!

Join the Beat Feet family and get amazing perks such as our full color film poster, our one-of-a-kind t-shirt, and our original soundtrack.  Be one of the first and only to gain exclusive access to swag and updates!


The Music

Motivated first and foremost by our passion for good storytelling, we have teamed up with several talented artists and musicians who are helping us bring Scotty's story to the world with their original compositions.  

           


The Impact

Scotty's story is paralleled in the lives of countless veterans who have faced insurmountable odds. It is our goal to bring this story to those who need it most, especially those who are all too familiar with the perils of war and the challenges of living with a disability.

Your donation will directly fund the post-production of Beat Feet, and will help Scotty's story be told across the country.

Your donation will help fund:

  • organizing and editing media into a cohesive story
  • composing original score to be used throughout the film
  • writing and recording original song to be used during the end credits
  • creating motion graphics to be used in the film
  • designing graphics for movie posters, social media, and distribution packages
  • equipment rentals for recording narration, additional interviews, etc.

All proceeds over and above the cost of post-production will go to organizations that help military veterans and their families.


Connect

Thank you so much for supporting our campaign and bringing this inspiring true story to life.  Please connect and share with us on social media as we near our distribution date!

www.facebook.com/beatfeetmovie
www.twitter.com/beatfeetmovie
http://www.hopeunseen.com/

story:
About The Television Documentary Campaign Creator:


http://projectcamelotportal.com/index.php/kerry...


AND,


http://thecritical-post.com/blog/2015/02/drake-...


Television Documentary Background Story:


In 2005, while in Eastern Europe on assignment, a relative of the gatekeeper for the Howard Hughes property building vault files contacted me.


In 2012, after several years of communicating with this individual, I was invited to a remote Mormon desert ranch oasis near Area 51 in Nevada where the Howard Hughes vault files had been clandestinely moved-to for hiding prior to the gatekeeper's information that the U.S. government planned to raid and seize The Legacy business vaults and contents therein.


From 2012 through 2013, I was allowed exclusive access to a 53-foot long metal shipping container hidden in the back hills of the desert near the Utah border going through a plethora of boxes containing files that had not seen the light of day since the 20th century dating back to 1944 with even-earlier evidence surrounding secret affairs of the Howard Hughes SUMMA CORPORATION founders and associates plus secret directors of numerous other secret global financial businesses, operations and interactions with governments with private client's interests and holdings therein and abroad.


In short, a secretly nested intelligence vault the U.S. government limitedly tolerated through longtime trusted consultants because of 'who' their clients were, the amounts ( billions and trillions ) and the 'type of wealth' wielding secret power around the world.


The files contain secret foreign and domestic information surrounding notable organizations, individuals, global legacy families, their lawyers, the middlemen and government and military leaders involved with clandestine business financial transactions, secret investments, secret trading and treaties between many nations never revealed publicly.


From a private global hotel magnate's personal financials to international private banks and government national central banks, and secret international trades and Treaty agreements never publicly broadcasted or even noted in archives, this was the secret-sensitive vault of all vaults.


While these files 'do not represent everything ever deposited within the operational lifespan of the Howard Hughes property building vault', it does go above and far beyond the conceivable; containing absolutely remarkable evidence of what appears to be archeo-archaic ( possibly extraterrestrial ) technology processings involving genuine gold microfibers embedded within very old foreign parchment used for very special high-value financial instrument certificates verifiable as authentic only when 'high-intensity light' was applied; light-reactive multi-piece documents dating back to 1944 - additionally embedded within otherwise hidden symbolics akin to some sort of extraterrestrial ( E.T. ) type alien inscriptions the likes of which even unto this day cannot be duplicated by modern-man machines.


What people only 'thought' was fantasy or science-fiction displayed in the Disney film "National Treasure" comes very much alive as part of the reality displayed. No longer does this treasure trove of historical files need to remain hidden.


Being proposed is a television broadcast network series of documentary revelations surrounding these private findings with accompanying provenances supporting these secret files accompanying my analysis on all these high-quality resolution computer-scanned image documents the public has never known before about or seen; the abandoned Howard Hughes property building vault legacy files.


Color photos of the exterior and interior levels of this Howard Hughes property ultra-high security building, security area, lobby area, secure meeting rooms, executive office, multiple vault chambers, and various vaults along with some security protocol information are available for public documentary viewings.


A plethora of insider files, handwritten internal business notes, many typed and signed correspondences and replies, multiple shipping invoices, transcribed phone conversations, foreign and domestic operational detailed instructions and executive travel itineraries, passports, identification cards, memorandums, and much-much more are included in-addition to much of the missing financial links for former Philippines President Ferdinand Edralin Marcos, former Indonesia President Dr. Soekarno, and many-many other notable persons and international banks in history around the world.

About Unwanted Publicity Guy

by, Kerry Cassidy


November 13, 2013


"The Unwanted Publicity Intelligence Guy


For more than 40-years Paul Collin was active in global intelligence matters.


In 1968, he began performing independent research leading to communicating with a secret Jesuit research facility in the San Francisco Bay area surrounding an offshore energy platform program involving strategic copper mines being bought up by oil companies to corner global markets on free solar energy generating stations.


In 1971, as a Viet Nam war-time era full-time employee of the U.S.

Department of Defense as a CIA attaché Intelligence Operations Specialist.


For the last 15-years, Mr. Collin created and maintained a global mini-intelligence network, including websites publishing special reports, displaying supportive image documents and photos previously unavailable to the general public and in some cases not governments either.


Clients and credits came from a major U.S. cable ( CNBC ) television show ( American Greed ) Kurtis Productions Ltd. ( Chicago, IL, USA - owned by Bill Kurtis, former CBS Morning News anchor man ), several international entities, certain private entities, plus federal government officials.


Others, found utilizing Mr. Collin's workproducts, included an active foreign ( Canada ) military ( Air Force ) high-ranking ( commander ) official, a former foreign nation ( Jordan ) prime minister ( former chief general of national intelligence and later later global multinational bank magnate ), and according to WikiLeaks recently ( 2012 ) implicated in correspondence with at-least one U.S. federal government contractor involved with the international defense security organization STRATFOR.


A few investigative journalists, foreign news reporters and authors ( e.g. Peter Dale Scott, et al. ) commented about Mr. Collin's intelligence workproducts or made footnote mentions of such in their own articles, reports, and / or books.


Perspectives on global  intelligence matters shifted for many so, today Mr. Collin's website "Kentron Intellect Research Vault" [ https://KentronIntellectResearchVault.WordPress... ] reflects 'public interest intelligence' on more pressing matters; many, coming from beneath the ground to the sky and beyond the stars.


Click here to read some of the Unwanted Publicity Guy's Blog [ http://www.projectcamelotvnetwork.org/blogs/unw... ]

The information is extremely voluminous and awaiting funding through The Unwanted Publicity Guy so everything 'without fear of duplication' can be properly displayed publicly for everyone to be able to discover more than they will ever be able to read non-stop in 3-years; there are millions of file pages of image documents consisting of official and private letters, official and private documents, private photographs, microfilm, maps, and communication transcripts for review.


Just as soon as the infrastructure can be funded to build a secure public platform, all will be lain before the people of the world to decide precisely what is befalling them from anyone publicly claiming to hold control over any such high-value assets ( billions or trillions ), which can be proven they do 'not'..."

There are less than a half-dozen people I personally know whom are somewhat familiar with my research last year ( 2013 ) near Area 51 in the Nevada desert, but had it not been for my conversation with one ( 1 ) man holding White House ties with China and its archeohistoricals I would never have understood the value and risk of what I accidentally discovered.


What I was looking at, with the my human naked-eye, only became visible on computer magnification after high-resolution scanning very old image documents of a United States Bank within a rare custom made book brought from China, along with several sealed dark brown burlap folded bundles of documents transported by nine ( 9 ) agents from Korea to the United States where for a short time all was deposited into the basement vault of "The Legacy" building.


Although the sealed burlap bundled documents were later transported back to the Far East, the accompanying rare custom book along with highly specific instructions - for 'how to specifically arrange the documents for viewing to verify' content imageries - was accidentally left behind.


Shortly before, the building was abandoned, all the remaining documents were inconspiciously transported to a remote ranch where they were locked-up in a 53-foot long roll-on/roll-off ( ro-ro ) shipping container where they remained sealed in plastic containers for almost 15-years until I opened all of them up and began my research on the entire remaining vault file contents.


Details of precisely what I researched and later discovered even-more about will eventually be revealed in one of several of my upcoming Disclosure Project reports..."

story:
Treading Yesterday Trailer


The Project

If there were a way to go back and correct the one thing you've come to regret most in life, would you, could you, should you?  Eric's already decided, he just didn't tell anyone.

SOMEWHERE IN TIME meets QUEER AS FOLK in TREADING YESTERDAY, a dramatic TV series.

TREADING YESTERDAY plays out through a multi-decade storytelling witnessed through the eyes of Eric, a soon to be middle aged gay man, who has lived what appears to be a charmed life.  The pilot episode opens as  a present day drama however by midpoint the timeline resets to 1988, in a historical fiction format, during a period in time when monumental anti-gay backlash had been orchestrated.

As the series evolves, viewers will experience  life's triumphs and setbacks as Eric attempts to resolve his life's single greatest regret with the support of his friends, finding new meaning in life and appreciation for that which is, rather than, what could have been.

TREADING YESTERDAY juxtaposes 1988's intolerance of Gays with present day acceptance while at the same time revealing the inherent challenges existing in both environments.

What We Need

Put simply, we need your help to continue. Whatever you can pledge to our Indiegogo campaign will go to completing our first season of 8 episodes.

What will we do with money raised?

We expect that our future expenses will mirror those incurred during the filming of episodes 1 & 2 which broke down like this:

  • 21% went to actors’ pay and benefits
  • 20% to wardrobe, supplies, studio and space rental
  • 48% to production, including the camera, lighting, set design and production organizing crew
  • 11% went to promotion, advertising and legal.

Independent film making is important. It is one of the very few vehicles that we have by which we are able to tell our story in an unfiltered way and in our own words.

If you have any doubt about the importance of such work in affirming our community, just take a moment and consider the recent repeal of LGBT rights that occurred just a few weeks ago in our nations 4th largest city (link to story here).

The struggle is far from over and we need your help in creating and providing LGBT programming in support of our community.


Please help spread the word that episodes 1 & 2 will begin airing on Vimeo on December 6th 2015!

story:
A surrealist film that explores two lover’s deepest imagination in a race against time to salvage one last adventure together, before finally being separated.

With two little blue pills and one last day together, Noah and Oliver travel the distance jaunting side by side in a series of psychedelic projections that intertwine their bond into an unbreakable knot. The day washes away with the rain and with it comes time for Noah to leave.


                                         

Claire Woolner | Noah

                                                  

Claire Woolner is an up-and-coming actress with extensive background in theater, performing in close to a dozen theater productions. Training includes improv at the Upright Citizen’s Brigade, dance at Bard College, and screen acting with Brad Greenquist (“Pet Sematary” & “The Lone Ranger”.) Claire is best known for her leading role in the film ‘Midnight in a Perfect World’. 


Reyn Beeler | Oliver

                                                  

Reyn Beeler graduated Emerson College with a BFA in acting, and has an extensive background in theater as well. He has performed in a dozen theater productions. Skills includes stage combat and various whistling techniques. Reyn is best known for his performances as David in the film ‘Daddy’, Mason in his own film ‘Mutability’, and Will in ‘Sleeping Alone’.


                            

Sherouk Hasan | Director & Writer

                                            

Sherouk Hasan is an emerging experimental filmmaker based out of LA. Her titles have included films she’s done abroad while living in the Middle East, and over the course of one year, Sherouk has written 4 films. ‘Roxanne’, directed by Victoria Innocenzi, which has just wrapped post and ‘In Transit’, which won her first place at the Screenwriter’s Competition at Columbia College Hollywood. Sherouk has collaborated alongside LA-based choreographer Lorenzo Hanna for her thesis film ‘Tusk: The Ritual’, a high-intensity, tribal-themed music video. ‘August or June’ will serve to broaden her variety of films, delving into the surrealist mind and art film genre.

Nicole Holmes | Producer

                                       


Nicole Holmes comes from over twenty years of theater experience before transitioning into film. In the span of two years, she's produced close to a dozen films. Her most recent productions include "Quench: The Music Experience" and "Baby, Baby". Nicole has worked with named talent, such as, Shanti Lowry (The Game), Chris Salvatore (Eating Out) and music artist, Asher Roth. Previous accomplishments include, "Official Selection" for her short film, "Keepsake" and Horizon-award participant for her film "Curtain Call".


Josh Campbell | Director of Photography

                                        


Josh Campbell is an experimental cinematographer with a large list of short films titles such as "Roxanne", "Lost", and "Baby, Baby." His most recent production "Quench: The Music Experiment" was produced alongside Nicole Holmes.  More of his work can be found on his reel (link below):

https://vimeo.com/136358706.


                    

We are very independent, stemming right out of film school. Funding would help us tremendously to compose our vision in these directions:


          


                              

Any and all donations will aid us in accomplishing our vision.

Find us on Facebook and connect with us to keep up-to-date with our progress!

Facebook: facebook.com/AugustorJune


Reaching our goal will certainly allow us to have everything we need to produce this film.  However, even when we do reach our goal, our dream doesn't stop there. We hope to take 'August or June' out into the festival circuit internationally. Any contribution to get the word out there will definitely help the push. 

Please share us and help us meet our goal, and beyond that.We’ll all we can to make this film come about. 

We strive for honest, artistic integrity to create this great story for entertainment.

Sincerely,

story:
Summary

The Time is Now: Portland will shine on the Big Screen!

Hello, My name is Kristen Kingsbury. 

I moved to Portland from NY in 2006 to work on the Academy Award Nominated Feature,"Coraline". It was the perfect opportunity to learn everything about production and story and to do so under the wing of some of the world's greatest. I also discovered a passion for interviewing people when I met my Oregon native husband, Pippin, who has been a videographer for 20 years. This type of storytelling never existed in me anywhere else and the reason is simple: The people in Portland are fascinating to talk to and learn from. Their personalities and what they're talking about, when combined, is pure art.

Enough About Me, just who is this BING SHELDON ?

When Pippin and I met Bing, what was supposed to be a 30-minute interview turned into something so much more. Three hours later, and on the second floor at his modest desk at SERA Architects, our camera was still rolling as the 81-year old Portland icon poured over details about what this "village" of Portland was like when he arrived from Copenhagen in the 1960's. Towards the end of this interview was when we discovered that our City was sitting on a gold mine; a wealth of stories that described how we got to be so awesome--and that it has never been eloquently told as a feature on this platform.

Fast Forward to Now.

Everyone knows what a hot topic our city is today and that frequent comparisons are running up and down the West Coast. The changes to the Portland we know feels more like sand slipping through our fingers and at this rate, we're afraid we'll all be staring at our empty hands after it's run it's course. We described this feeling to Bing and asked him what could be done about it. His answer: "This city was actively run by the people before. Now is the time to get back to it."

But We Don't Want to Live in the Past, This is About the Future!

While our film promises to deliver those beautiful stories in the voices that are still around to tell them, we also feel it's responsible to respond to the recent high-impact emotional twist that has lodged itself into this story: What about the now? What about the future? Is what's being designed for us even good enough? How do we have more say in what our city becomes?

Portland Was Once a Guinea Pig, Nourished with a (grass-fed) Radical Sense of Self.

Your contribution will turn national and international attention to the problems that cities are facing everywhere, but with Portland as the winning example. Half a century ago, our city went left when everyone else turned right. This social impact film will remind us to put our values to the test again, and put an end to the threat of Portland's well-being.

What We Need & What You Get

Lights, Camera, Action!

We're ready to get started. The script is developed and we want to assemble our production team. Our funding will determine how cinematic our story can become and the higher the quality, the bigger the stage. While our target for production is $250,000, we're after obtaining $15,000 to start so we can add more fuel to the fire of this production. Simply put, we need to market this smartly to ensure the rest of funds raised will not go towards hindsight.  The most successful films are the ones that have used every opportunity possible for pre-production planning and that includes leading with image. Other funds will go towards employing a highly talented Oregon production crew (pictured above is Portlandia Producer, David Cress who has donated SO MUCH of his time to this already), for graphics and music scoring, as well as renting camera equipment and purchasing things such as hardware for adequate storage. We also need to pay for the perks we promise, pay taxes on what we raise and allow IndieGoGo their piece of the pie for providing their platform. If we can double the $250k production goal, we'll be able to open this film with the most captivating intro ever known to documentary film. 

That's a promise! 

Sounds Fun, What Do I Get for Helping?

I'm so glad you asked. We'll offer limited run Portland Inc T-Shirts and Hoodies, DVDs, invites to private screenings and premiere parties--after all--This is Portland, we want to meet you, hear from you and toast with you!

What else can you do to offer MORE OF PORTLAND as a gift for my support?

Everyone knows how talented our community of local makers are here. That's why we've teamed up and created perks that support their craft so that we can offer a real slice of Portland as a gift. Thoughtfully designed themed necklaces, block printed canvas bags, and other items will be available as our way of saying thanks while supporting our local artists.

A Contest?

We're working on putting out a contest call for cover art appropriate to the theme of the film. We'll offer posters of the winner, voted by you! There's room for runners up as well. Stay tuned for details.

Strength in numbers.

If we don't reach the ceiling, we're prepared to make this film on a shoestring. However, we feel that our city and it's accompanying challenges deserve our very best --which includes surrounding this project with Oregon based talent so it can stand confidently on a platform for the world to see. Your support will strengthen it's success for high quality immensely.


The Impact

Why Feature Film?

We've toyed with the idea of creating a small-scale series. But we think that because of Portland, we can do better and would like to offer more than a tripod-based-90-minute-video of talking heads. I'm not sure I could even make it through that type of film. So let's get creative and make something we'd LOVE to see up on the big screen!

This is a social impact film. We want to really shine a spotlight on the national and international stage. We want to inspire other cities to look within; That an active citizenry is essential to making every city thrive. We've lead those efforts in the recent past and we can continue to do that now. There's no better medium than film to show how.

Film is Critical to Our Economy.

Being a contributor on this film is the same as showing Portland how much you care for it's well-being. You support the environment by using re-usable bags at the grocery store, by commuting alternatively, by standing on the docks united for "Shell-no". You support our local economy by purchasing farm-fresh produce at your neighborhood farmers market, by purchasing gifts at the Saturday market, by shopping at your local small businesses. I've seen you around town, volunteering your time, giving your last few dollars to someone that needs it more than you, and always meeting new people for opportunities to discuss your passion and collaborative ideas. I'm asking you to do the same here. Doing so will create a ripple effect that will benefit the rest of Portland and create more opportunity to show how much you care.

I've already mentioned my feature credentials. I'd like to add that our film network is vast and incredibly supportive of this film. Our recent projects include Volunteer Firefighter promo material, commercials and creating free video resources for blended and step-families, to name a few. I've also written a feature length thriller and several short scripts. In addition, this documentary became the catalyst for a Re:Think Portland Leadership Conference that aims to influence active grassroots community participation...for ALL.

Risks & Challenges

Swimming in Shark Infested Waters...Come on in, The Water's Fine!

Filmmaking is always risky. It is impossible to give 100% of your audience a warm fuzzy feeling. Our sole objective is to tell the story of Portland in the best way possible; which will definitely excite, anger and entertain. There is a possibility that we will barely reach our goal and will tell this story from the confines of our tiny equipment. There is a possibility that we won't be able to tell the Portland that you know to be true, that segments you think are important will not be included but we promise not to mishandle information. We also promise to adequately represent all sides as best as we can. This is why your support in the process of making this film is so critical. We'll post behind-the-scenes segments, regular updates and expect to hear from you along the way.

We've put this campaign off for awhile. Mostly because we were fearful of being the recipient of cutting comments and of course, failing to raise the kind of funds that we feel are important. Putting ourselves out there like this is a little distressing, but as I've said in the video, it's far less cumbersome than the feeling of regret.

Best case vs. worst case scenario.

The worst possible outcome is a micro-budget documentary made with our meek Canon 60D, some lights and crafty paper animation. The best case scenario includes an out-of-this-world intro and a high quality piece of art surrounded by Oregon talent (read: we love supporting other creatives and what better way to do so than to give them a job, some credit and more experience that they needn't travel to Hollywood for?) plus a Portland-centric premiere.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, that is OK!  The Portland way is also about donating time instead of funds. We place high value on your participation in spreading the word through your own network. Please utilize the Share tools from IndieGoGo to create the biggest splash.


Thanks so much for being a part of this community and for not giving up!
story_txt:
Summary

The Time is Now: Portland will shine on the Big Screen!

 Hello, My name is Kristen Kingsbury. 
I moved to Portland from NY in 2006 to work on the Academy Award Nominated Feature,"Coraline". It was the perfect opportunity to learn everything about production and story and to do so under the wing of some of the world's greatest. I also discovered a passion for interviewing people when I met my Oregon native husband, Pippin, who has been a videographer for 20 years. This type of storytelling never existed in me anywhere else and the reason is simple: The people in Portland are fascinating to talk to and learn from. Their personalities and what they're talking about, when combined, is pure art.
Enough About Me, just who is this BING SHELDON ?


When Pippin and I met Bing, what was supposed to be a 30-minute interview turned into something so much more. Three hours later, and on the second floor at his modest desk at SERA Architects, our camera was still rolling as the 81-year old Portland icon poured over details about what this "village" of Portland was like when he arrived from Copenhagen in the 1960's. Towards the end of this interview was when we discovered that our City was sitting on a gold mine; a wealth of stories that described how we got to be so awesome--and that it has never been eloquently told as a feature on this platform.
Fast Forward to Now.
Everyone knows what a hot topic our city is today and that frequent comparisons are running up and down the West Coast. The changes to the Portland we know feels more like sand slipping through our fingers and at this rate, we're afraid we'll all be staring at our empty hands after it's run it's course. We described this feeling to Bing and asked him what could be done about it. His answer: "This city was actively run by the people before. Now is the time to get back to it."
But We Don't Want to Live in the Past, This is About the Future!
While our film promises to deliver those beautiful stories in the voices that are still around to tell them, we also feel it's responsible to respond to the recent high-impact emotional twist that has lodged itself into this story: What about the now? What about the future? Is what's being designed for us even good enough? How do we have more say in what our city becomes?
Portland Was Once a Guinea Pig, Nourished with a (grass-fed) Radical Sense of Self.
Your contribution will turn national and international attention to the problems that cities are facing everywhere, but with Portland as the winning example. Half a century ago, our city went left when everyone else turned right. This social impact film will remind us to put our values to the test again, and put an end to the threat of Portland's well-being.   What We Need & What You Get
Lights, Camera, Action!

We're ready to get started. The script is developed and we want to assemble our production team. Our funding will determine how cinematic our story can become and the higher the quality, the bigger the stage. While our target for production is $250,000, we're after obtaining $15,000 to start so we can add more fuel to the fire of this production. Simply put, we need to market this smartly to ensure the rest of funds raised will not go towards hindsight.  The most successful films are the ones that have used every opportunity possible for pre-production planning and that includes leading with image. Other funds will go towards employing a highly talented Oregon production crew (pictured above is Portlandia Producer, David Cress who has donated SO MUCH of his time to this already), for graphics and music scoring, as well as renting camera equipment and purchasing things such as hardware for adequate storage. We also need to pay for the perks we promise, pay taxes on what we raise and allow IndieGoGo their piece of the pie for providing their platform. If we can double the $250k production goal, we'll be able to open this film with the most captivating intro ever known to documentary film. 
That's a promise! 

Sounds Fun, What Do I Get for Helping?

I'm so glad you asked. We'll offer limited run Portland Inc T-Shirts and Hoodies, DVDs, invites to private screenings and premiere parties--after all--This is Portland, we want to meet you, hear from you and toast with you!
What else can you do to offer MORE OF PORTLAND as a gift for my support?
Everyone knows how talented our community of local makers are here. That's why we've teamed up and created perks that support their craft so that we can offer a real slice of Portland as a gift. Thoughtfully designed themed necklaces, block printed canvas bags, and other items will be available as our way of saying thanks while supporting our local artists.
A Contest?
We're working on putting out a contest call for cover art appropriate to the theme of the film. We'll offer posters of the winner, voted by you! There's room for runners up as well. Stay tuned for details.
Strength in numbers.
If we don't reach the ceiling, we're prepared to make this film on a shoestring. However, we feel that our city and it's accompanying challenges deserve our very best --which includes surrounding this project with Oregon based talent so it can stand confidently on a platform for the world to see. Your support will strengthen it's success for high quality immensely.

I've seen you around town, volunteering your time, giving your last few dollars to someone that needs it more than you, and always meeting new people for opportunities to discuss your passion and collaborative ideas. I'm asking you to do the same here. Doing so will create a ripple effect that will benefit the rest of Portland and create more opportunity to show how much you care.

story:
We (Zoe, Gavin and Marcus) run a small Production Company (called Infinite Film) we specialise in music videos and commercials and corporates but are desperate to follow our dreams and make our own work,  more narrative, filmy work (ie feature films)... This is a step in that direction...

The short film, Here Comes The Sun, is completely prepped and ready to go - in fact we begin shooting on the 7th April (for three nights). 

The film follows the final night of work for an asthmatic prostitute. A dark comedy, starring Roxanne Gregory as 'Sarah' and Ewen MacIntosh  as 'Darren'.

We are so close to reaching the budget, it is the finishing touches that we are now struggling to cover, the things which will allow us to take the film to the next level.    

Your help, any help, will help us, help finish the film. Help...

story:
Dark Spirit Films needs your help to make the feature 80's style dark fantasy/horror film, Beyond Hell. The film is in post production and your support will determine the quality of the final film.


We still have a lot of work to do, but here is your first look at what's coming for Beyond Hell.



Maryssa seemingly has the perfect life, however her "Leave it to Beaver" lifestyle is a prison she wants to escape. After trying a new version of the drug changa with friends, Maryssa finds herself transported to a hell dimension where the demon, Belial, latches on to her. Using Maryssa as a tether to our world, Belial begins killing her friends one by one in horrific hallucinations. Maryssa and her surviving friends must find a way to stop him before he is freed and brings hell to earth.



Alan Murray, the Director/Creator of Beyond Hell has always had a passion for horror. Inspired by his favorite horror films, including Nightmare on Elm street and Hellraiser, his vision was to bring some of these forgotten stylistic elements back into the horror genre. He has seen this project come full circle through much hard work and determination and will likely be involved in most of the post production as well due to his background in digital animation.


Gavin Downes, the Co-producer and Actor playing Belial in Beyond Hell, was first cast as the creature before the film had been fully written. Gavin has been with this project since day one . Alongside Alan he has ensured that it captured the 80's style horror ambiance that the two had envisioned since the beginning.


Kat Murray, Production Manager and Author of the Beyond Hell novel has been alongside for the entire Beyond Hell ride. Multi-tasking everything from Craft and Wardrobe to Production Management and the conversion of the original script into a novel. Kat is known for her Chronicles of Hart series and she brings a love of plots and literature to the project, ensuring that the novel and movie captured the same stylistic elements.


We have some fantastic perks to offer for your support, take a look at them on the side bar right there. In addition, we will be offering SECRET PERKS, these perks will be hidden on our website beyondhellfilm.com , search for the link and check them out. But just to keep you on your toes we will be moving the link on our website weekly, changing the secret perks and all around keeping you guessing. Have fun.

Here are a few examples of Beyond Hell merch that we have to offer. (Note: colors and style are subject to change)

                        



Since the film has already been shot, we are looking to create a polished film in post production. How funds will be used:
- Sound (40%)
- Special effects (40%)
- To pay for professional editors (10%)
- For insert shots to improve the quality of the film (10%)



With Beyond Hell already in post production, you can rest assured that the film is past its biggest hurdle. Beyond Hell was filmed in 5k RAW on a RED DRAGON and is the first in a multi book/film franchise. The success of this Indiegogo campaign will determine the quality of the final project. But to be honest, the film is going to be finished anyway. With your help we can ensure that it makes its mark in the best way possible. Without you, we are on our own.


Throughout our campaign we will be uploading new behind the scenes, interviews, sneak peeks and concept art for Beyond Hell. Be sure to check back weekly for updates. The full campaign calendar will be announced soon!


Don't forget that you can help us by sharing our campaign with your friends and family, every little bit helps.

Thank you for checking out our campaign,

Team Dark Spirit Films

story:
Short Summary

Wardens: When Night Falls is the second season of the Wardens webseries which began last year with the release of Wardens: Dark Conspiracy. It is produced by DaurSoul Productions. A team of fantasy writers, stage combat sword fighters, and professional make-up artists. 

The Wardens series features professionally choreographed sword fighting sequences, expertly designed character make-ups, and a mix of practical and digital effects.

When Night Falls follows the story of Dusk, an unseelie fae, as he searches for the remnants of an artifact made by his people and stolen from them long ago. The Beginning, an item with the power to create absolutely anything its wielder's heart desires. But power comes at a price, and once the artifact is awakened, there may be no one in all the world who can stop it.

Our second season is on track to be a much bigger and better production, and we need your help to make this vision a reality!

What We Need & What You Get

The Wardens series is known for being very makeup and effects intensive, as such we are asking for funds in order to afford the various makeup wardrobe and practical effects needed to make this season the best it can be.

Backers will receive several perks ranging from special thanks in the credits all the way up to behind the scenes bonus content or a tour of a working set depending on the size of the donation!

In the event that we do not raise the full amount of our funding filming will continue, but we will not be able to pull off some of the various effects needed to create our full vision.

The Impact

With every successful season, the Wardens series continues on to get bigger and better! With full funding we will be able to make Season 2 everything it should be and continue on to make an even better third season in the future.

Our experience with filming season one has made us better producers and filmmakers, as we go on the content we produce will only go upwards.

We can not achieve this without your help! Every donation, no matter how small, is greatly appreciated.

Risks & Challenges

Filming anything has inherent risks, the most obvious being going over-budget and behind schedule. Our experiences with our first season of Wardens and working on several other projects has put us in a unique position to be able to anticipate these issues and work around them as they arise.

Obviously, funding helps a great deal in overcoming these potential problems.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you'd like to help, but aren't able to contribute, spreading the word is the best kind of help we can get!

Taking the time to share our crowdfunding campaign on social media is always helpful to allow us to reach a larger audience. You can also like DaurSoul Productions on Facebook and follow our production as it happens!

story:
Short Summary

History Speaks is a feature length documentary about the World War II generation. We set out to capture many different stories from that era.  Not only from the veterans who served in the military but also those who supported the war effort on the home front. Once the interviews were set, we began with the same question:  "Where were you on December 7th, 1941?"

Why These Stories?

On the weekend of the 60th anniversary of the attack on Pearl Harbor, History Speaks Producer Susan Cummings was in Hawaii.  During her visit she noticed a number of WWII veterans wearing the easily recognizable caps displaying the name of the vessels on which they served.  She also noticed the number of people surrounding them – strangers mostly – listening to their stories of service in the war and survival of the attack in the harbor. 

Later, during a visit to the memorial, Susan sat next to a gentleman who began to tell her of his experience on the morning of December 7th, 1941.  He was completely lost in his memory of that day.  Susan left the memorial realizing there were many other first person accounts of this remarkable generation that deserved to be heard.

"My father was in the war”, says Producer Shari Doran.  “I thought a wonderful way to honor him and all who served would be to hear their stories and share them with future generations. I am constantly amazed at how this documentary connects with people.  I can talk about this project anywhere and have people excited to share their own stories of family and friends who experienced the war.”

And that brings us to this fundraising page.  We at Pony Tale Films invite you to join us as we complete our documentary about these heroic men and women by contributing to HISTORY SPEAKS here on Indiegogo!

What We Need & What You Get

We have completed shooting our interviews and we already have a rough cut of the film.  Your contributions to the film will allow us to do the following “post production” activities that will complete our project:

•  Complete final film edit including the final audio mix and color correction.

•  Purchase and / or license stock footage and music

•  Graphic design services for marketing tools that will enable us to enter film festivals and submit for broadcast and / or distribution. 

The Impact

As daughters of World War II veterans we feel very strongly about capturing these stories for future generations.  We know how we have been changed by meeting and speaking with these amazing people and we can not wait to introduce you to them.  Their sense of duty, loyalty, justice and responsibility are things we can all appreciate. 

Risks & Challenges

Any time you set out to make a documentary, you have to be passionate about the subject because it’s a risky proposition.  But we have the interviews and the film is nearly complete!  Any and all funds raised here will get us that much closer to completing the film!

Other Ways You Can Get Involved

There are still so many stories from this generation that remain untold. If you or a member of your family served or supported the war effort during WWII, we’d love to hear about it.  

And if you have any photos of your family members from this time and would like to share, we will try to include them in the film!

Please drop us a line on this page or via Facebook or Twitter.

film!

Please drop us a line on this page or via Facebook or Twitter.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Timothy Ray Brandon. I began writing the script for Black Widow a year ago. The video you will see on this page is the first 5 minutes of the film! This campaign is going to help the cast and crew for this film make the best possible film for you the audience. We want to make sure that we have the resources to make great film. 

We are proud of the script, the crew and the cast that we have assembled for this project. We really do feel that with the support of all of you, that we can make an intriguing film that you will enjoy. A film that you will be proud of and satisfied with your decision to help us.

What We Need & What You Get

The funds that we raise her will be used on prop purchases/rentals, cast, crew, location rentals, catering….you know, the basics!!! 

Depending on your contribution you will entitled to certain perks involved with the film, ranging from a special mention on the website of the film to your name as a producer and special contributor, being invited on set, signed photos and more.

The Impact

Your contributions will help us make a film that in the long run we want you to enjoy watching. We want you to talk about it days, weeks, months and years after you view it. We all love engaging and interesting movies that keep us entertained and our goal is to give you that.

story:
About the documentary 

The filming of this paranormal documentary about countess Elizabeth Bathory (1560-1614) started on november 2008 and ended on october 2009. We had just finished this trailer when some rushes, hundreds of hours of footage, were stolen 3 months later. They were never recovered and the producer gave up the project.
Today, after a few years of hesitation, we decided to give it a second chance and complete the documentary for a release in dvd/bluray.


What we need and why

Despite some remaining footage, we don't have any more producer so we need a minimum of funds to create a film production society, buy equipment and go on location in Slovakia for more film stock to compensate the stolen footages.
Though we should be able to manage all right with 20.000 euros, every extra contribution past our goal would help us even more to buy more and better equipment for our new Prod.

However, in the worst case scenario, the funds we will get will help us create our film production society and we will not give up our project. One day or another, ELIZABETH BATHORY, A PARANORMAL INVESTIGATION will be fully completed and released !

About the director


Born in France in 1964, Philippe R. Welté is a writer and paranormal investigator. He has always been fascinated by the unknown and unexplained phenomenas.

In 1985, he decided to visit Whitechapel, once Jack the Ripper's hunting grounds and felt the spectral presence of a young woman.
Intrigued by the mystery of this strange encounter, he decided to focus on the Whitechapel killer and his preys. A best-seller in France in 2006, his book "JACK THE RIPPER, the secret of Mary Jane K." is the result of 20 years of investigations.

Why produce Elizabeth BATHORY, A PARANORMAL INVESTIGATION ?

"Many rumors have spread about her for centuries. She was a fascinating woman, whose legend turned her into Vlad Drakul's female counterpart. I wanted to know more about her, who she really was and I knew that, as a channel, I had good chances to make a contact with her and get some answers about many mysteries surrounding her legend.

This documentary is about the truth and exposes how and why she was said to bathe in virgins blood. And much more..." (Philippe R. Welté)


Can't Contribute? You Can Still Help!

We know not everyone can contribute. If you can't financially back our documentary, we kindly ask you to please share our campaign across all of your social networks.The more people aware of our campaign, the better chances to hit our goal.

We’ve received support from many people, but their voices are not all we need. Your support for our project can and will make it work.
