story:
Imagine a world where you can stay mindful throughout your day

The MindPod Network is a collective of teachers and thought leaders and a website and podcast network dedicated to spiritual growth, community, mindfulness and balance in our everyday lives.


You are not alone on your path...

You have helped us build a podcast network that delivers weekly teachings from Ram Dass, Jack Kornfield, Sharon Salzberg, Krishna Das, Lama Surya Das and Mindrolling with David Silver and Raghu Markus. In addition, we've recently added Tara Brach, Chris Grosso and Michael Donovan with more brilliant minds joining us soon.

Thanks to you our podcasts are downloaded over 620,000 times a month and our website is visited over 130,000 times each month.

"You and I are the force for transformation in the world. We are the consciousness that will define the nature of the reality we are moving into."

- Ram Dass


Expand your consciousness with daily resources

With your help we're building a free mobile app that supports our community, provides sanctuary for the heart and serves as a connecting point for us all.

Receive instant access to guided meditations. 

We want you to be able to pick your favorite teacher(s) to walk you through the steps to find calm and balance in your day.

You'll be able to attend exclusive new courses like the "Life in Balance" course which will provide tools to change habitual patterns and transform negative thoughts and emotions.

You'll also be able to hear and experience live teachings that may not be affordable for you to travel to.

Catch immediate lessons from treasured teachers every morning when you wake up. A quick wisdom reminder to your favorite device to give you perspective as you go about your day.

Of course, you'll also have direct access to the podcasts, show notes, recommended readings, and transcripts. No more searching for a pen to write down what you just heard.



"We can travel a long way and do many things, but our deepest happiness is not born from accumulating new experiences. It is born from letting go of what is unnecessary, and knowing ourselves to be always at home."

- Sharon Salzberg


What your help will allow us to do next:

Our goal is to raise $36,000 so we can accomplish the following:

  • Develop a new and innovative MindPod Network mobile app that delivers content and connections unique to the mobile experience.
  • Create new spiritual teachings such as the "Life in Balance" audio course mentioned above.
  • Support the part-time volunteer staff that have worked hard to get MindPod Network where it is today.
  • Hire staff members to enable us to produce fresh and innovative content for the web, podcast and app environment.
  • Hire additional technical crew and equipment for webcasts, live podcasts and new content productions.
  • Purchase some technical equipment and hire editors and engineers to accommodate the creation of innovative content on new mediums.

“There are many ways up the mountain, but each of us must choose a practice that feels true to our own heart. It is not necessary for you to evaluate the practices chosen by others."

- Jack Kornfield


We are on this path with you.

Help us reveal some common sense spiritual knowledge and improve the world one connection at a time.

Please choose any pledge amount to send your message of support. 

We've also set up a variety of perks (or rewards) for various pledge amounts. Take a look below.


Perks

Thank you so much for supporting us. You are welcome to donate any amount in lieu of a perk by using the form that says "contribute now" above the perks.


For $27 you will receive:

  • 1 heavy duty canvas Be Here Now zipping tote bag! Perfect for earth friendly grocery shopping or beach days, we like to use it as a yoga bag!



    • For $54 you will receive:

    • 1 limited edition 11"x14" color poster of Ram Dass' "Grist for the Mill" book. Far out.
    • 1 audio download of the original "Be Here Now" talks from 1969 (2 hours, 15 minutes)
    • You will be personally thanked on the Mindrolling Podcast


    For $54 you will receive:

    • 1 MPN logo t-shirt (black or white) (we'll contact you within 24 hours to find out what size and color shirt you want)
    • Love Serve Remember LP set (digital audio download + liner notes) This collection was originally released as a box of LP’s and includes Ram Dass reading from the Ramayana and the Third Chinese Patriarch, taking questions on WBAI New York radio, kirtan, meditations, the Hanuman Chalisa and more. This box set has been a rare collector’s item over the years and now we are pleased to be able to present it in it’s entirety as a digital release.
    • You will be personally thank on Mindrolling Podcast




    For $108 you will receive:

    • 1 limited edition Ram Dass poster
    • 1 audio download of original "Be Here Now" audio talks
    • 1 MPN t-shirt (we'll contact you by email within 24 hours to learn what shirt size and design you want)
    • 1 copy of Krishna Das' "Laughing at the Moon" album
    • You will be personally thanked on Mindrolling Podcast


    For $280 you will receive The MindPod Network Mindfulness Kit:

    • 1 handmade wooden box from India with the following goodies:
    • MPN Meditation Collection - 90 minutes of guided meditations from different spiritual traditions featuring Ram Dass, Krishna Das, Jack Kornfield, Sharon Salzberg, Joseph Goldstein, Lama Surya Das and more.
      • 1 mala (meditation) bracelet
    • 1 Incense and holder from India
    • 1 meditation prayer shawl from India
    • 1 framed photo of Buddha and Hanuman
    • 1 copy of "The Pocket Pema Chödrön" - A book of 108 short selections for on-the-go inspiration
    • 1 copy of "The Pocket Thich Nhat Hanh"
    • You will be personally thanked on Mindrolling Podcast



    For $350 you will receive The MindPod Network Bonus Book Collection:

  • A collection of tomes written by Mindpod Network teachers, including Jack Kornfield, Sharon Salzberg, Joseph Goldstein, Krishna Das, Ram Dass, Lama Surya Das and more.
  • 1 MPN T-Shirt (we'll contact you by email within 24 hours to learn what shirt size and design you want)
  • limited edition Ram Dass poster
  • 1 audio download of original "Be Here Now" audio talks
  • 1 copy of Krishna Das' Live in NYC DVD
  • You will be personally thanked on Mindrolling Podcast


    •  



    For $855 you will receive The MindPod Network Wisdom Package:

  • This includes the MindPod Network Mindfulness Kit
  • The MindPod Network Bonus Book Collection
  • Audio downloads of Ram Dass talks "Living the Mystery" and "Who You Are (Double Album)"
  • You will be personally thanked on Mindrolling Podcast






    • “As far as I’m concerned the only thing we need to renounce is our self-hatred and judgment of ourselves, and our sense of unworthiness, and our sense that we are not worthy of love. This is where we should start. If we could just work with that place a little bit the whole quality of our lives would change.”

    —  Krishna Das



    What is our story?

    In 1968 Dr Richard Alpert returned from India as Ram Dass and through his commitment to sharing his path turned on a new generation to the spiritual wisdom of the East. From that point forward a revolution in consciousness brought together a vast and diverse spiritual community of fellow searchers on the path to inner fulfillment.

    Some of the travelers on the path met very early in those days in India and became a very close family made up of both Buddhists and Bhakti’s. It was this diversity yet singularity of purpose that led me to contemplate bringing these teachers together under one umbrella of conscious inner social action. And it was Duncan Trussell who provided the clue- podcasts!

    With the birth of Mindrolling and my partnership with David Silver, that idea grew to include our India family- Ram Dass, Sharon Salzberg, Jack Kornfield, Krishna Das and Lama Surya Das. It was that mix of devotional heart practice and the wisdom of the Buddha that is now the foundation of the Mindpod Network: a destination on multiple platforms for Heart Mind Wisdom and the practical and easy application of that wisdom for anyone at any level to connect with and utilize in their lives. 

    It is that unique blending that attracted me from the very beginning when I followed Ram Dass back to India where I first met Neem Karoli Baba and felt I had been given the tools to follow a life path of inspiration, balance and connection. And so we really have gone full circle and followed Ram Dass' example to share and carry forward our experience. It’s so very gratifying to see how quickly such a substantial community has been created in such a short time. 

    May we be blessed to have this network reach out to whomever wants to share this collective spiritual heart.

    - Raghu Markus


    What’s next?

    After you show your support today, you'll be thanked on an upcoming episode of the Mindrolling podcast.

    We'll also keep you in the loop about each exciting upgrade to the MindPod Network. You'll become a member of the exclusive first look community and be the first to learn about new offerings.


    “Learning how to love is the goal and the purpose of spiritual life - not learning how to develop psychic powers, not learning how to bow, chant, do yoga, or even meditate, but learning to love. Love is the truth. Love is the light.”

    - Lama Surya Das


    How to help

    Please choose a pledge amount and either a contribution or perk and we'll be eternally grateful.


    What happens after I pledge?

    Immediately our hearts will be warmed by your support. 
    Then within 2-4 weeks your products will ship. Any digital products will be delivered by email within 24 hours. Later on we'll email you about which episode of the Mindrolling Podcast you will be thanked on.
    If you select a perk with a t-shirt we'll contact you by email within 24 hours to learn what shirt size and design you want. 



    Other Ways You Can Help


    Contributions are great, but you can also help by spreading the message.

    Any of the below will assist us getting the word out:

    1. "Share" our campaign on your Facebook wall and Twitter, asking people to support us and "Like" our campaign.  

    2. Email this campaign to your friends, family, satsang, sangha, colleagues, and networks.

      3.   Leave a “Comment” and tell us what you think of what we're doing!

story:
We are a small community in Vancouver dedicated to bringing you the finest in trashy entertainment. Fleisch Maschine Productions in association with Polychromatic Cat are coming at you live from a dumpster in Vancouver!

GorePoolooza started as a random birthday party idea. Get drunk and wrestle in a pool of blood. The first one was a hit, and it evolved and grew from there. Now we want to take it to the next level!


We have secured a space, and in August 2015 the battle is on!

We have changed the date from June to August 15. There will be a sign up event and potentially a few small battles before then, and plenty of videos to come. More on this as updates happen.

For anyone wanting a DVD/Blu Ray, these will sent out after the main event and will contain all Gorepoolooza footage up to and including the main event. Thank you for your patience.

This year we want to expand and get some shiney big production value for our videos, and do a live webcast of the event.

We need funds for:

Blood. We need an animal free, hypoallergenic, non-burning solution. We are testing a few options, starting with this:

http://www.amazon.com/Jorvet-J0109-J-Lube-Obstetrics-10-Ounce/dp/B006G2S17A

The second ingredient is hobo blood. Or Kool Aid powder.

New Pools. We want to have 2-3 rings so we can prep one while the other is in use.

We also need equipment, specifically a basic PA system, and upgrades to our camera rigs.

GoPro headband mount and chest mount.

Wifi camera shoe to broadcast footage

Costumes

Booze

story:
Hnifur is a visual, compelling and dynamic film.  Exploring unique ways of story telling it confronts  a woman's fear of knives. 

Hnifur begins in a hospital room and then flashes backwards in time.   We learn of a  woman's fear; a childhood scar, its manifestation, her terror, her isolation, and overwhelming fear of knives.

Her husband's frequent travels leave her home alone. The moment he departs, she races to the kitchen and separately wraps all the knives and then stashes them in different places in the house. 

Her fear escalates when she discovers a missing  knife. Despite a frantic search, the knife is nowhere to be found. 

On this stormy night, her husband Skypes to tell her he has arrived safely. However, before he can say much, there is a knock on his door. Their phone connection becomes more and more erratic.  Unable to understand what is happening in his hotel room, she hears shouting and cries for help. Helpless, all she can do is listen.  Then, there it is -- frozen in the middle of the Skype frame. The missing knife, unwrapped and laying on top of his suitcase.

Her past rushes and flashes before her. Taking her back to a day when she was a child hunting with her grandfather. A tragic occurrence in the woods -- an event that haunts her for the rest of her life. 

As a rush of labour pains set in, she thinks she sees the animal waiting for her. It has come to seek its revenge on her and her unborn baby.



Your participation will make our film and dream a reality. There is no other way around it. We want to tell a story, send a message, create a wonderful piece of art. And with your help we can!
Bella Monticelli, is one of ten female directors chosen by AFI to participate in the Directing Workshop For Women. AFI is providing her the tools to make this amazing film.

The AFI Directing Workshop for Women sets a budget limit of $30,000 to finance the film. With your support, we will be able to achieve our goal to make Hnifur a living breathing film. 

"Set me a challenge based on your fears - be creative, have a laugh and I will send you a video of me living through what you FEAR most".

                                                                                              - Bella Monticelli, Director of Hnifur

(From Bella our director) There is very little I will not do to make this incredible project come to fruition, as I believe in its integrity, its message, its purpose, and need your help to make it a reality. 

From sharing our behind the scenes bloopers and goof offs, to watching me suffer in pursuit of the cause -- I want you to be a part of it through my "Fear Challenge Videos,"  all of which is designed to prove my commitment to Hnifur.

Trust me, I will beg, borrow and steal where I can but there are not many animal wranglers that understand "Favours" (get your mind out of the gutter).

In addition to joining our team, your donation will help in increase the number of women directors, leading roles for women and helping to keep Independent Cinema alive and thriving!


Your contributions help to feed our crew (I am Italian and Jewish deal with it- a well looked after crew is a happy one) insurance, location fees, permitting, paying cast and crew, post production, session musicians (for the incredible soundtrack), visual effects, sound design, production design and many more extraneous costs that come with making a movie of any length.

Most importantly you are doing a beautiful thing - you are contributing to an artwork - a creative piece that has no bottom line, no branded content. And your contribution goes to AFI, an educational non-profit,  eligible for a tax deduction!

Other Ways to Participate

Even if you can't make a monetary contribution, we hope you will still join our team.

You can:

  • Make some noise and share our campaign our Indiegogo campaign with your friends and family.
  • Visit, like, follow our Facebook page.
  • Provide in-kind donations of equipment, hard drives, goods and services, food, and beverage.
  • Or any other ideas you may have for us, please please please send them our way!

BELLA MONTICELLI (DIRECTOR)

Born in Australia, raised between Sydney, Australia,  Wyoming, USA and educated in London, UK, Bella Monticelli is a writer/director residing in Los Angeles. After studying Fine Art at Central St Martin's she went on to direct "Live From Abbey Road" on Channel 4 for 5 years. Working with incredible artists such as The Killers, Green Day, Brian Wilson, Mary J Blige, James Blake and over 200 others, for an uncool person she sure met a lot of them.

She went on to direct music videos, fashion films and now commercials with Pretty Bird here in the US. Her Tom Odell "Another Love"  has been viewed over 67 million times on YouTube and counting.

In 2013, she directed her first narrative short film "Shall We Try Again"  and with your help "Hnifur" will be her second. 

Her incredible mentors include Jane Campion (The Piano, Bright Star), Michael Winterbottom (24 Hour Party People, The Trip, The Trip to Italy), Daniel Barber (The Keeping Room, Harry Brown) and Steve Jacobs (Disgrace) - all people she has been lucky enough to work with and learn from.

BORA KIM (CINEMATOGRAPHER)

Originally from Seoul, this coffeeholic found her interest in cinema in her early 20s watching European and Japanese films. She admires the works of Jiří Menzel and Lee Chang Dong for their keen insight about human nature and realistic directing styles. 

Bora is a great believer in invisible and authentic camera work. She started her career as camera assistant for three motion pictures in Korean film industry, 2005-2007 and intensively started learning cinematography at Korean Academy of Film Arts. She’s been expanded her experience and knowledge for 10 years by shooting various short films and animation. Confession (2010) and Squid (2013) screened in major film festivals in South Korean and The House (2010), a featured animation, was invited in Anncey international animated film festival. 

She was the 1st Unit DP for 'Canimals', children's animated TV series co-produced by Voozclub, BRB, and Aardman, broadcasting world-widely. Currently, she is on the last semester of her MFA program in Cinematography at the American Film Institute Conservatory and looking forward to expanding her collaboration with great narrative storytellers in Los Angeles.

KEN MORRIS (PRODUCER)

How do we change the world? By changing the way we see it. In all that he does, this is what motivates Ken Morris the most. A storyteller from a young age, Ken developed his passion for cinema in college, producing his first feature, ZOMBIE LOVE, as a senior thesis project. Ken produced his second feature, OBSELIDIA, the very next year. It premiered at the 2010 Sundance Film Festival and is currently available online. Ken loves working with artists who challenge the fundamentals of storytelling and seek new and innovative ways to connect with the audience.


THANK YOU SO SO SO MUCH - It takes a village to make a movie and we are honored to have you join ours!
story_txt:
Hnifur is a visual, compelling and dynamic film.  Exploring unique ways of story telling it confronts  a woman's fear of knives. 



Hnifur begins in a hospital room and then flashes backwards in time.   We learn of a  woman's fear; a childhood scar, its manifestation, her terror, her isolation, and overwhelming fear of knives.
Her husband's frequent travels leave her home alone. The moment he departs, she races to the kitchen and separately wraps all the knives and then stashes them in different places in the house. 
Her fear escalates when she discovers a missing  knife. Despite a frantic search, the knife is nowhere to be found. 
On this stormy night, her husband Skypes to tell her he has arrived safely. However, before he can say much, there is a knock on his door. Their phone connection becomes more and more erratic.  Unable to understand what is happening in his hotel room, she hears shouting and cries for help. Helpless, all she can do is listen.  Then, there it is -- frozen in the middle of the Skype frame. The missing knife, unwrapped and laying on top of his suitcase.
Her past rushes and flashes before her. Taking her back to a day when she was a child hunting with her grandfather. A tragic occurrence in the woods -- an event that haunts her for the rest of her life. 
As a rush of labour pains set in, she thinks she sees the animal waiting for her. It has come to seek its revenge on her and her unborn baby.






Your participation will make our film and dream a reality. There is no other way around it. We want to tell a story, send a message, create a wonderful piece of art. story:
Birthday Party Fun!

Sweet Celebrations is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization that provides birthday parties for homeless children.  Each birthday child receives a personalized birthday cake, Baskin Robbins ice cream, a personalized birthday shirt, birthday games to fit the theme and age of the child, a “Build a Bear,” and a few other gifts.  In addition, each child receives a framed picture of his or her party! 


How you can help!

The cost of each party is $100; we need to raise $30,000 in order to provide our goal of 300 birthday parties this year.  Please help by sponsoring game supplies, sponsoring a cake, sponsoring birthday gifts, or sponsoring the ENTIRE PARTY!

-  A donation of $20 sponsors all the party supplies needed for one party. We will send you a picture of the birthday child you sponsored.

-  A donation of $30 sponsors the cake. We will send you a picture of the birthday child and the cake you sponsored.

-  A donation of $50 sponsors the birthday gifts for one party. We will send you a video of the birthday child opening his or her gifts.

-  A donation of $100 sponsors the ENTIRE PARTY. We will send you a picture of the birthday child with his or her cake, a video of him or her opening gifts, and a personalized thank you card from the birthday child.  

  

Little Celebrations, Big Impact

We have celebrated hundreds of birthdays and created thousands of smiles, but there are some that really show the BIG IMPACT we can make in a child’s life.  Recently, we celebrated a young man's birthday who had never celebrated his birthday.  This young man enjoyed the games and was excited to see the birthday cake with lighted candles. As the lights were dimmed, David* began to cry. For the first time he felt love; for the first time he felt compassion; for the first time he was able to make a birthday wish! As the cake was being cut, David quickly began washing off the decorations from the cake to save as keepsakes. He said that he wanted to treasure every minute of the best birthday ever. David was 20 years old that day. To many, birthdays are expected; to some a birthday is just another day. Sweet Celebrations is more than a party; it is understanding; it is love, and it is joy. We provide Little Celebrations with a Big Impact.  With your help, we can create many more smiles and literally change more lives.

* Real name not provided to ensure privacy.


Don't Forget!

  • Please share with your friends and family
  • Visit our website and sign up for our monthly newsletter to see all the fun we are having: http://sweet-celebrations.org/contact-us

story:
The descendants of the extinct dinosaurs fight for their survival. With the help of an elite team located at the most Southern part of Africa - South Africa;  Danny and co fight off the Rhino Horn hungry and greedy poachers and smugglers. Their dedication to saving the dying breed of Rhino's, the last of it's kind on the planet; is overwhelming.  Danny's strength and courage goes a long way, allowing her to overcome past disappointment and heartache all around as she moves forward strongly in support of the greatest cause known today!

A water prison off the east coast of South Africa becomes her focal point of interest as prisoners are used to chop up unseaworthy vessels to be sold as scrap metal.  Thus providing funds for the increasing the protection of our Rhino's.

Prisoner teams are escorted inland to assist in completion of a Tornado wall, an experimental government project for the Tornado Alley that runs along the East Coast of South Africa, as well as right through the Rhino protection Sanctuary.

Nothing stops them from eliminating the now "military style" poachers;  INTERNATIONALLY!

Danny encounters a few tough decisions throughout, especially in meeting up with her past, face to face.

Will the corrupt, murderous savages be brought to justice timeously?  Can Danny and her team pull it off to save the last if the world's Rhino population? Or will the Big 5 of Africa become the Big 4?  Follow Danny on her quest for saving a species and you will see the truth and harsh reality of a Rhino poachers lust for Rhino Horn........... turn to dust!

story:
Short Summary

Todd Ryznar has taken adversity and bad luck and turned it on it’s head. When you’re at the bottom, the only place left to go is up. But bottom has it’s own timetable -- days become weeks, and summer soon turns to fall.  "Living The Dream, Asshole" is Todd’s story about kicking reality up it’s butt!  Take that!   Burdened with a cast on his foot and down to his last few smokes, he’s knows there’s something special in the telling of this story.  It’s not a normal situation, nor is this going to be a normal film.
This campaign will take us to the next step. There are time and costs to write the script, to work with actors, travel, to network with production companies to bring this idea to the people that can help get it made, and showcase it to the world. The dedication and commitment shows in what is done already, and any support will relieve some of our own personal costs to keep going. Indie means we want to control the creative content at this early stage…

 

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is $12,000 which will cover equipment rental, any  additional shooting, posters, graphic design, a story editor to help with the script and some overhead costs.  The key to a good movie is a good script -- the story has to be on the page and it has to be told well.  Writing is the most fundamental element of any movie regardless of the genre, and your support will contribute to a very unique first draft of a feature length script.

We will take every person’s name and have a draw for 3 people.  When the script is being written we will include these names, and they will appear in the movie in an inventive manner: perhaps your name will be stenciled on the beach ball Todd bonks Braydon on the head with!  Or Todd will sign your name on his cast…. Or it will be spelled out with whipping cream on the pumpkin pie… It will be a treasure hunt for your sweet enjoyment.

 

Experience

 

Todd Ryznar created and starred in "Fool's Gold" which ran 2 seasons on Discovery Canada, Animal Planet USA, A&E Australia and 20+ other countries including Sweden, Belgium and Italy.

IMBD Link - http://www.imdb.com/name/nm7595406/

http://www.tvguide.com/celebrities/todd-ryznar/...

http://www.hollywood.com/celebrities/todd-ryzna...

 

https://www.facebook.com/WolfPactFilms/?fref=ts

 

Most times what people are looking for in entertainment is determined by when they let their thumb off the remote.  Signing up for pay-per-view and scrolling through: “saw that, saw that, saw that…”  And then, finally -- that sweet satisfaction when you find something and say, I want to watch that. Or better yet, I want to watch that again!  This is what we strive for with this project.  We want to put our best into this film, and it is because of the stark truth about Todd’s life that we take this very seriously.  Todd’s story is a delicious dramatization of reality --  Oh, the irony of it!

Sweat equity that goes into a project is expected, mostly because if it’s not important enough for us to do it, why would we ask you to help. We have both brought everything we have to make the video to showcase our idea.  Over the course of a month Todd produced, performed and edited, and Patricia wrote, directed and filmed this trailer. It is an example of what we are capable of producing.  No big fancy production crew -- just two film people living in a small town who paid attention to the universe’s nudging us towards this project, and soon the artist in each of us recognized there is a reason for everything.  With an endless stream of data spilling into every device, being absorbed by brain cells that are dulled by mediocrity, we want something else of ourselves, and this project.  We know we can create something that finds a home with some of the best filmmaking ever made. 

 

Risks and Challenges


A producer friend said “Never make movies with people who haven’t made movies before.”  And that’s because getting a movie made takes a long time, and requires understanding the unique obstacles that come with making a movie. They continuously arise to test the commitment to the project, and the people in it. Although money is absolutely necessary -- what it doesn’t do is solve problems.  Money does relieve the burden of costs, but the workload remains the same. Movies are not made in isolation, and a partnership is tested many times in incredibly unpredictable ways. We have already learned how to work together,  and we are the solid foundation of this project. The tests have been many, and each challenge was met with grace and maturity.   
We also have two additions to our team. A well-established businessman is a joint owner of the bank account; Patricia wanted the reputation of this project be protected by an impartial third party.  Also, the Executive Director of the Atikokan Economic Development Corp. will sign invoices as defined by the budget, which in turn, releases the funds.  We know the road ahead has many more bumps and potholes, but these decisions pave the road for better travel towards Living The Dream… Asshole.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share our story which you can easily do using the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Short Summary

Hello, my name is Kiara Simmons, and I am a filmmaker currently in high school. I have been around film my entire life and started trying to create my own when I was around 10 years old. I began first with creating my own short films, then I started formulating ideas for feature films and series. This will be my first time bringing one of those ideas to life.

I am starting this campaign because although I have some actors, locations, and a few crew members, I still need more, and will have to pay for them, as well as feed and transport everyone. I would also like to have a showing of my movie at a local theater, if possible. This is extremely important to me, as it will help further my knowledge and experience in film, as well as further the knowledge and experience of the cast and crew.

Contributing to this campaign would not only further drive the careers, portfolios, and knowledge of a group of students but will also share a funny, relatable story with the world.

What We Need & What You Get

We need $20,000 to cover the costs of the production. This includes paying the cast and crew, feeding the cast and crew, locations, transportation, distribution, marketing, and the showing.

15% will go to locations
15% will go to food
5% will go to transportation
20% will go to distribution
15% will go to the actors
15% will go to the crew
10% will go to marketing
5% will go to the showing

Perks are available for donations as low as $15. The perks get better the more you donate, and range from an electronic copy of the movie to an invitation to the showing and executive producer credits!

If we do not reach our goal of $20,000, we will still create the best movie possible with the money we have, but we may not be able to have the showing (sad, I know)

The Impact

Contributing to this project will not only help a group of students further their knowledge, portfolios, and current or future careers, but it will also inspire and share happiness with others.

"Caught Up" is a comedy, as I wanted to share a story that would leave people happy and have them laughing after they watch it. I always want to spread happiness, and this is a platform in which I can do so.

Your contribution will also inspire other young filmmakers such as myself. Many teen filmmakers shy away from any kind of big project because the people in this industry do not take us seriously. If other young filmmakers can see the success of this project, they will take on their own, and the industry will begin to see more of the creativity, drive, and hard work of more teenage filmmakers.

.

Risks & Challenges

Because I am such a young filmmaker, as I mentioned earlier, I am not taken very seriously. I realized this and have made sure that I have a dedicated cast and crew who are just as excited for this project and are willing to put in just as much effort and time as I am. I also have a dedicated team behind me to make sure that everything runs smoothly.

As with any project, there are risks involved. One of those risks for us is if we don't raise much money at all. If this does happen, filming will have to be temporarily postponed, but we do have some backup fundraising methods and will use whatever money we can raise or use out-of-pocket to fund it.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute right now, don't worry. There are other ways you can help, such as:

  • sharing this campaign with others and encouraging them to donate
  • talking about the project with others and spreading the word on social media
  • sharing the casting call link and encouraging people to apply

Thank you so much for this opportunity, and I hope you will consider donating!
story_txt:
Short Summary
Hello, my name is Kiara Simmons, and I am a filmmaker currently in high school. I have been around film my entire life and started trying to create my own when I was around 10 years old. I began first with creating my own short films, then I started formulating ideas for feature films and series. This will be my first time bringing one of those ideas to life.
I am starting this campaign because although I have some actors, locations, and a few crew members, I still need more, and will have to pay for them, as well as feed and transport everyone. I would also like to have a showing of my movie at a local theater, if possible. This is extremely important to me, as it will help further my knowledge and experience in film, as well as further the knowledge and experience of the cast and crew.
Contributing to this campaign would not only further drive the careers, portfolios, and knowledge of a group of students but will also share a funny, relatable story with the world.

What We Need & What You Get
We need $20,000 to cover the costs of the production. This includes paying the cast and crew, feeding the cast and crew, locations, transportation, distribution, marketing, and the showing.

story:
Short Summary

This crowd-funding campaign is over now but we are still very grateful for any direct contributions you feel moved to offer.  We can offer the same perks of downloads of therapeutic Nature films as a thank you for contributions between £25-£100.   Please send any contributions by PayPal to bryonytree@googlemail.com.

We are two film-makers with over thirty years combined experience of filming and engaging deeply with Nature.  We have each felt Nature's healing power in significant ways, and we want to explore and share this phenomenon.  The film will engage with innovative people, projects and perspectives.  We will interview Health professionals, researchers, patients, traditional elders and creative artists from different cultures, exploring their experience, wisdom and understanding of Nature's role in the healing process.

We are exploring the scientific ground for creative, spiritual and everyday ways of connecting with Nature for healing benefits.  We will interweave interviews with scientists and artists with the voices of indigenous elders, to explore the points at which these worlds touch, and are similar.  We aim to inspire wider understanding, learning and to promote discussion about our connections, health and well-being. We want to inspire positive change in the educational and health related systems that support us. This film will provide a valuable resource of simple, cost-effective strategies and innovations for Health and Education, and more widely in society, for supporting people's healing.

Our skills, experiences and knowledge uniquely equip us to engage deeply with this topic.   The relationships we have already formed with some of the health and Nature specialists, and indigenous elders, we hope to interview, give the project a strong start.  We are drawing on Mark Minard' s seventeen years working with powerful Nature imagery and Bryony Roger's twelve years work in community documentary film-making.

 

Mark Minard (Director and Camera)

Mark has been creating and bringing specialist nature films into hospitals, prisons and school environments for seventeen years, with great positive effect.  These films are available on www.vimeo.com/markcameronminard and www.movingessence.net.  This work was nominated for  Nursing Times award in 2014.  He films in cinematic quality.

Mark also has extensive skill and experience in therapeutic arts and health including movement, sound and imagery and sensory awareness.  He has worked with community groups of diverse ages and abilities. He has worked and trained with many experienced practitioners and researchers in these fields in UK, New Zealand and USA.

Mark is also trained and has worked as a scientist, design engineer and teacher.

 

Bryony Rogers (Director and Producer)

Bryony trained at UCL and London Film-makers Co-op and worked in television research and production for several years.  She successfully ran Light Productions, a community and art film-making business, for six years, in Lancaster, UK.  This company produced twenty eight short documentary, fiction and dance films, and was awarded Film Council funding on three occasions.  Two of Bryony's personal films have been awarded prizes and commendation, at the VIVA Film Festival in London and the Vendome Film Festival.  She had to stop working because of ill health in 2006, but has started film-making again in recent years.  A couple of short documentaries she made recently are available on https://www.youtube.com/user/brightoceanstar

Bryony is also a singer, poet and song-writer and leader of song ceremonies, and some of this work is available on www.songofawakening.org.uk.  She has twenty years experience of healing practice and is trained to Reiki 2.  Her training combined with her recent years of health experiences have brought a depth of knowledge, insight and skill in the holistic approach.

 

These more holistic skills work together with our film skills to support our sensitivity in interviewing and filming people.  We are open to the subtleties of relationship between people and with Nature.  We can see this in the video in the filming of Maori Elder Eila Paul as she sings to the trees in the woods.  Eila is given space and time with which to express her experience of Nature responding to her, energetically, symbiotically, as she responds to it.  This enables the presence of this relationship and the power of Nature to be more readily experienced by the viewer.

 

Funding

We have already self-funded this project to the scale of £13,600 and started developing a significant number of the interview relationships.

To make this important film to the quality we envision, with cinematic standard images we need to raise an additional £52,000.  This money will enable the finished film to be shown in cinematic settings, and to large groups and sold to television.

 

We need money for:

Further research and development. 

Filming costs including equipment, transport, file storage

Editing to a high standard

Soundtrack composition

Insurance costs to cover use of expensive equipment

 

The Impact:


This project is valuable.  It will spread awareness of the healing power of nature and the powerful changes that can result from the introduction of simple nature connection.  The film will be a resource for developing innovation in Health and Education, and more widely in society. It will also have a personal impact on the viewer, created from the stunning imagery  and fascinating interviews. 

Other Ways You Can Help

All contributions and support are welcome.  Even if you can't contribute financially, you can still really help this important project.  Please SHARE this project with your families, friends and colleagues and with anyone who might be interested in getting involved.
You can use the Indiegogo share tools!!

story:
"The Southwests Answer to Game of Thrones" -
BBC Spotlight TV news: Feb 10th 2017

 

LINKS TO SEE MORE VIDEOS ABOUT THIS PROJECT:

Film trailer from production footage so far I Mordred OST soundtrack sampler I The cast get their first combat workshop I Poetry: The Battle of Camlann I Interview with the director I IMDb  I Production Facebook Page I Film page on the British Film Council Website I Mordred on BBC TV news

 

ABOUT MORDRED 

This is a challenging but energetic project, by people from across the South West of England, who share a deep love of Arthurian legend, the history of the Dark Ages, and the performing arts. We want to prove that local people are worthy of recognition and not to be just passed over!
This feature-length drama film brings to life an adaptation of many of the earlier, lesser known legends of Mordred, researched from some of the earliest sources in existence and folklore.
There is an amazing amount of international interest already in this film - press articles have not only appeared locally but also in LA and New York. The film team comprises of people ranging from complete beginners through to Mike Mitchell; an actor who has appeared in films such as Gladiator and Skyfall, all working together in an amazing, supportive team.
This film leads the pack in addressing male/female unbalance in film-making.

Despite being an action film, it is written and directed by Laura Jay, a woman with a decade of experience in directing historical drama. This film features a large number of strong female characters who are equal to the men. 

The trailer, which is now complete, has been shown on BBC regional TV news, and is also a semifinalist in the Los Angeles Cinefest and Indieboost film festivals, as well as having been screened in the Barcelona Film Festival. It has also led to our team being shortlisted (at the time of creating this crowdfund) for a national arts award (Epic Awards 2017 - #epicawards2017)

 

SYNOPSIS

" I am what you forced me to become!" snarls Mordred.

King Arthur has ruled Dumnonia, the south-west peninsula of Britain, after being chosen as the Pendragon. His rise to prominence is remarkable, having defeated the Saxon sea-wolves at the Battle of Badon Hill at the age of sixteen. His elder sister, Morgan, once the Arch-Druidess of Dumnonia, is consumed with jealousy and plots against the throne. Following the deaths of Arthur's first wife, Anna, and his baby son, she is banished from Dumnonia.

Many years later, a young nobleman is found, poisoned, on the moors. Brought to the fort town Isca by Arthur's warriors, he is revealed to be Mordred, illegitimate son of King Arthur. He too has fallen victim of Morgan's plots. As father and son slowly gain each other's trust, Mordred, who is well liked by most of Arthur's followers, is eventually chosen as Regent of Dumnonia. This is a timely appointment of power as Arthur once more engages in battle, defending his kingdom against the Saxon invasion.

Unfortunately, not all of Arthur's enemies are on the battlefield...

HOW YOUR HELP AFFECTS THE FILM & THOSE INVOLVED 

*"Mordred" is mainly filmed, but requires some extra scenes that could not be completed at the time due to budget, and weather conditions. These scenes are critical to the narrative of the film, and without which the film cannot be completed. 

* Your contributions allow us to gain access to a needed venue, cover costs of travel and food for cast and crew, without which the final scenes cannot be completed, and to assist with post production, editing costs - again if we cannot get the film edited then we cannot release the film that everyone has worked so hard on, and which so many lovely people have supported. 

FUNDS ARE BEING RAISED FOR

* Additional scene location hire : £1,000

* Travel / food/ sundries for cast and crew for additional scenes: £1,600

* Post production general prices (editing, CG) £1,200

So far we have raised £150 towards this budget, so now, need to work hard for the rest.

We have a variety of exciting perks lined up for our lovely supporters. Among them there should be perks available for all budgets and tastes, and for those who can visit locally, as well as those further afield - you can view the full list in the list to your right. 

In addition, all contributors will receive frequent news, images, and updates as to the progress of the project: before, during and after production. Contributors will also be invited to an exclusive team film premiere in South Devon when the film is complete. 

With regards to any equipment or props purchased, these are obviously for the film, but will be retained after the project finishes, and used to create future projects, showcases, and training-in-use for local people, so that donations will have long term positive help as well.  

MORE INFORMATION ON OUR TEAM

Would you like to meet the team and hear about them in their own words? Would you like to see links to where we have been featured in the press here in the UK, and also in New York and LA?  If so, pop over to our website.

Team social media - For more info on us:

www.southdevonplayers.com
Facebook & Twitter: @sdevonplayers
Instagram: sdevonplayers1
email sdevonplayers@gmail.com
Youtube: southdevonplayers

(MORE INFORMATION)

Risks & Challenges

Some people have already asked us some valid questions about 'Mordred'. The Arthurian legend has been dramatised on screen many times before – how are we different?

Yes, the Arthurian legend has been dramatised many times, in many versions. However, we feel that what we have is unique in our source material and in our angle on the story. Whilst other films have explored the legends from the point of view of Morgan La Fay, Merlin, and Lancelot, no films have ever been produced - to our knowledge - that centre on Mordred. We have found some novels which explore the legends from Mordred's point of view, but even these are very different to what we are doing.

Most dramatisations of Arthurian legend depict Mordred (or a Mordred-like character) as a malevolent, evil character. In these treatments, he appears already evil, clearly insane or simply power-crazed. We prefer to trust some of the earliest known legends which actually speak well of Mordred's character, and pose the question 'What if Arthur and Mordred, fallible human beings, were pitted against one another by circumstance?'

The actual challenges are much more mundane.

Time constraints

We are of course making this film around our own day-jobs, so we have to liaise together to find windows of opportunity, when we can all take the time off to make this film. Luckily the ethic of teamwork and unity of purpose is high in our team, and we work hard to make these arrangements happen. 

Equipment failure

Cameras, editing systems and external hard drives can all fail and cause serious issues. Once footage is filmed, it will be backed up to to two individual external drives

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to help us financially, we understand – times are not easy. But if you would like to help in a non-financial way, then please share this campaign with your friends. Do you have friends who love legends, history or Arthurian drama? Tell them about us, we really do appreciate it.  

You are encouraged use the Indiegogo share tools, or paste the web link. 

Contact us with any questions, and follow us for our news

www.southdevonplayers.com
Facebook & Twitter: @sdevonplayers
Instagram: sdevonplayers1
email sdevonplayers@gmail.com / TEL & SMS: 07855 090589
Youtube: southdevonplayers

story:
My name is James H. Stevens. I am 58.   -AKA.420JIM

In 2013 in Farmington NM I was set up, and charged with two counts of Marijuana.

I wanted to take it all the way to a jury trail. The State needed to prove what narcotic is in marijuana.  Instead of facing me in a trail the State found me Incompetent

 to  stand trail and dropped the case. This to me is like calling me crazy!

So on March 1st of 2014 I ventured with my RV, and my dog and hit the road to show them just how crazy I was.

Over the last three years have traveled to 30 States.  Educating and also learning about the Cannabis/Hemp {AKA Marijuana plant} I held the first cannabis event ever done at Mount Rushmore in 2015. I held a pro--cannabis march in DC in 2016.

Also in 2016 I was invited to the 34th Vietnam veterans reunion near Kokomo IN. A whole lot of the vets asked for me to fight for them here in 2017 as well. I have two events to attend this year for the vets. in June, and one in Sept.

It is my greatest wish to make a documentary about my travels. I have so many story's to tell.

This day and age anyone that says cannabis/Hemp is bad is either uneducated or a liar!

The Cannabis /Hemp herb can Heal, Fuel, Feed. Etc.

In the 1930s a lie was started by W.R.Herst he named the Cannabis /Hemp plant Marijuana to scare the U.S.A. for self gain.

I can not stand the fact that states sell a medical card for a class 1 narcotic.

I cant stand ripping off people making them buy a card! We do not sell a card for any kind of drug!  

It is time to end the lies on Cannabis/Hemp.  I need your donations to help pay for the documentary. The funds will go to traveling and filming in 5 States, as well as the actors, and crew that is helping, and filming the story.

The story will also have a hole lot more that I don't want to giveaway right now. {Alcohol, Drugs, 2 Murders. foster care and  much more.  

Some might say what gives you the right to ask for help (what have you done }  In 2014 I sold everything I had but the dog and RV. I made up $5,000 and hit the road. In 2015 I took a job on the road at a flying J truck stop worked 93 days in a row {no days off}, made $3,000 put it into the mission and in 2016, I worked for three months at Budds Creek motocross in MD. There I made $3,000 and put that in also. I have talked to tens of thousands of people, while doing petitions, and so on for over three years. So to sum it up, I have invested over $10,000 cash out of pocket, and three years of my life fighting for ALL of us in the U.S.A.

 

You can also see more on my web-site www.420jim.com and I am also on facebook as Jack H. Apoo

If the goal is not reached the money will go into the mission to make it legal for all.

Thank You.   PEACE,LOVE.CANNABIS FOR ALL.

My name is James H. Stevens. I am 58.   -AKA.420JIM
In 2013 in Farmington NM I was set up, and charged with two counts of Marijuana.
I wanted to take it all the way to a jury trail. The State needed to prove what narcotic is in marijuana.  Instead of facing me in a trail the State found me Incompetent
 to  stand trail and dropped the case. This to me is like calling me crazy!
So on March 1st of 2014 I ventured with my RV, and my dog and hit the road to show them just how crazy I was.
Over the last three years have traveled to 30 States.  Educating and also learning about the Cannabis/Hemp {AKA Marijuana plant} I held the first cannabis event ever done at Mount Rushmore in 2015. I held a pro--cannabis march in DC in 2016.
Also in 2016 I was invited to the 34th Vietnam veterans reunion near Kokomo IN. A whole lot of the vets asked for me to fight for them here in 2017 as well. I have two events to attend this year for the vets. in June, and one in Sept.
It is my greatest wish to make a documentary about my travels. I have so many story's to tell.
This day and age anyone that says cannabis/Hemp is bad is either uneducated or a liar!
The Cannabis /Hemp herb can Heal, Fuel, Feed. Etc.
In the 1930s a lie was started by W.R.Herst he named the Cannabis /Hemp plant Marijuana to scare the U.S.A. for self gain.
I can not stand the fact that states sell a medical card for a class 1 narcotic.
I cant stand ripping off people making them buy a card! We do not sell a card for any kind of drug!  
It is time to end the lies on Cannabis/Hemp.  I need your donations to help pay for the documentary. The funds will go to traveling and filming in 5 States, as well as the actors, and crew that is helping, and filming the story.
